loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming rice for two years and earns additional income from gardening vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Langcheng

texts.en:
Langcheng is 27 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than four years, earning about $4 per day. Her husband is a mechanic who makes $5 each day.

 In order to improve her family’s finances, Langcheng is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase spare parts for her husband to fix and resell to his clients. This purchase will help him earn more income for the family. 

In the future, Langcheng would like to run an additional business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her husband to fix and resell to his clients

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business, as she was able to buy the needed products (e.g., clothing and cosmetics) for her direct selling business. In addition to that business, she also has a variety store. She sells slippers for additional income. She is already a widow, and she works hard to provide for her everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of 50,000 PHP. She will use most of it to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her current inventory at the store. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. She will use another part of the loan money to buy products for her direct selling business, and slippers to sell. Her profits from business will definitely help her to support herself. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita dreams of expanding her business and having more stalls. She hopes for strength and good health to continue working. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy products for the inventories of her several businesses

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old, married, and lives in Amulung with her husband and children. Gina and her husband manage a farming business where they plant and harvest rice twice a year. They gain just enough funds to sustain the educational needs and daily meals for the family. 

Gina wanted to increase her crop production, that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy rice seeds and fertilizers used in farming. These farm inputs will help maintain good growth and nutrition of her rice crops for an abundant harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers used in farming.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gemalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell dried fish business. Gemalyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Gemalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her business.

Magdalena has been in this business for five years. Magdalena earns additional income from food vending.

Magdalena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en: Munkhtsetseg is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in old house on plot of land. She and her husband have been selling beef to local people by renting a stall at the outdoor market. Her two daughters both go to high school. The house they live in has been deteriorating for years so she decided to renovate and build an extension to her house. For this project, she is requesting a loan of 5000000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks and fiberglass as well as vacuum insulated windows and hardwood flooring. Using those materials, she and her husband will renovate and build an extension to their house before winter. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into atmosphere. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man is 62 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling porridge and Khmer noodles for more than four years, earning approximately $4 per day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $4 each day.

Due to a lack of funds, Man is requesting a loan of $500. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials to build her house. This money will help her obtain a convenient place for her family to live. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house

loans.name: Samey

texts.en:
Samey is 34 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $6 each day.

Due to a lack of funds, Samey is requesting a loan of $800. She will use it to purchase timber and zinc, with which to build a new house. This purchase will help her obtain a convenient place for her family to live. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop of her own and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Layhieng

texts.en: Layhieng is 50 years old, married and lives with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling pure drinking water for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $14 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Layhieng is requesting a loan for $1,000 to buy a camera to run a photography service. This will allow her to generate more income for her family. In the future, she would like to build a new house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy a camera to run a photography service

loans.name: Munkhchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhchimeg, 37 years old, lives with her father and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. Her father has retired from work and gets a state pension. She has been renting out eight rooms to local people. Her 9-year-old daughter goes to elementary school. 

She is requesting a loan of MNT 4,000,000 to purchase a low-pressure heater and roof shingles.  Last spring heavy rain damaged the house roof, so she and her husband will repair the roof using the shingles.  They will also install a low-pressure heater. As a result, they will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into atmosphere. Burning of coal is the main source of air pollution in Mongolia.

loans.use: to purchase a low-pressure heater and shingles to repair her roof.

loans.name: Oseas

texts.en:
Oseas  is from the village of Lintugop, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 62 years old, married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Oseas owns and operates a service-based business providing a passenger pump boat in the local community. Oseas has been engaged in his business for eight years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2009, Oseas joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC, which he used to improve his business. Oseas is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his boat machine. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his boat machine

loans.name: Mosmira

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mosmira works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling pre-paid mobile load cards. Mosmira is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods to sell for business.

Mosmira has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell

loans.name: Glyrose

texts.en:
Glyrose is 21 years old and single.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Glyrose is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Glyrose has been pig-fattening for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cervella

texts.en: Cervella is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells ginger in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell. Cervella has been in this business for two years and earns additional income by running a general store. She has sustained her business through hard work and help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from rice retailing. Judith is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 49 years old and married with five children.

Elma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, spices, milk and coffee.

Elma has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns income from rice retailing.

Elma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, spices, milk and coffee.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José Elías tiene 49 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos  cuyas edades comprenden entre 29, 27, 20 años y los tres solo han cursado hasta el quinto año de secundaria ya que Jose no ha tenido muchos ingresos económicos y nos les ha podido dar los estudios que ellos hubieran querido, asimismo Jose solo ha estudiado hasta el quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar “Mecánica Automotriz”, el plato favorito de Jose son lo “Tallarines con Papa a la Huancaína”, es un platillo a base de fideos cocidos a los cuales se les añade una salsa a base de tomate y se acompaña con papa sancochada las cuales llevan una salsa a base de queso fresco, ají amarillo, pan.

Jose se dedica en la actualidad a su negocio de mototaxi, en la cual realiza transporte de pasajeros por las calles de su ciudad, Jose se le dedica a su trabajo mucho esfuerzo, labora alrededor de 12 horas diarias y atiende alrededor de 80 clientes,  Jose nos dice que para él cada día es muy bueno porque puede regresar a su casa con dinero para los gastos del hogar, lo cual le brinda un poco de tranquilidad al terminar el día. El cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene mucha Fe en Dios y que Dios es el que guía sus pasos por eso siempre tiene algo que llevar a su hogar  y porque es honesto, honrado y respeta a sus clientes.

Actualmente está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que es la Tercera vez que le brindan su apoyo y gracias ello podrá mejorar su vehículo de trabajo que es la mototaxti comprando llantas nuevas y cambio de asientos para la mototaxi, con esta mejora podrá brindarle más comodidad a sus clientes así obtendrá más ingresos y podrá ahorrar para poder cumplir su sueño: “Comprarse un auto”.
texts.en:
José Elías is 49 years old, has three children who range in age from 29, 27, and 20 years old. The three of them have all completed only up to their fifth year of middle school, since José hasn't had many economic resources and he hasn't been able to pay for their studies as they would have liked. José himself has only studied up to the fifth year of middle school, but he would have liked very much to study “Automotive Mechanics”. José's favorite dish is called “Huancaína noodles with potatoes”, which is a dish that consists of a base of beans to which have been added a tomato sauce and is accompanied by parboiled potatoes with cheese sauce, yellow chilies, and bread.

José is a mototaxi driver, and he transports passengers through the streets of his city. José puts forth a lot of effort into his job as he works about 12 hours every day and attends about 80 customers. José tells us that every day is a good day because he is able to return home with money for household costs, which gives him a little peace at the end of the day. He believes that his business is going well because he has a lot of faith in God and that God guides him, and for this reason he always has something to take home because he is honest, honorable and respects his customers.

José is actually very grateful for Kiva loans, as this is the third time that they have given him their support and with it he will be able to make improvements on his work vehicle, which is a mototaxi. He will buy new tires and change the seats, and with this improvement he will be able to improve his customers' comfort and thus obtain higher earnings. He hopes to be able to save enough to accomplish his dream: “To buy a car”.

loans.use: to pay for tires, repairs, and vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been growing rice for five years, and she earns additional income by fattening pigs.

Marife is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice crop

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en: Alfreda is married with an only child. She lives in Sagrada, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, along with her family. Her husband is a farmer and is their main source of income, while Alfreda manages their piggery to earn a living. She borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to renovate her livestock's shelter. She hopes to gain more income and save a portion of her generated income as a reserve fund of the family.

loans.use: to renovate her livestock's shelter

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Apple

texts.en:
Apple, 32 years of age, is married to a carpenter and they are blessed with two children. She manages a food-vending business where she sells snacks every afternoon. With this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 120 per day. 

She's asking for a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase food ingredients and raw meat to use in her business. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow, so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients and raw meat to use in her business.

loans.name: Norlinda

texts.en:
Norlinda is 35 years old and married. She has one child. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years, and she earns additional income from fish vending.

She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional items to sell, like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, and shampoo. Norlinda has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF, before this loan.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell at her store, like milk, canned goods, eggs and soap

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Bebelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming and selling vegetables. Bebelyn is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy additional fruits to sell for her buy and sell banana business.

Through her past 26 loans from NWTF Bebelyn has been sustaining her business activities. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon is a 49-year-old farmer from Goris. He has been involved in beekeeping for 15 years and currently he keeps 20 beehives. Levon gets high-quality honey which is very much in demand among the locals. The income from selling honey helps Levon to sustain his family's living. He lives with his wife and two school-age children.

Now, for increasing the number of beehives, Levon needs financial support. So, by applying for this loan, he asks for a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase 15 colonies of bees. The loan will greatly assist Levon in getting more honey and increasing his income. 

Levon hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 15 colonies of bees.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, 50 years of age, is married and they are blessed with three children. For almost 20 years, she has managed a vegetable production business in their village. With this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 200 a day. 

Due to insufficient funds, she's requesting a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seedlings. She hopes that her business will become more profitable, so that she will continue availing herself of loans to further improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seedlings.

loans.name: Noemi Abigail

texts.es:
Noemi es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola, con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Noemi está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar enseres para su domicilio, con lo cual podrá ir mejorando su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Noemi is a woman who has a great desire to get ahead, and this is why she works as a laborer on an agricultural farm. With her earnings she is able to pay for household costs. She believes that she does well at work because she is responsible. 

Noemi is very grateful for Kiva loans since, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy household goods, with which she will be able to continue improving her quality of life and continue fighting to make her dream come true: “To have her own business.”

loans.use: to buy household goods.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari appreciates the previous loan that supported his retail shop and enabled him to open a cloth selling business. He sells khangas (women's wrap clothing) besides the business he is doing.

With the loan he is requesting of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase to bales of khangas for resale. He joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (women's wrap clothing) for resale.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 44 años de edad, acompañado y con dos hijos.  Posee mucha experiencia en la actividades  que realiza (cultivo de maíz, crianza de ganado de repasto y venta frutas mango,papaya y tamaritano.) ya que toda su vida se ha dedicado a dichas actividad el cual manifestó que la aprendió de sus padres y lo sigue haciendo hoy por su propia cuenta junto a su compañera de vida con el cual ya tiene 6 años de estar juntos.

Él  viaja unos 1.3 kilómetros  a pie hasta donde toma un autobús o pick up  en el que se tarda unos 25 minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad, en donde compra los insumos para su cultivo de maíz (fertilizante, semilla, pesticidas ) luego 2 veces por semana viaja hasta otra ciudad donde vende el tamarindo que compra en la comunidades.

El crédito sera utilizado en la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas, unos terneros y seguir comercializando mango y tamarindo, también cubrirá otros gastos de su familia.

Gracias al préstamo podrá darle un mejor beneficio a sus cultivos  y podrá invertir mas en la compra  de mango y los tamarindos de los cuales espera vender y  mejorar los ingresos económicos para su familia y saldar su deuda.

Su propósito es construir una vivienda digna donde pueda vivir con sus 2 hijos y su compañera de vida, también espera que Dios le de vida para darles un estudio a sus  hijos y lograr sus metas proyectada.
texts.en:
José, 44, is married and has two children.  He has a lot of experience in the jobs he does (growing corn, raising grazing cattle, and selling mango, papaya, and tamarind).  He has worked his whole life in these jobs, which he learned from his parents and continues doing today on his own with his life partner.  They've been together for six years.

He travels some 1.3 kilometers on foot to take a bus or pick-up truck for 25 minutes to get to the city where he buys the supplies to grow corn (fertilizer, seed, pesticide).  Then, twice a week he goes to another city where he sells the tamarind he buys in the communities.

He'll use the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and some calves, as well as to continue selling mango and tamarind.  He'll also cover other family expenses.

Thanks to the loan his crops will benefit and he'll invest more in buying mango and tamarind.  He hopes to sell the fruit to improve his family's income and pay off his debt.

His goal is to build a decent home where he can live with his two children and his life partner.  He also hopes that God gives him life so he can give his children an education and achieve the objectives he has planned.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and calves

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 58-year-old widow and mother of seven children who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her eldest son is a retailer who owns a general store in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. In his shop he sells a variety of products and prefers to stock the best quality of products. The income he generates is insufficient to fulfill his family needs and to pay for all of the bills. He is currently interested in adding more variety to his general store which will help him increase both his net income and savings; due to the lack of income though he finds this difficult. 

Safia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her son purchase a variety of products to resell in the market at a profitable price. He will purchase biscuits, sugar, salt and cooking oil. Safia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products to sell.

loans.name: Bat-Ireedui

texts.en: Mr. Bat-Ireedui, 44 years old, lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working in security at a private business company. Before this job, he had worked at a military base and two years ago retired from work. His wife is an operator at the same military unit. His younger son also joined military training and will work in the military profession in the future. Mr. Bat-Ireedui has recently purchased land and wants to fence it. He is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to purchase planks for the fence. On his land he will breed his cattle and plant vegetables. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase planks in order to fence his land

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Para María Eugenia, es muy difícil dejar a sus hijas adolecentes solas en casa cuando se va a su trabajo de mesera en un restaurante, ella es madre soltera no tiene quien le apoye, y el barrio donde habita no es muy seguro ya que hay presencia de delincuentes constantemente. Por este motivo solicita el crédito que le permita comprar materiales de construcción como bloques, cemento, arena, hierro,  piedrín;  para hacer el muro trasero de su casa. Con esta obra terminada María Eugenia se sentirá más segura dejar a sus hijas.
texts.en:
It is difficult for María Eugenia to leave her two adolescent daughters alone at home while she is at her job as a waitress in a restaurant.  She is a single mother and does not receive support.  The neighborhood where she lives is not very safe since there is a constant presence of crime.  

For this reason, María Eugenia is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand, iron, and stone for building a wall at the back of her house.  Once the work is completed, María Eugenia will feel much better about leaving her daughters.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, iron, and stone for building a wall.

loans.name: José Danilo

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 33 años de edad, ha procreado un hijo de 7 años de edad. Él  es originario de la ciudad; pero por problemas de seguridad se vio obligado a emigrar junto con su familia a otro lugar y construyeron sus casas en el espacio que ocupaba antes la carretera panamericana . Por limitaciones familiares y económicas solo estudio hasta 4 grado de básica y vive solo con su hijo de 7 años; ya que su compañera de vida los abandono y se fue de la casa con otro hombre. La mamá de José,  vive a la par de su casa y le ayuda con su hijo y algunos quehaceres de la casa; mientras él trabajaba en actividades agrícolas, ya sean propias o como jorna, ya que son las principales actividades economías de la zona. Siembra de granos básicos (maíz), trabaja con su hermano en una propiedad que embargo el banco del estado y queda sin uso y la gente de la zona realizan sus cultivos de subsistencia en ese terreno que esta a 0.5 km. Los insumos agrícolas los compra en la ciudad  teniendo que viajar en autobús a unos 10 km hasta la cuidad y luego acarrearlos en la espalda hasta los lugares de cultivo o en construcciones como ayudante de albañil. Su hijo asiste a la escuela de la comunidad en la jornada matutina a 1 grado de básica.            


El préstamo sera utilizado para la compra de insumos agrícolas ( herbicidas y fertilizantes ) para la siembra de 0.4 Ha de maíz. Con el propósito de disponer del grano para la alimentación de su familia y vender  una parte a las vendedoras de tortilla  de la comunidad y así pagar la deuda del préstamo.   

José, espera con el préstamo cosechar suficiente grano para el consumo de su familia y vender el excedente de la cosecha para pagar el préstamo solicitado. Sueña con que su hijo estudie una carrera profesional y algún día liberarse de los compromisos que posee. Él mantiene un préstamo en otra institución que deberá cancelar dentro de dos meses. Espera ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida e ir comprando algunos muebles; debido a solo posee lo básico para vivir y no tiene energía eléctrica y quizá sea lo mas urgente de instalar.
texts.en: José is a 33-year-old man who has a 7 year-old-son.  He was born and bred in San Miguel but, security problems forced him to move with his family to a different place. They built their houses there in a space previously occupied by the Pan-American Highway.  For family and financial reasons he had only 4 years of primary education and now lives alone with his 7-year-old son as his partner left him for another man.  José's mother lives close by and helps him with his son and does some of the housework while he does agricultural work (for himself or as a day worker) or works as builder's assistant because they are the main economic activities in the region. He works with his brother growing basic grains (corn) on a plot of land which was left unused after the state bank repossessed it.  Now the locals grow subsistence crops on the land which is 0.5 km away.  José buys his agricultural supplies in the city, which is a 10km bus-ride away, and then carries them on his back to the plot.   His son goes to the local school each morning and is in the first year of primary education.   The loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies (weed-killer and fertiliser) to sow 0.4 hectares of corn.  The aim is to use the corn to feed his family and to sell some to local tortilla sellers and thereby pay of the loan.  José hopes that the loan will enable him to produce enough grain for his family's consumption and to sell the rest to pay off the loan he has applied for.  His ambition is to see his son study for a professional career and to eventually free himself of his current commitments.  He has an existing loan from another institution which has to be repaid within two months.  He hopes to improve his living conditions and buy some furniture, as he currently only has the bare necessities.  Additionally, he does not have electricity and so having this installed is, perhaps, his most pressing need.

loans.use: to buy weed-killer and fertiliser to sow 0.4 hectares of corn.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 38 years old and married to a farmer. Together, she and her husband manage a hectare plot of land. They plant and harvest rice to sell. Gina wanted to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming, but she had insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP. She hopes to keep improving the growth of her rice crops to attain a profitable harvest and uplift her family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Joefiel

texts.en: Joefiel is single with two children. He lives in Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He operates a service-based business providing motorcycle transport to make a living. In 2011, he joined Gata Daku MPC and successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used in his business. He borrowed a new loan of 5,000 PHP to repair his existing motor. He wants to improve the general living situation of his family in the future.

loans.use: to repair his existing motor

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: Aziza is married and has one child who is still underage and does not go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She operates a business selling cashew nuts in the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to buy seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Leslie Angelica

texts.es:
Leslie es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, que tiene un gran deseo de superación.
Por iniciativa propia, Leslie trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola, adicionalmente cría codornices y vende sus huevos, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación.
Leslie se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará materiales para construir una jaula para sus codornices, de esta manera ella seguirá criando estas aves y venderá sus huevos, así pues Leslie seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad.
texts.en:
Leslie, 19, is a single young woman living in the city of Cañete, Imperial District, with her parents and siblings.  She’s a very kind, hardworking person who very much wants to improve.

On her own initiative, Leslie works as a laborer on a large agricultural estate and in addition raises quail and sells their eggs.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she’s doing well because of her dedication.

Leslie’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy the building supplies to build a cage for her quail so that she can continue raising these birds and selling their eggs.  Leslie will thus continue working and striving towards reaching her great dream of being able to study an Accounting career.

loans.use: to build a cage.

loans.name: Hilario Felix

texts.es:
Hilario es un hombre de 39 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz,en el distrito de Carhuaz, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y  por la necesidad de trabajar, Hilario no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica.
Por iniciativa propia, Hilario trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de cubrecamas y mantas, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por los buenos precios que ofrece a sus clientes.
Hilario se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Hilario’s a 39-year-old single man living in the city of Huaraz, Carhuaz District.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, because of the lack of economic resources and because he needed to work, Hilario was unable to study the professional career of Mechanical Engineering.

On his own initiative, Hilario works in a small business selling bedspreads and blankets.  He works about 10 hours every day and he believes he does well because of his dedication and because of the good prices he offers his customers.

Hilario is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided he will buy larger amounts and assortment of merchandise to continue working and striving towards reaching his great dream of having a sales stand of his own.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Victor Cesar

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero,vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo desde muy joven de trabajar, Victor no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios.
Por iniciativa propia, Victor trabaja como albañil, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Victor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva,ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará herramientas para su trabajo, como cubos martillos, maderas y otros, así pues Victor seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Víctor, 23, is a single man living in the city of Nazca with his parents and siblings.  He’s a very hardworking person who focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, because of the lack of economic resources and the need to start working very young, Víctor was unable to complete secondary school.

On his own initiative, Víctor works in construction.  He works about 12 hours daily and believes he does well because of his dedication and the courteous way he treats others.

Víctor is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will buy work tools like buckets, hammers, lumber and others so Víctor can continue working and striving towards reaching his greatest dream of having a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Marcial Mercedes

texts.es:
Marcial es un hombre de 51 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, en el distrito de Carhuaz, el es una persona muy trabajador, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Marcial no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Marcial trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de billeteras, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios que ofrece a sus clientes,
Marcial se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería para abastecer su negocio, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vida tranquila y apacible.
texts.en:
Marcial is a 51-year-old man. He is single and lives in the city of Huaraz, in Carhuaz district. He is a very hard worker, who dedicates all of his effort to getting ahead. Unfortunately, due to lacking financial resources and because he needed to work, Marcial wasn't able to pursue a higher education. 

On his own initiative, Marcial set up a small business selling wallets. He works every day for approximately ten hours and believes the reason why things are going well for him is because he offers his customers good prices.

Marcial is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since the help offered him will allow him to buy larger quantities and a wider variety of merchandise to stock his business. He will keep working and striving to achieve his big dream, which is to live a quiet and peaceful life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Homidjon

texts.ru: Хомидчон 43-летний житель района Спитамен. Он женат и имеет троих сыновей. Жена Хомидчона работает преподавателем в университете. Старший сын тоже работает, а двое других сыновей еще учатся. Хомиджон работает мастером-строителем, его работа является сезонной.  Хомидчон просит выдать кредит для открытия бизнеса "Откорм-продажа скота". На сумму кредита он намерен купить 2 голов крупнорогатого скота и корм. Он будет содержать скот у себя во дворе в коровнике. По словам Хомидчона продолжительность откорма скота будет составлять 60 дней. Хомидчон будет продавать скот на скотном рынке района, который находится недалеко от его дома. Таким образом, у него не будут транспортные расходы при реализации скота. Данный бизнес будет приносить Хомиджону стабильный доход, что позволит ему улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Homidjon is a 43 year-old resident of the Spitamen district.  He is married and has three sons.  Homidjon's wife works as a teacher at a university.  His oldest son also works, and two other sons still study.  Homidjon works as a construction worker, and his work is seasonal.  Homidjon is requesting this loan to open a business of fattening up and reselling livestock.  He intends to buy two heads of cattle and livestock feed with the loan amount.  He will keep livestock in a cowshed at his yard.  According to Homidjon's words, he will be fattening up livestock for 60 days.  Homidjon will sell livestock at a livestock market in his district, located near his house.  This way he will not have any transportation expenses selling livestock.  This business will yield Homidjon a stable income, which will allow him to improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy two heads of cattle and livestock feed

loans.name: Jose Bernardo

texts.es:
José, está acompañado y disfruta de tres hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 7, 11 y 15 años. El, se dedica a la agricultura, cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz y frijol, también a la crianza de ganado, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 35 años, lo desempeña todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, hasta la fecha no presenta ninguna dificultad. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los materiales agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir los insumos agrícolas para obtener una buena cosecha.
Su sueño es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jose is married and has three children, ages 7, 11, and 15.  He is a farmer who raises basic grains such as corn and beans and also raises livestock and has done so for 35 years.  He works every day from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm and has not had any problems to date.

He needs this loan to buy farming supplies such as compost, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, and other things that will help his have a good harvest.

His dream is to be able to support his children with their studies and make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Maria Ignacia

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera, vive con su hija y su yerno, también sus nietas de 10 y 17 años de edad. Ella, se dedica a la elaboración, venta de pupusas y antojitos, dicha actividad la aprendió desde hace mucho tiempo atrás y lo realiza todos los días por las tardes.
El préstamo le permitirá comprar   una plancha, ya que la que posee está deteriorada  y asimismo adquirirá papas, yuca, condimentos, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su negocio de buena manera. Uno de sus riesgos es en el invierno cuando llueve por las tardes por lo que el negocio lo realiza en ese tiempo.
Su sueño es lograr tener un local propio para poder desarrollar su negocio de una manera mejor.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother who lives with her daughter, son in law, and granddaughters, ages 10 and 17.  She makes and sells pupusas and snacks.  She learned this a long time ago and does this every evening.

This loan will allow her to buy a griddle because the one she has is deteriorated.  She will also buy potatoes, yucca, condiments, and other things.  This will help her improve her business.  One of the risks is the winter, when it rains in the evenings because this is when she works.

Her dream is to have her own restaurant where she can develop her business in a better way.

loans.use: to buy a griddle and ingredients.

loans.name: Jonatann Jesus

texts.es:
Jonatann es un hombre de 26 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Jonatann pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de computación e informática.
Por iniciativa propia, Jonatann trabaja en una universidad brindando servicios técnicos, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño.
Jonatann se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara su vivienda, el desea tarrajear, pintar y poner piso a la habitación de sus hijos, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su negocio de reparación de computadoras.
texts.en:
Jonatann, 26, is a man living in the city of Chincha with his wife and little boy.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  Thanks to his efforts, Jonatann was able to study the technical Computer Programming career.

On his own initiative, Jonatann works at a university providing technical services.  He works about 10 hours daily and believes he does well because of the good work he does.

Jonatann is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to improve his home.  He wants to plaster, paint and install flooring in his children’s bedroom.  He will continue working and striving towards reaching his greatest dream of owning a computer repair business.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Eloisa Filomena

texts.es:
Eloisa es una mujer de 68 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, en el distrito de Carhuaz, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante;lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Eloisa no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Eloisa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buenos precios.
Eloisa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir, los cuales le servirán de mucho para atender a mas clientes y así tendrá un poco mas de ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Eloisa, 68, is a woman living in the city of Huaraz, Carhuaz District.  She’s a very kind, hardworking person who focuses all her efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, because of the lack of economic resources and because she had to start working very young, Eloisa was unable to study a professional career.

On her own initiative, Eloisa works in a small clothing sales business.  She works for about 8 hours every day and believes she does well because of her dedication and her good prices.

Eloisa is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will buy larger amounts and variety of clothing which will be of use to her to better serve her customers and she will be able to earn a bit more income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es: El señor  Hermogenes, es una persona de 61 años de edad, de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria vive en su propia casa en la comunidad de Tiraque, la actividad principal a que se dedica el señor  Hermogenes es la agricultura  de tal forma produce  los siguientes productos en promedio anual y en las cantidades siguientes: Papa 45 cargas, Oca 30 cargas, Papa liza 25 cargas. La siembra de estos cultivos lo realiza en sus propios terrenos en una superficie de 3 Hectáreas, por otro lado el señor  Hermogenes  en época de  siembra y cosecha lo realizan con la colaboración de trabajadores eventuales a los que les cancela el jornal trabajado a Bs. 50.  Vive en una casa rustica de adobe, con este préstamo comprara una yunta, esta yunta le permitirá trabajar para el arado y le generara ingresos que mejoraran su calidad de vida y la de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Hermogenes is 61 years old, married, has an elementary school education, and lives in the community of Tiraque.  His main activity is farming and he raises the following products in the following annual average amounts: 45 bushels of potatoes, 30 bushels of Ocra, 25 bushels of smooth potatoes.  He grows them on 3 hectares of his own farmland.  During the harvest season he does the work with help from workers to whom he pays Bs. 50.  He lives in a rustic adobe home.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a yoke that will allow him to work and generate income that will improve his quality of life and that of his dependents.

loans.use: to buy a yoke.

loans.name: Rosana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosana es una mujer de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pequeño hijo, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Rosana no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería.
Por iniciativa propia, Rosana trabaja como secretaria en un servicentro de su ciudad, adicionalmente vende productos de belleza, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación.
Rosana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará materiales para avanzar con la construcción de su vivienda, así pues Rosana seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada y segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosana is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Pisco with her young son. She is a very friendly, hardworking person who dedicates all of her efforts to getting ahead with her son. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need for her to work, Rosana was not able to study nursing.

By her own initiative, Rosana works as a secretary at a gas station in her town. She also sells beauty products. She works every day for approximately 10 hours, and she feels that it is going well due to her dedication.

Rosana is very thankful for Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, she will be able to purchase materials to continue constructing her home. Rosana will continue working and making the effort to achieve her dream of having an suitable and secure home for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Silvia Isabel

texts.es:
Silvia, es una persona trabajadora y está casada, tiene 48 años de edad y su esposo tienen 45 años de edad, disfruta de un hijo el cual estudia bachillerato. Ella, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace diez años junto con su esposo, lo desempeña todos los días.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar pollos, concentrado, vitaminas, granja. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es fortalecer más el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is a hardworking woman.  She’s 48 years old, married, and her husband is 45.  She has a bachelor’s degree and has been raising chickens every day for ten years alongside her husband.  She needs this loan to buy chickens, feed, and vitamins for the farm.  This will help her increase her inventory and income.

Her dream is to strengthen her business and provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Blanca tiene 32 años de edad es casada y de ella y su esposo dependen 6 hijos los cuales están en diferentes grados de educación en la escuela de la comunidad. Ella es agricultora y ama de casa dedicándose a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol hace ya varios años la cual aprendió gracias a sus padres desde muy temprana edad. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo el cual pudo terminar a pesar de las dificultades económicas que sus padres vivieron para que ella pudiese culminar. El terreno que cultivan es propio y se trasladan diariamente a pie o en vestía para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos ya que la distancia la cual está ubicado está cerca aproximadamente a 10 minutos.

Sus planes a corto plazo es intensificar sus áreas de cultivo fortalecerlas y trabajarlas de manera que sean productivas en todo tiempo dando apoyo y mantenimiento para hacer fértiles las tierras ya que sus hijos y sus estudios como también otras necesidades dependen de este rubro. Es por ello que Doña Blanca ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara 40 libras de maíz certificado para su posterior siembra, 30 libras de frijol certificado, 15 QQ de fórmula 18-46-00 y 15 QQ de urea para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos como a los que posteriormente sembrara.
texts.en:
Blanca is 32 years old, married, and has six children in different grades at the local school.  She is a housewife and farmer who has been raising basic grains such as corn and beans for several years.  She learned this from her parents at an early age.  She completed elementary school and was able to finish despite financial difficulties that her parents had.  The land they farm on is their own and they walk or ride an animal there every day to maintain their crops; it’s only about 10 minutes away.

Her short term plans are to increase her farming area and work them in a manner that is productive at all times, and keep her land fertile and productive, because her children depend on this trade.

Blanca is asking for this loan through the COMIXMUL co-op so she can buy 40 pounds of corn and 30 pounds of beans to plant, 15 QQ of 18-46-00 fertilizer, and 15 QQ of urea to maintain her present and future crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilú, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija, vive en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio  con la venta de cosméticos. Hace tres años inicio la actividad de cría y engorde de cerdos para la venta. Ella los vende en su casa. Actualmente solicita un préstamo de 5,000 Lempiras para comprar más cerdos, los engorda y los vende. Con esta inversión espera mejorar los ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar. Su plan de realizar esta actividad es para poder ayudar a su hija con los estudios y también mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Marilu is 33 years old and is a single mother.  She has a daughter and they live in Esparta, Atlantida.  She has always sold cosmetics and started raising pigs for sale three years ago.  She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Lempiras in order to buy more pigs.  She hopes to be able to increase her income to support her family.  Her plan is to be able to help her daughter with her studies and also make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Victoria Marcelina

texts.es: La señora Victoria, es una persona de 44 años de edad, de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria, vive en su propia casa en la comunidad de Tiraque y tiene dos dependientes económicos a su cargo que son sus hijos, la actividad principal a que se dedica la señora Victoria es la agricultura,  produce  los siguientes productos en promedio anual y en las cantidades siguientes: Papa 90 cargas, Haba (verde)  70 cargas, Arveja  (verde) 50 cargas, Trigo (grano) 20 quintales, Oca 12 quintales y Avena (forrajera) 2 camiones. La siembra de estos cultivos lo realiza en sus propios terrenos en una superficie de 3 Hectáreas que tiene en la misma comunidad donde vive y los otros terrenos que tiene son herencia de sus padres, la mayor parte de esos terrenos están con plantaciones de  pinos y eucaliptos y una porción de esos terrenos son agrícolas donde siembra  el trigo  y la avena, los terrenos cuentan con riego, por otro lado en época de  siembra y cosecha lo realiza con la colaboración de trabajadores eventuales a los que les cancela el jornal trabajado a Bs. 50. Vive en una casa rustica de adobe, con este préstamo que realiza es para capital de operación para comprar semilla de papa, una vez cosechada  mejorara sus ingresos  y de igual manera la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Victoria is 44 years old, married, and has an elementary school education.  She lives in Tiraque and has two children who depend on her for support.  Victoria’s main business consists of farming, where she produces an annual average of: 90 bushels of potatoes, 70 bushes of green beans, 50 bushels of peas, 20 quintals or wheat grain, 12 quintals of ochre, and two truckloads of peas. She plants on her own 3 hectares of farmland located in her community, and also on other land that her parents gave her.  Most of the land has pine and eucalyptus trees on it and part of it is farmland where she raises wheat and oats.  There is irrigation on the land and she harvests with the help of farm workers to whom she pays Bs. 50.  She lives in a rustic adobe house and needs this loan to buy potato seeds.  Once harvested, she will improve her income and quality of life for her dependents.

loans.use: to buy potato seed.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Doña blanca, tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en el municipio de Quimistán Santa Bárbara. Anteriormente por muchos años trabajo en una compañía bananera como asalariada, luego se dedico al comercio. Ahora tiene su propio negocio para generar ingresos para su familia. Tiene una pulpería donde vende productos de primera necesidad como granos básicos, refrescos, lácteos, embutidos, pan, dulces, condimentos, y vanidades como adornos, cosméticos, sandalias, cremas, desodorantes y otros. Ha obtenido varios préstamos con la Institución, actualmente solicita el séptimo ciclo que es por 15,000 lempiras para surtir la pulpería de productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: granos básicos, embutidos, lácteos, refrescos, y otros. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio y lograr auto sostenibilidad.
texts.en: Blanca is 52 years old, married, and has two children with whom she lives in the town of Quimistán Santa Bárbara.  For many years she used to work for a banana producer as a salaried worker, but later became a businesswoman.  Now she has her own business to generate an income for her family, and has a store where she sells primary needs products such as basic grains, soft drinks, dairy products, sausages, bread, candy, condiments, and vanity items such as decorations, cosmetics, sandals, creams, deodorants, and other things.  She has gotten various loans through the institution in the past and is asking for her seventh loan in the amount of 15,000 Lempiras, so she can stock her store with food products, such as basic grains, sausages, dairy, soft drinks, and other things.  Her plan is to grow her business and make it self-sustaining.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es:
Doña Juana es una mujer de 37 años de edad, en un estado civil en unión libre la cual goza de una excelente salud mucha energía y mucho entusiasmo al momento de trabajar. Ella trabaja en compañía de su compañero de hogar y sus 8 hijos los cuales viven en la misma casa y estudian en diferentes grados de educación. En familia se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café ya que ella aprendió desde pequeña en compañía de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra ya que no pudieron apoyarla a terminar sus estudios cursando hasta el tercer grado de educación primaria porque eran de escasos recursos económicos. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a pocos metros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan pie todos los días. Sus sueños como madre de familia es poder educar a sus hijos para que ellos puedan vivir en buenas condiciones y darles una mejor y mayor calidad de vida con un nivel educativo superior.

Doña Juana solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para  la compra de 4 QQ de urea, 4 QQ de abono 18-46-0, 4 QQ de abono 12-24-12, 6 litros de abono foliar, 3 galones de herbicidas entre otros para poder asistir sus cultivos de café y obtener una mejor producción y una mejor ganancia de la venta de la misma.
texts.en:
Juana is 37 years old, single, and has much energy and enthusiasm when working.  She works with her domestic partner and eight children who attend different grades in school.  The family raises and harvests coffee and she learned this from her parents when she was very young.  It was they who taught her to work the land since they were not able to support her to study past the third grade due to a lack of financial resources.

Her coffee crops are located a few meters from her home and she walks there each day.  Her dreams as a mother are to be able to educate her children so that they can live under good conditions and give them a better quality of life and a higher education.

Juana is asking for a loan through the COMIXMUL co-op so she can buy 4 QQ of urea, 4 QQ of 18-46-0 fertilizer, 4 QQ of 12-24-12 fertilizer, 6 liters of foliage fertilizer, 3 gallons of herbicide, and other things to help her coffee crops to better produce and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo es un hombre de 56 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus 4 hijos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Hugo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica.
Por iniciativa propia, Hugo trabaja en su pequeña vulcanizadora,el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen servicio y dedicación.
Hugo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva,ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará materiales para su trabajo, como parches, cámaras, rodajes y otros, así pues Hugo seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Hugo is a 56-year-old man who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his four children. He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, and dedicates all of his efforts to providing for his family. Unfortunately, due to lacking financial resources and because he needed to work, Hugo wasn't able to study Mechanical Engineering. 

On his own initiative, Hugo works at his small tire repair shop. He works every day for approximately ten hours and believes things are going well for him due to his good service and dedication. 

Hugo is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since the help offered him will allow him to buy materials for work, such as patches, chambers, bearings, and other items. Hugo will keep working and striving to achieve his big dream, which is for his children to become good professionals.

loans.use: to purchase materials.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Doña Isidora es una mujer de 38 años de edad casada, emprendedora y luchadora, madre de 5 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y están en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación en una escuela de la comunidad. Ella se dedican en compañía de su esposo a las diferentes actividades de cultivo y producción de granos básicos como ser: maíz y frijol siendo su principal actividad el café. Aprendió la agricultura hace más de diez años siendo su esposo el que le enseñara a trabajar la tierra en las diferentes actividades como, limpieza, abono, corte, riego, etc. Sus cultivos están ubicados cerca de su casad de habitación aproximadamente a 5 minutos de camino a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente. Doña Isidora solo curso hasta el segundo grado ya que no tubo apoyo financiero por parte de sus padres siendo ellos de escasos recursos. Sus sueños son educar sus 5 hijos para que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y que obtenga un nivel educativo universitario formar un patrimonio sólido y atractivo para sus clientes ya que en época de cosechase involucra toda la familia e inculcan a sus hijos el valor y la honradez en el trabajo como también la responsabilidad.

Doña Isidora actualmente solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de: 3 QQ de formula cafetalera, 3 QQ de abono 12-24-12, 2 QQ de urea, 2 litros de nutrí café y 4 litros de forti café ya que es necesario asistir y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos como también extenderlos para generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y su familia.
texts.en:
Isidora is 38 and married, she is enterprising and determined. She is the mother of 5 young children and they are in various classes in the community primary school. She works for her husband's company undertaking various tasks growing basic grains like corn and beans, although their main crop is coffee. 

She learnt the trade more than 10 years ago as her husband taught her how to work the land, including the various tasks: cleaning, fertilising, cutting, irrigation etc. Their crops are located near to the family home, it is about a 5 minute walk and they go on foot every day. 

Isidora only studied to the second grade as she had no financial support from her parents as they had limited resources. Her dream is to educate her 5 children so they can have a better quality of life and obtain a university education to form a solid and attractive heritage for her customers. At harvest time, the whole family is involved and the children are taught the value of honesty in their work and responsibility. 

Isidora is currently requesting a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to buy 3 QQ of coffee formula, 3 QQ of 12-24-12 manure, 2 litres of nutricafe and 4 litres of forticafe as she needs is to attend to and maintain her crops in order to earn an income for her home and family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Mawenzi Group

texts.en:
Aziza, who is in her mid-20s, is single.  She has been selling tie-dyed materials since 2008.  She works from 7.00 am to 5.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her 6th loan request which she will use to buy more tie-dyed materials to sell to more people. With the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she managed to purchase more tie dyed materials. Aziza used her business profit to cover home expenses. Specifically, she bought iron-sheets for house building preparation and a fridge.  Aziza dreams that one day she will be able to build a house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" Mawenzi Group" which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more tie dyed materials to sell to more people.

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru: Фахриддин трудолюбивый человек. Ему 19 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями и братом. Он успешно учился в средней школе и после окончания средней школы поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет по специальности Экономика и финансы. Он умный и начитанный человек. В свободное время он помогает матери по домохозяйству, а также занимается спортом. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fahriddin is a hardworking person.  He is 19 years old.  He lives with his parents and a brother.  He successfully attended a secondary school and after graduation got accepted to the Khujand State University with the economics and finance major.  He is a smart and well-read person.  He helps his mother with the household and plays sports in his free time.  He has to pay for his university contract, but does not have money.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his university tuition.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Phlaung

texts.en:
Phlaung is a 62-year-old married woman with six children, three of among whom are employed in various occupations. She lives in a small thatched house in the Baray district of Kampong Thom province with her family. She owns and operates a plantation of rice and cassava in order to earn a living. For many years, this business has earned a good income which she uses for her home bills, food and for the sake of her children.

Phlaung has requested a loan in order to buy merchandise to restock her daughter’s grocery store with items such as snacks, shampoo, home use products, toiletries, cosmetics, beverages and other miscellaneous products. She has never had loans from any state banks before but Kiva partner HKL has provided her with a greater ease and lower interest.  Through the loan, she hopes to help her daughter sustain her retail business and increase her sales. With the profit from the business as a result of the loan, she will use some for daily needs and save more for the future expansion of the business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her daughter’s grocery store.

loans.name: Evenecer Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Evanecer está conformado por ocho integrantes, madres solteras con ganas de superación personal, son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de noroeste del país. En sus ratos libres les gusta disfrutar de su familia. Y les preparan platos típicos de la región como “ carne en baho” lamentablemente no pudieron cursar una carrera, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. 

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Luz Marina es la coordinadora del banco y tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, jabón. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Evanecer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Evanecer" is made up of eight members: they are single mothers who want to better themselves. They are from El Sauce, in the northwestern part of the country. The members like to spend their free time with their families, and prepare typical meals, such as "Carne de Baho" (a meat and yucca dish), for them. Sadly, none of the members were able to pursue higher education and have had to work from a young age. 

Thanks to her hard work and desire to get ahead, Luz Marina is the coordinator of the communal bank, and earns her living from a "pulpería" located in her house. A "pulpería" is a small shop that sells edible products in small amounts, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, as well as detergent and soap. For 12 years, she has been earning her living by selling these products.

The loan will be used to invest in working capital and stock up on supplies so that Luz Marina can increase her sales in the near future. The communal bank "Evanecer" is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, allowing them a decent means of earning a living.

loans.use: to invest in the working capital and to stock up her business with edible products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, as well as detergent and soap.

loans.name: Batkhuyag

texts.en:
Mr. Batkhuyag, 49 years old, lives with his wife and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He has been raising cattle and selling the diary products to local people. His elder daughter works at a farm as an assistant farmer. His younger daughter goes to high school and during summer holiday she helps her family. His elder son also helps his father in raising cattle. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase additional cattle in order to increase his income. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who came to Ulaanbaatar from the countryside in pursuit of happiness two years ago.

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle.

loans.name: Chheun

texts.en:
Chheun is a 40-year-old married woman. She didn’t finish secondary school and got married when she was at her twenties. She has been blessed with three adult children and together they live in a small house in a remote area of Kampong Thom province. She has almost 15-year experience in agriculture. She owns a few plots of land to grow rice within the rainy season and devotes some of her daytime to work as a paid laborer for local plantation owners.

The loan she is asking for is to prepare the soil and to buy farm supplies to grow her rice. With this she can apply the materials in time so that the harvest will be good and allow her to ensure grains for home consumption and to sell. She has been a good client of Kiva partner HKL for five loan cycles already and she is confident to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to prepare the soil and to buy farm supplies to grow her rice.

loans.name: Erkebu

texts.ru: Эркебу 65 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает шестерых детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Эркебу - высшее образование, на протяжении долгих лет работала в местной школе, преподавателем химии и биологии. Эркебу на протяжении 40 лет занимается животноводством, стартовав с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Эркебу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 лошадь, 2 дойные коровы, а также 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эркебу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки мелкого рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Эркебу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Erkebu is 65 years old, a widow, who has been raising six children by herself after her husband's death and also running her own business.  Erkebu has a higher education.  She spent many long years working as a chemistry and biology teacher at a local school.  Erkebu has been involved in animal husbandry for 40 years, having started with a purchase of livestock with 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 1 horse, 2 dairy cows and also 20 heads of small livestock, and the monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Erkebu requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to increase livestock headcount by buying small livestock.  Erkebu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Goris town with her family. The family has been involved in agriculture for 10 years. Mainly they are engaged in beekeeping and land cultivation. Currently Gayane and her family keep 5 colonies of bees. As honey is a must-have item for each household of Armenia, it is very much in demand among locals.

Gayane works hard to gather high quality honey and sell it. Her family consists of 7 people: Gayane herself, her husband, parents-in-law and three children (two of them are school age).

The income from agriculture hardly helps Gayane to cover her family's basic needs, so she would like to enlarge it. Gayane took a loan from a local financial institution before and wasn't able to repay it because of the family's poor conditions. But over years of hard work, Gayane and her family were able to farm in a way which is sustainable enough for covering monthly payments. So, Gayane has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international.

The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products, so lenders will greatly assist Gayane by giving her an opportunity to purchase 5 more colonies of bees and 3 pigs.

loans.use: to pay for 5 colonies of bees and 3 pigs

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie works hard to support her family. Lenie is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lenie requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials. Lenie has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Lenie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 55 years old and married. She has eleven children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and she earns an additional income from prepared food vending.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more goods to sell in her general store. Ma. Luisa has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es: Edilberto, de 34 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Edilberto se dedica a dos actividad, una de ellas es  la siembra de toda variedad de verdura, alverjas y menestras. Los cuales realiza en sus propios terrenos agrícolas ubicados en la zona alta de su localidad. En temporadas de escasez, siembra en sociedad con otras personas, con las que comparten los gastos de fertilización y mantenimiento. Ya tiene 8 años de experiencia vendiendo sus cosechas en la capital del país y otras ciudades reconocidas. Y su otra actividad es la construcción de casa, por eso se desempaña como albañil y es muy bueno en su trabajo, obtiene buenos ingresos semanales, “todo depende de los contratos que adquiera”, menciona con la alegría que lo caracteriza. Ahora desea ser reconocido en su trabajo como albañil.Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, esta muy contento de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos. Edilberto, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de maderas para su trabajo de albañilería.
texts.en:
Edilberto, who is 34 years old, is a responsible man. He lives with his wife and their two children in the home they own. 

Edilberto has two businesses. One of them is growing a wide variety of vegetables, peas, and legumes. He does this on his own farmland, located in the highlands of his town. In periods of scarcity, he partners up with other farmers and they share fertilization and maintenance expenses. He already has eight years of experience selling his products in the country's capital and other well-known cities. 

His other business is building houses. He does construction work and is very good at it. He makes a good weekly income, but "it all depends on how many contracts I get," he mentions with his usual cheerfulness. Now he wants to be recognized for his construction work.
