This is his second Kiva loan. He is very happy to have financial support, since he has always proved himself to be responsible with his payments. Edilberto will invest the 500 soles in purchasing wood for his construction work.

loans.use: to buy wood for construction work.

loans.name: Alvaro Luis

texts.es: Alvaro Luis de 23 años de edad el se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace 2 años, apesar de tener poco tiempo en el negocio se ha superado y por esa razon solcita a Kiva un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en medicina natural, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el creditos solicitado ya que el sueño de él es agrandar mas su negocio ahora que sus clientes han aumentado.
texts.en: Alvaro Luis is 23 years old and has worked selling natural medicine for two years.  In spite of having little time in the business, it has excelled, and for that reason he is asking Kiva for a loan to buy more merchandise of natural medicine. He is hoping that you can help with the requested loan, because his dream is to grow his business now that customers have increased.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine

loans.name: Leilanie

texts.en:
Leilanie, 29 years of age, is married and they are blessed with four children. Her husband and her have diligently established a business to earn more income for their children. As such, she has managed an auto repair shop for almost 11 years.  With this business she's earning a net income of Php 7,000 per week. 

She plans to expand their business so she is seeking a loan of Php 13,000 in order to purchase a compressor for their auto repair shop. She's hoping that her business will improve and become more profitable as a result.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor for their auto repair shop.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 55 years old and married. She has eight children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years, and she earns additional income by selling charcoal.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional items to sell in her store, like spices, milk, soft drinks, and chips. Yolanda has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store, like spices, milk, and soft drinks

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 21 años de edad,  soltero que estudia bachillerato en la ciudad. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a sus padres que dependen de las actividades que él realiza. Como es la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres,  para llegar a la parcelas camina 1 Km  y trabaja junto a ellos durante la mañana y luego en el transcurso de la tarde estudia y en la noche se dedica a cuidar una finca

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono, semilla, pesticidas, herbicidas, para  sembrar y obtener una buena cosecha para el sustento de su familia. Su objetivo, es  trabajar en una empresa y darles una vivienda digna a sus padres.
texts.en:
Carlos, 21, is a single young man who's studying for a college degree in the city.  He gets up at 5 a.m. with his parents.  They depend on his agricultural work, which he learned from them.  To get to the fields he walks a kilometer and works with them in the morning.  Later he attends school in the afternoon and takes care of a farm at night.

The loan Carlos is requesting is to buy soil amendments, seed, pesticide, and herbicide to plant his fields and get a good harvest so he can support his family.

His goal is to work in a company and give his parents a decent home.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, seed, pesticide, and herbicide

loans.name: Darwin Antonio

texts.es: Darwin es un joven de 31 años de edad, padre de una hija que depende de él económicamente quien está en edad escolar, su esposa es ama de casa, no tiene empleo actualmente. Juntos habitan en casa de un pariente, ya que están construyendo una pequeña casa en el patio de sus padres quienes le cedieron una parte de terreno para que pudiera independizarse, Darwin trabaja como colector de ingresos en una institución del estado. Solicita este crédito para comprar láminas de zinc,  cemento, arenilla y pago de mano de obra de esta manera podrá culminar la construcción de un cuarto, para asi habitarla con su familia, mientras construye el resto de su vivienda. Con esta obra se benefician tanto él como su familia,  habitando en su propio hogar.
texts.en: Darwin is 31 year old young man. He has a daughter who depends on him financially and is in school. His wife is a homemaker and doesn’t have a job. They live together in a relative’s house. They are building a small house on the property of his wife’s parents who gave them some land so that they could be independent. Darwin works as a revenue collector for a state agency. He’s asking for this loan to buy zinc sheets, cement, and gravel as well as pay for labor. This will let him finish construction of a room to live in with his family while they build the rest of the house. This project will benefit Darwin and his family, letting them live in their own home.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, cement, and gravel and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Gladys Cruz

texts.es:
Gladis es una mujer de 31 años de edad la cual se dedica a la docencia en ella que no tiene esposo y sus pagos son cada cuatro meses por lo que ella opto a trabajar en la agricultura para tener otros ingresos, es madre de tres hijos la mayor tiene seis años y está en primer grado, el segundo hijo está en el kínder y la tercer hija no tiene aún la edad para estudiar. Gladis cuenta con el apoyo de un hermano que es quien se encarga de cuidar los cultivos mientras ella se encarga de los recursos económicos para poder asistirlos y darles el mantenimiento necesario y posible. su único rubro como ingreso a parte de su trabajo es el cultivo de arroz ya que de allí es donde obtienen los ingresos para todo el año y dar a sus hijos lo necesario. Ella tiene 5 años de dedicarse al cultivo de arroz el cual es propio ya que pertenece a sus padres por lo que se ahorra el pago de alquiler de tierra los cuales están ubicados alrededor de su casa de habitación. Gladis sueña con algún día poder comprar su propia tierra para cultivarla con las ganancias de la cosecha de arroz este año.

Por lo que ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para dar un mayor mantenimiento y asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de arroz con la compra de 3 galones de ARROMAX, 15 QQ de abono 12-24-12, 2 litros de FURORE y 10 QQ de urea.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 31-year-old woman who makes a living as a teacher. Since she does not have a husband and she receives paychecks every four months, she decided to work in agriculture to earn other income. She is the mother of three children. Her oldest daughter is six years old and in the first grade. Her son is in kindergarten and her younger daughter is not old enough to study yet.

Gladis has the support of her brother who is in charge of caring for the crop, while she takes care of the financial resources in order to attend to them and give them the necessary and possible maintenance. Through the cultivation of rice, she earns income for the entire year and provides for her children. She has been cultivating rice for five years on land which belongs to her parents, which allows her to save money on rent for the land which is located around her house.

Gladis dreams of someday being able to buy her own land for cultivation, using the profits from this year's rice harvest. For this reason she has requested financing from the COMIXMUL cooperative to provide greater maintenance and technical assistance to her rice crops through the purchase of three gallons of ARROMAX, 15 QQ of fertilizer 12-24-12, two liters of FURORE, and 10 QQ of urea.

loans.use: to buy supplies to cultivate rice

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a borrower from BRAC Pakistan. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her brother. Her brother is the only earning person for the family. He is an excellent tailor. He can stitch all types of dresses for both men and women.  He has only one sewing machine to complete customers order on time.  Every week he has a lot of tasks and it gets very difficult for him to complete the orders on time. Therefore, he would like to purchase one more machine and hire one worker to help him in completing orders. This will help him to cope with customer needs more efficiently. 

Nusrat hopes that the loan will be a productive one for her brother's shop. She feels happy to help him.

Nusrat says thanks to all Kiva staff and Kiva lenders

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mujeres De Granadillo Group

texts.es:
La señora Fabiana es madre soltera, tiene 35 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes y guipiles típicos, inició este negocio aprendiendo con su familia y hasta la fecha lleva 15 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de hilos para tejer guipiles y cortes típicos del lugar, espera en el futuro contar con un capital estable que le permita agrandar su negocio tejiendo variedad de estilos. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de café y a tejeduría. Una de las integrantes no pudo asistir cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Fabiana is a 35 year old single mother. She has not had the chance to study and has two children, one of whom is studying. She makes a living weaving guipiles (woven blouses) and cortes (woven skirts) which are typical dress in her area. She started this business by learning with her family and to date has 15 years of experience. She counts on her family to help her.

She has organised a group and is applying for a loan which she will invest in buying thread to make traditional local clothing. In the future she hopes to have a stable income which allows her to expand her business by weaving in different styles. The other members of the group make a living by growing coffee and weaving. One of the members could not be present when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Fatumata

texts.en:
Fatumata is 32 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is married and has three children aged between 6 months and 9 years old. They live with her and go to school. She currently is a 9th grade student.

Over the past six years, Fatumata has been running a table business at the local market, where she sells Lappa (fabric). She started this business with her own money. She has requested a loan to purchase more Lappa, to attract more customers.

In the future, Fatumata hopes to be a big businesswoman and have her own store. She is glad to be a BRAC Liberia borrower.

loans.use: to purchase more Lappa (African fabric), to attract more customers.

loans.name: Inocensia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Inocensia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Inocensia is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc., for her general store business.

Inocensia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 55 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Marilyn has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Luis Octavio

texts.es: Luis a sus 29 años de edad ha trabajado desde que era muy joven en diferentes almacenes de venta de celulares y accesorios desempeñándose como vendedor de mostrador, allí adquirió experiencia y conocimiento en el manejo  de este tipo de negocios, además ha conseguido los recursos necesarios para solventar sus necesidades básicas y aportar a la economía de su familia. Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ingresos y de manejar su propio tiempo, Luis desea independizarse y montar su propio negocio de venta de accesorios y equipos celulares, para esto ya tiene el local que tomó en arriendo, pero requiere del apoyo del crédito que solicita para comprar activos fijos (vitrinas y estantes), surtido de mercancía (protectores de pantalla, auriculares, baterías, equipos celulares) y realizará adecuaciones locativas (pintar las paredes), de esta manera podrá iniciar con su idea de negocio, dándole una imagen agradable y ofreciendo gran variedad de mercancía, además también prestará el servicio e reparación de equipos celulares, todo esto dará como resultado la generación de recursos para seguir progresando. Luis sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en una distribuidora donde pueda generar empleo y es consciente que para lograrlo debe trabajar con esmero y mucha dedicación, sólo de esa manera se forjará un futuro exitoso que le dará la capacidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, who is 29 years old, has worked as a salesperson in different stores that sell cell phones and accessories since he was very young. Here, he gained experience and knowledge in the management of this type of business. He also obtained the resources necessary to pay for his basic needs and contribute to his family.

With the goal of increasing his income and managing his own time, Luis would like to become independent and open his own business selling cell phone equipment and accessories. He is already leasing a location, but he needs the support of a this loan, which he requests so that he can buy fixed assets (windows and display cases), merchandise (screen protectors, headphones, batteries, cell phone equipment) and make improvements to his stand (paint the walls). This way, he will be able to start his business, give it a pleasant appearance, and offer a great variety of merchandise. He will also be able to provide service and repairs of cell phones. All of this will generate resources so that he will be able to continue to progress.

Luis dreams of growing his business and converting it into a distributor that will generate jobs. He knows that, to achieve this, he will need to work with care and great dedication. In this way, he will create a successful future that will give him the ability to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (windows and display cases), merchandise (screen protectors, headphones, batteries, cell phone equipment) and make improvements to his stand (paint the walls).

loans.name: Neneh

texts.en:
This is 23-year-old Neneh.  She is single but has one child.   

In 2006, Nenneh established a clothing sales business. She began her business because she wants to be fully responsible for herself and her child. By working six days per week and 11 hours per day, she earns appoximately 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL to buy 20 bales of cotton @ 250,000 SLL each. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 900,000 SLL. In the future, Nenneh plans to operate a wholesale business by trading in larger quantities. She explains that she is very hardworking and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional cotton bales

loans.name: Amlet

texts.en:
Amlet, 47, is married and lives in the village of Shaumiani, with his wife, two children, and retired mother. Amlet’s children go to the public school. He’s a very hardworking, enthusiastic man, who focuses all his efforts into getting ahead. Amlet works very hard on his own plot of land, where nuts and persimmons are grown. In addition, he owns a dairy cow and sells the received milk. His products are very good quality, and Amlet has several loyal customers, but his revenues are not enough to feed the family and cover everyday costs, as well.

With the loan that has been granted, Amlet will purchase a cargo van to start a vegetable-selling business. He will purchase fresh products in bulk and sell them in nearby villages, for a profit. The van will be used for making deliveries. This use of the credit will significantly increase his family's income. It is obvious that the family's financial needs are significant, but Amlet will work hard to satisfy them and to give the children a better life. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cargo van for starting a vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Febella

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Febella works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Febella is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for her prepared foods business, like meat, vegetables, spices, and rice. Febella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her prepared foods business, like meat, vegetables, spices, and rice

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado County. She is 48 years old, and she stopped her education at 7th grade. Sally is married and has three children, ages 17 to 30 years old. Only one child lives at home and is attending school. For the past sixteen years, Sally has been selling Lappa, which are African cloths used mostly by women, in the local market. One problem she faces is small income. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes every time. She is requesting a loan to purchase more Lappa for her business. In the near future, she hopes to build a house for her children. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa for her business.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is 52 years old and married. She supports a family of six. She sells clothing in Kapsabet town. This has been her income-generating business for the last six years, and she earns an average monthly income of KES 40,000.

She has borrowed a fourth loan from KADET, of KES 50,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase clothes to sell, to boost her business.

She anticipates of getting profits, which she will use to improve her household and farm business. Her dream is to expand her business and to live a better life with her family

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Vilma is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of soft drinks, milk, soap, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell such as soft drinks, milk, soap, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
This is twenty-nine year old Emmanuel. He is married and has no children. In 2005, Emmanuel established a business selling baby clothes, napkins, calculators, watches, and blouses. He began his business after dropping out of school because he wanted to be self-reliant. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week, 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,213,080 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from the business.

Emmanuel would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and he now needs a new loan in order to buy more napkins, shoes, calculators, and vests. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock and thus his profits. In the future, he plans to expand the business to the sale of ladies' dresses. He also hopes to complete the construction of the house he just started with the proceeds of his previous loan. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to but napkins, shoes, calculators, and vests

loans.name: Kely Alejandra

texts.es: La cliente reside en Machala.  Empezó con esta actividad ayudándole a vender a su mamá y posteriormente se independizó, ya que le gustó el negocio dado que resultaba productivo.  Ahora trabaja sola todo el día.  Es soltera y no tiene hijos.  En el futuro desea poder montar una tienda junto con el bazar para su familia.  Requiere el dinero del préstamo para la compra de vitrinas, perfumería y bisutería.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in Machala.  She started in this line of work by helping her mother make sales, but later on she became independent.  She enjoys her business since it has given her productive results.  The borrower currently works all day by herself.  She is single and has no children.  In the future, she would like to open a store with a bazaar that she can manage for her family.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy display cabinets, perfumes, and trinkets.

loans.use: to buy display cabinets, perfumes, and trinkets.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebat, 36 years old, lives with his mother and sister in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He has been driving workers bus at a private business company for two years. Before that, he rendered taxi services to local people. His mother is retired from work and gets state pension. His sister just graduated from her university and is now looking for a job. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate his house. The renovated house will enable the family to live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials to renovate his house.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana Gladis de 46 años de edad vive junto y su pequeño nieto a sus hijos quien día a día son su motivo para ser una buena mujer y una buena madre. con muchas características que las distinguen de los demás Ana Gladis es muy emprendedora cada mañana se levanta con nuevos proyectos en mente y desea que pronto su vida mejore. Desde hace ya 7 años vive en casa humilde pero propia ha sabido mejorarla y se ha sentido satisfecha porque nunca les ha faltado el pan de cada día. Ana se dedica al comercio de vender leña, corta cada raja de leña y hace los puñitos, también posee una pequeña tienda donde comercializa productos básicos y de primera necesidad como shampoo, jabón, huevos, leche, papel higiénico entre otros. Ana Gladis decidió solicitar un préstamo a FUSAI para construir un cuarto de 4mts por 3 mts cuadrados y además mejorar el servicio sanitarios (letrina)hacerle un respaldo y arreglar el techo donde se encuentra. Agradece por el apoyo brindado y espera pronto saldar la deuda adquirida así ella se verá beneficiada con ese prestamos y les dará una buena condición de vida a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Ana Gladis is 46; lives with her husband, children, and her small grandson; and strives each day to be a good wife and mother. Ana Gladis stands out for many reasons: she is very hard working, starts each day with new tasks to do, and has a strong ambition to achieve a better life. 

Ana Gladis has for seven years lived in a modest home that she owns. She has made improvements to the house and is pleased that she's been able to do so without depriving her family of their daily necessities. Ana Gladis sells firewood, cutting each bough into logs herself. She also runs a small shop where she sells basic items such as shampoo, soap, eggs, milk, bathroom tissue, and other goods. 

Ana Gladis decided to apply for a loan from FUSAI [Fundación Salvadorña de Apoyo Integral, Salvadoran Foundation for Comprehensive Development] to add a 4 x 3 square meter room to her home, improve sanitation by adding a second latrine, and fix the house's roof. She is grateful for the lender's support and plans to repay the loan quickly. The loan funds will benefit Ana Gladis and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to build a 4 x 3 square meter room, improve sanitation by adding a second latrine, and fixing the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy one cow and two head of cattle.

loans.name: Sotirko

texts.en:
What you see in the background of the photograph, is the little family home of Sotirko. She is a 60-year-old mother of five grownup children, who resides in the rural southeastern part of Albania. She is indeed poor, according to our poverty measurement tools. For the past ten years she has been caring for livestock, and she wants to add a dairy cow to her existing little herd, with this loan.

“I have been selling raw milk to a nearby dairy farm and to not complain, I have been able to make a little income out of this. But this little income has enabled me to secure the staple food. I did not know that there were institutions in our region to offer financial services to people in my situation and at my level. I am so very grateful to the loan officer, who made me aware of this, because I can now take advantage of such services just like others,” is what Sotirko said.

loans.use: to buy another milk cow

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es una mujer de 55 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 31 años y una hija de 26 años de edad respectivamente. Estos viven legalmente en estados unidos. Vive en la casa con la mamá de ella, persona que tiene 95 años de edad. La casa donde vive es propiedad de un hermano. Su casa la tiene alquilada.

Emilia, se dedica a costurar desde hace 35 años, la mamá fue costurera y  ella  le enseño el oficio. Actualmente, confecciona uniformes escolares y a sus clientes, generalmente mujeres.


El préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción $1,300.00  y  pago de mano de obra en la edificación de un muro de la vivienda y $200.00 en compra de materias primas como: telas, hilos y broches.

Con el tapial construido, tendrán mejor seguridad en su vivienda y al adquirir materias primas (telas, hilo y broches) gozará de un mejor descuento por compras por mayoreo y se evitará gastos por transporte al dejar de estar viajando por comprar accesesorios.


Además, seguridad en la vivienda y capital de trabajo. El tener en su casa diversidad de telas, le permite mostrarles a sus clientes y convencerles que le compren y obtener mejores ingresos.

Tiene la idea de crecer con su taller de costura y  emplear otras personas de su comunidad y dedicarse a la venta de ropa que pudiera producir.
texts.en:
Emilia is a 55 year old woman. She has a 31 year old son and a 26 year old daughter. They live legally in the United States. She lives with her mother. Her mother is 95 and the house they live in belongs to her brother. She rents it. 

Emilia has been a seamstress for 35 years. Her mother was a seamstress and taught her the trade. Right now, she makes school uniforms and her customers are generally women. 

The $1,300 of the loan will be invested in buying construction materials and paying for labor to put up a wall around the house and $200.00 will be used to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread and fasteners.  

With the construction of the wall, they will have more security in their home and with the acquisition of raw materials (fabric, thread and fasteners) she will have a bigger discount from buying wholesale and avoid transportation costs when she stops traveling to buy accessories. In addition to security and working capital, with a diversity of fabrics she can show them her customers and convince them to buy and make more profits.   

She has the idea of growing her sewing workshop and hiring other people from her community and selling what clothing she is able to produce.

loans.use: $1,300.00 are to buy construction materials and pay for labor costs to build a wall around her house and  $200.00 are to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread and fasteners.

loans.name: Zoila Mercedes

texts.es:
Zoila cuenta con 26 años de edad, es casada y con dos hijos de 10 y 5 años. Estudio hasta el primer grado, vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a la pesca artesanal, sus dos hijos los cuales estudian en un centro escolar cercano a su lugar de domicilio.

Ella se dedica al comercio de mariscos desde hace 15 años, el oficio lo aprendió con su mamá quien se dedicaba a lo mismo.

El crédito lo ocupara para invertir en el negocio de mariscos comprara más hieleras, una red de pesca, y con lo demás comprara mariscos. Ella planifica hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Zoila is 26 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 10 and 5.  She went to school up to the first grade.  She lives with her husband who is a traditional fisherman.  Her two children attend the school near her home.  She has sold seafood for 15 years;  it is a business that she learned from her  mother, who did the same work.  She will use the loan to invest in her seafood business by buying more refrigerators and a fishing net, and with the rest by buying seafood.  She plans to grow her business and to improve her home.

loans.use: to invest in her seafood business by buying more refrigerators and a fishing net, and with the rest by buying seafood.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a hard worker who has farmed rice in the Philippines for the past six years. She also sells rice at retail to make more money.

Lea has been sustaining her farm through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She is applying for a 26,000 PHP loan to buy more fertilizer for her farm. Her desire is to provide for a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, 64, is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and has nine children, one of whom is in school.

For the past ten years Cecilia has had a restaurant in the Philippines. She is applying for a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, chicken, spices, vegetables, salt, etc. for her dishes. She is working to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant entrees.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en: Ma. Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her business. Ma. Lourdes has been in this business for five years. Ma. Lourdes earns additional income from a general store.  Ma. Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from Tegh village of Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and 21-year-old son. Jointly with her husband, Hasmik has been engaged in agriculture for 20 years. They keep livestock (including pigs, piglets, cows, and sheep) and cultivate wheat, haricot, potatoes and grass. 
Hasmik and her husband sell the gathered harvest in local markets and gain income which is vital for them for covering the family's costs. Realizing how important agricultural income is for them, Hasmik asks a loan of USD 2000 for purchasing 20 more sheep. As this is Hasmik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.  So this loan will greatly assist Hasmik to increase her livestock and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 20 sheep

loans.name: Danilo Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Danilo Adolfo reside en la ciudad de Somoto en el departamento de Madriz en el norte Nicaragua, este señor tiene unos 30 años de vivir en su propia casa de habitación, él está felizmente casado, su esposa es docente en un centro escolar en el área rural de la ciudad de Somoto. Este señor es muy conocido por los vecinos como una persona de buenas relaciones y muy trabajadora.
El señor Danilo Adolfo se desempeña como guarda de seguridad interna en las instalaciones de la empresa de acueductos y alcantarillados, este señor tiene unos 13 años de laborar en dicha institución de manera continua y estable, con buenas relaciones laborales. 
Este señor se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel con el objetivo de solicita un financiamiento para poder mejorar las condiciones físicas de su casa de habitación, como es la mejora de algunas de las paredes de su casa, el plantea que de serle aprobado el crédito el podrá comprar los ladrillos, cemento y pagar la mano de obra que se necesita para realizar la mejora.
Este cliente es la segunda vez que se presenta a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento para mejorar su casa, ya se le otorgo el primer crédito y lo pago en tiempo y forma. Él se muestra positivo que de aprobársele el crédito podrá seguir mejorando su casa y así mismo las condiciones de su vida.
texts.en:
Danilo Adolfo lives in the city of Somoto, Madriz department, Northern Nicaragua. He has been living for about 30 years in a house of his own. He is happily married; his wife is a teacher in a school located in the rural area of Somoto. Danilo’s neighbors think of him as a friendly and hardworking person.

Danilo works as a security guard for the local water and sewage operator. He has been doing this continuously and with a good performance for thirteen years. He came to CEPRODEL to request a loan to make some home improvements. He wants to fix the walls; in case the loan is approved, he will buy bricks and cement and pay for the labor needed to do it.

This is the second time he requests a loan in CEPRODEL for home improvements. The first one was approved and he paid it back accordingly. He feels positive; in case the loan is approved, he will be able to continue improving his house and his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Khureltsooj

texts.en: Mrs. Khureltsooj, 48 years old, lives with her two sons in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in house on a plot of land. She has been working as a cook at restaurant for the last two years. Her elder son is currently in vocational training with funding from a mining company. She is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as fiberglass, planks and shingles in order to repair the house roof. Last spring heavy rain damaged the house roof, and heat loss through the roof increased greatly. So after repair, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they can burn less coal for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase shingles, fiberglass and planks

loans.name: Desebel

texts.en:
Desebel is 26 years old.  She is married and has two children. With her children currently in school, Desebel works very hard to provide for them.
Desebel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc. to sell in her general store.  Desebel has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Desebel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Jonna works hard to support her family.  She has a coconut business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Jonna is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of coconut to sell for her coconut business.  Jonna has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coconuts to sell

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria es originaria de la ciudad de León. Se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 4 años. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito por el apoyo que le han brindado ya que logro surtir  su negocio,  obtuvo mayores ingresos  y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar y una vitrina donde pueda exhibir sus productos con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio. Tiene como meta mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio. Estima que el financiamiento será de mucho éxito para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria's from the city of León. She has made a living for four years with her grocery store business.

Gloria's grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito for their support because she was able to stock her business, earn more income, and satisfy her customers' needs.

She's requesting this new loan to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, and a display case to show her products and offer better service.

Her objective is to improve the infrastructure of her business.  She thinks the loan will be very successful in improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, and a display case

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y es padre de tres hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura a cultivar maíz, yuca y fríjol, actividad que desempeña desde los 12 años de edad. Además, mantiene ganado lechero, el cual le genera entradas económicas. Vive con su esposa y 1 hijo, los otros 2 ya viven aparte y con sus respectivas familias. Las tierras que trabaja se encuentran a una distancia de medio kilómetro, el horario de trabajo es de 6 de la mañana hasta las 11:30 del día, el resto del día se lo dedica a cuidado del ganado. 

El crédito lo solicita para comprar fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, pago de mano de obra para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y otros 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, las cuales esta cultivando en tierra alquilada.
  
Sueña con ver a su hijo, como profesional ya que él le costea actualmente sus estudios universitarios, lo cual requiere un gran sacrificio, además sueña con comprar la tierra que alquila, ya que planea realizar un crédito a futuro con la institución.
texts.en:
Miguel, 61, is married and is the father of three children. He is a farmer and grows corn, yuca and beans; an activity that he has been doing since he was 12 years old. In addition, he has dairy cattle which generates an income for him. He lives with his wife and son. His other two children live with their respective families. The land that he works on is half a kilometre away. His work schedule is from 6am until 11:30am; he takes care of the cattle the rest of the day. 

The loan he is requesting is to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides and payment for manual labour to plant 7,000 square metres of corn and another 7,000 square metres of beans, which he is growing on rented land.

He dreams of seeing his son as a professional since he pays at the moment for his university studies, which requires a great sacrifice. In addition, he dreams of buying the land that he rents since he plans to get a loan in the future with this institution.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides and payment for manual labour to plant 7,000 square metres of corn and another 7,000 square metres of beans, which he is growing on rented land.

loans.name: Jairo Alberto

texts.es: Jairo, a sus 45 años de edad es padre de un hijo de 4 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Nació y creció en una familia campesina, humilde y trabajadora, aprendió las labores del campo por las enseñanzas de su padre desde que era un niño; gracias a todos estos conocimientos y experiencia, hoy en día se dedica a la agricultura y posee cultivos de café y caña de azúcar, lo que se cosecha es vendido en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside y así ha generado los recursos económicos necesarios para solventar los gastos básicos en su hogar. El cliente es un hombre pujante, enérgico y tiene un espíritu emprendedor que lo lleva siempre a buscar nuevas oportunidades para salir adelante. Esto lo motiva a solicitar el crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas (fungicidas, herbicidas, abonos y fertilizantes) de esta forma, podrá darle continuidad a su actividad y abonará los cultivos de café para prepararlos para la cosecha y así tener una producción de mejores resultados, con productos de buena calidad que permitan ser vendidos a un mejor precio en el mercado, para aumentar el margen de ganancia y los ingresos familiares. De esta manera, Jairo sueña con continuar su negocio, trabajando arduamente para poder ampliar sus cultivos y así aprovechar el terreno que tiene disponible, con lo que podrá incrementar su producción, garantizando así, una mejor estabilidad económica y bienestar para su hijo y su esposa.
texts.en:
Jairo, a 45-year-old man, is the father of a 4-year-old boy and lives with his common-law wife. He was born and raised in a rural, humble, and hard-working family. His father taught him the labors of the country from the time he was a child. Thanks to this knowledge and experience, he currently works in agriculture and owns coffee and sugar cane fields. He sells the products that he harvests in the marketplace in the municipality where he lives. This is how he earns the economic resources necessary to cover the basic expenses of his household.

Jairo is a thriving, energetic, entrepreneurial man who is always looking for new opportunities to get ahead. This motivated him to seek a loan that he will invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies (fungicides, herbicides, manure, and fertilizers). This way, he will be able to continue his business and fertilize the coffee fields to prepare them for harvest and obtain better results and high-quality products that he can sell at a higher price in the market. This will increase his profit margin and his family's income.

Jairo dreams of continuing his business, working hard to increase his harvest and take advantage of the available land so that he can increase production and guarantee economic stability and well-being for his son and his wife.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (fungicides, herbicides, manure, and fertilizers).

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 31 años, es una madre muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Percy sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Raquel se dedica a la agricultura, ha hecho que sus cultivos de alverja y papa sean muy productivos y abundantes. Sus productos, los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde obtiene buenos precios por sus productos, ya que tiene clientes muy fieles, quienes le compran todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, puesto que el transporte es muy escaso, además cuenta con una pequeña tienda de productos comestibles , el cual atiende en sus ratos libres. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. Además promete pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Raquel, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Raquel is 31 years old, a very simple and hard-working mother. She lives together with her husband Percy and two beloved children, whom she wants to provide a high standard of living. Raquel is a farmer, who has made her crops of peas and potatoes very abundant and productive. Her harvest is taken to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. She receives a good price for her products, as she has very loyal clients, who buy everything wholesale. 

What she likes most about her work is protecting her fields from the infestations that might attack them. She has been doing this for 9 years now and considers the most difficult thing is getting her goods to the market, given that transportation is scarce. She also has a small grocery store, which she attends to in her spare time.

This is her fourth loan with Kiva. Raquel will invest the 1500 PEN to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her fields. She is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving so she can get ahead. She promises to pay her installments on time. In the future she would like to buy more land to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is from the village of Japana, in the western part of Georgia. He is 34 years old, divorced, and lives with his two school-aged children and his mother.  Teimuraz and his parents run a small-scale agricultural business to earn a living. Specifically, they own a dairy cow and a calf. With the received milk, the family produces cheese for selling. Besides that, they sell maize, which they grow on the family-owned plot of land. The adult family members work hard, but they still live under the poverty line and get a small amount of social assistance from the government.

As the existing income is hardly enough for the family, Teimuraz decided to start a trading business. He plans to purchase nuts with his received start-up credit. The price of nuts is low now, because it is harvest season. He will sell the nuts after four or five months, when the price increases. Teimuraz plans to use the gained profit in the same business and increase the turnover gradually.  This gives him a chance to feed his children properly and give them a normal standard of living. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of nuts for resale

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 63 años de edad vive felizmente junto a su esposa. Es un hombre muy visionario y siempre tiene deseos de superación, vive en su casa propia desde hace ya 5 años y día a día le da gracias a Dios porque le permite ser un hombre muy activo, emprendedor, atento y carismático. Pedro, vende helados en su casa como chocobananos (bananas recubiertas de chocolates), siberianos (helados de frutas con leche), paletas y sorbete de varios sabores es muy feliz y eso hace que tenga clientes ya que los atiende amablemente, esa es su forma de ganarse la vida honradamente. Con deseos de mejorar su vivienda ha realizado un préstamo a FUSAI para construir una fosa séptica pues la que tiene se esta arruinando y desea mejorarla espera obtener este crédito ya que para él es muy importante tal mejora. Agradece a las personas que de buen corazón le ayudaran y cuenta con la satisfacción de que pronto saldará la deuda obtenida.
texts.en: Pedro is 63 years old and lives happily with his wife.  He is a visionary man who has always had the drive to excel.  Pedro has been living in his own home for the past five years and is grateful to God every day because he is allowed to be an active, enterprising, caring, and charismatic man.  He sells frozen treats from his house such as chocolate covered bananas, “siberianos” (frozen fruit with milk), popsicles, and sorbets of various flavors.  Pedro is very happy, which enables him to provide friendly service to his customers and make an honest living. Wanting to improve his home, Pedro is obtaining a loan from FUSAI so that he can build a septic tank since the one he has is not working.  He hopes to obtain this loan since this is a very important improvement.  Pedro is grateful to the good-hearted people who will help and he plans to repay this debt quickly.

loans.use: to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Manuela Paula

texts.es: Doña Manuela vive en casa propia con sus familiares, ella se dedica hace 7 años a la venta de antojitos como tostadas, papas, yuca y plátanos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues es un alimento muy vendible y ella los vende a un buen precio, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Manuela solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como papas, plátanos, yuca, aceite, repollos, tomates, etc.  con esto espera obtener más ganancias y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuela lives in her own house with her family.  She has been selling snacks like tostadas, potatoes, yucca, and bananas for seven years.  Her business is located close to where she lives.  She has a lot of clientele.  This food is very marketable, and she sells it at a good price.  She manages to pay some of the household expenses with the earnings that she gets.

Manuela is requesting a loan to buy supplies like potatoes, bananas, yucca, cooking oil, cabbage, and tomatoes, etc. for her business.  This way she hopes to get more earnings and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies like potatoes, bananas, yucca, cooking oil, cabbage, and tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres  hijos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de especies, posee mucha clientela que demanda sus productos, gracias a la calidad con que los comercializa, gracias sus venta a logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos. Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de más mercadería relajo, pimienta, olor, achote, etc. por mayor y satisfacer la gran demanda que posee para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandrina lives in her own home with her husband and three children.  She buys and sells spices.  Alejandrina has many customers who demand her products thanks to the quality of what she sells.  Thanks to her sales, she is able to pay for many of her expenses.  

Alejandrina is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise such as spice mixes, pepper, ground spices, annatto, and other products in bulk so that she can the great demand.  This will enable her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy spice mixes, pepper, ground spices, annatto, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Egdda Del Carmen

texts.es: Egdda es originaria de la ciudad de Teustepe, tiene 38 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos. Es comerciante y se dedica a la elaboración de ropa desde hace mucho tiempo, negocio el cual  empezó gracias a su papa ya que fue quien le enseño. Su esposo la apoya en este negocio. Está solicitando el préstamo para comprar: Tela, hilo, botones, alfiler, aguja y una maquina industrial para elaborar mayor cantidad  de pedidos. Este crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y obtener mayores ingresos. Su plan próximo es comprar dos máquinas, vitrinas y exhibidores para dar a conocer sus productos. Su meta futuro es  construir una casa.
texts.en: Egdda is from the town of Teustepe, she is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She is a businesswoman who has made a living making clothes for many years. She began this business thanks to her father, who taught her how to do it. She is supported by her husband. She is requesting the loan to buy material, thread, buttons, pins, needles and an industrial sewing machine so that she can make more clothes. This loan will be very useful since it will allow her to meet the demands of her customers and make higher profits. Her next plan is to buy two machines, showcases and displays to show off her products. Her future goal is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, buttons, pins, needles and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Evelyn Yaneth

texts.es:
La fotografia fue tomada en un cultivo, porqué en ese momento no tenia frutas ni verduras, Para mostrarla en la foto.

Evelyn de 28 años de edad, es bachiller, está casada y su esposo es empleado en el sistema de agua del cantón (fontanero), los dos hijos tiene 9 y 5 años, solo la niña estudia; vive en casa de la madre junto a una hermana, su esposo y sus hijos. 

Desde hace 2 años esta en el comercio, específicamente en la venta de ropa, fue una actividad que nació de su esposo quien le dijo que se dedicara al comercio, antes solo realizaba los oficios domésticos. Ella recorre todo el cantón, ya que la venta la hace de casa en casa, camina grandes distancias.  

Ahora ella, desea diversificar su negocio; por ese motivo solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras, ya que a observado en este comercio puede generar más ganancias, y así en lo personal podrá llevar sus ingresos a la casa y poder tener un nuevo negocio.  Con la inversión podrá generar ganancias y cuidar a sus hijos y brindarles el estudio.
texts.en:
Evelyn is twenty-eight years old and is a high school graduate.  She is married, and her husband is an employee of the the town water system as a plumber.  They have two children, ages 9 and 5, and their daughter is the only one in school.  Evelyn lives in her mother's home, together with her sister, husband, and children.

She has been involved in business for two years, specifically in selling clothing.  This was an activity that her husband suggested.  Before this, she was only involved in domestic chores.  She travels throughout the entire town, doing all of her selling door to door and walking great distances.

She now hopes to diversify her business activity.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables.  She has observed that this business can generate more profits.  She will be able to bring more income home while also having a new business.  

With the investment, she will be able to generate profits, take care of her children, and offer her kids the opportunity to go to school. 

*The photograph was taken in a crop field because in this moment, she does not have fruits or vegetables to show in the picture.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a 65-year-old widower, is a mixed farmer. His children depend fully upon themselves. Joseph has been farming for the past twenty years, with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses for his upkeep.

Joseph is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and manure for his farm. With the expected profit from the business, he will invest in larger-scale farming. His hope and dream is to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and manure for his farm

loans.name: Horacio

texts.es: Horacio, a sus 25 años de edad vive con su pareja en unión libre y es padre de un hijo de 3 años. Actualmente se dedica a laborar como empleado en un aserrío de maderas donde se encargaba de realizar los trabajos con una motosierra que le alquilan ya que la empresa no le da el equipo para trabajar.  Esta actividad la conoció gracias a un amigo que inicialmente le dio la oportunidad de emplearse en este campo. De esta manera ha logrado generar ingresos para solventar los gastos del hogar y las necesidades básicas de su familia. El cliente es un hombre pujante, apasionado por su labor y trabaja arduamente para buscar opciones que le permitan sacar adelante a sus hijo, esto lo motiva a solicitar el crédito que invertirá en la compra de una motosierra y herramientas de trabajo con el ánimo de no continuar pagando alquiler por la máquina para ejercer su trabajo, de esta manera tendrá mayor rentabilidad y mejorará positivamente la entrada de recursos que le permitan seguir avanzando y cumplir el sueño de independizarse, generando los recursos por cuenta propia y manejando su propio tiempo para disfrutar al lado de su familia, de una estabilidad económica favorable y mejores condiciones de vida para él y su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Horacio, 25 years old, lives in a common-law relationship with his partner and is the father of a three year old son. Currently he is employed by a sawmill company where he cuts wood with a chainsaw that he has to rent because the company does not provide the equipment for the job. He heard about this work from a friend who provided him with the opportunity to get employment in this field. In this way, he has been able to earn an income to pay for household expenses and other basic needs of his family.

This client is a vigorous man who loves his job and who works hard to find options that will enable him to help his little boy get ahead. This inspired him to apply for a loan to invest in the purchase of a chainsaw and other work tools so that he will not have to continue renting them to do his work. Thus he will make more of a profit and improve the flow of resources so that he can continue succeeding and realizing his dream of becoming self-employed. He wants to earn a living on his own and manage his time so he can enjoy his family more. In this way he will achieve financial stability and improve his own and his nuclear family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a chainsaw and other work tools.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with seven children, four of whom attend school and the rest are underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

Zawadi sells coconuts. She has been in this business for the last three years. She faces a major challenge of transporting coconuts to her place of operation. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es separado, no tiene hijos, vive en casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario. El trabaja como empleado en INDUSTRIAS VENADO y  por las tardes trabaja de chofer independiente (taxi). Anteriormente solicitó un credito con su esposa pero ahora esta separado 
 Necesita crédito para refaccion de su casa, es asi que es necesario que compre cemento, estuco, arena.
Es la primera vez que Juan acude a Kiva.
texts.en: Juan is separated, has no children, and lives in his own home located in the city of El Alto. He left education after secondary school, and works as an employee in Industrias Venado. In the afternoons, he also works as an independent taxi driver. He previously applied for a loan with his wife, but he's now separated. He needs credit to refurbish his home, so he can buy cement, stucco and sand. This is the first time that Juan is requesting help from Kiva.

loans.use: to refurbish his home.

loans.name: Horonya 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Horonya 2 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Kondia dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits equipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Sitan (2ème femme assise de la droite vers la gauche   dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de   Kondia .Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en: The ten women of Horonya 2 are all married in traditional families. They are on average 47 years old and have four children. They all live in the Kondia village in the Ségou region (4th administratrive region of Mali). They are known for their winter farming, their neighborhood connections, their marriages, and through family in the village. They farm peanuts, millet, and rice. In the goal of buying small equipment and agricultural resources, the group members went to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 3rd loan. Mrs. Sitan (2nd seated woman from the right in the photo) is a leading winter farmer in the village of Kondia. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seed and fertilizer, and to pay young workers to weed her field. She sells her products for cash at the end of the winter to repay her loan and to be able to save up to pay the expenses of her children and her family.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seed, and agricultural resources

loans.name: Horonya 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Horonya 5 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Kondia dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Satou (2ème femme assise de la droite vers la gauche  dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.

In the goal of buying small equipment and agricultural resources, the group members went to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 3rd loan. Mrs. Satou (2nd seated woman from the right in the photo) plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seed and fertilizer, and to pay young workers to weed her field. She sells her products for cash at the end of the winter to repay her loan and to be able to save up to pay the expenses of her children and her family.

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes de Horonya 4 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Kondia dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits equipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Kadia (3ème femme au milieu parmi les assises dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de   Kondia .Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.

They all live in the Kondia village in the Ségou region (4th administratrive region of Mali). They know each other from their winter farming, their neighborhood connections, their marriages, and through family in the village. They farm peanuts, millet, and rice. In the goal of buying small equipment and agricultural resources, the group members went to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 3rd loan. Mrs. Kadia (3rd seated woman in the middle of the photo) is a leading winter farmer in the village of Kondia. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seed and fertilizer, and to pay young workers to weed her field. She sells her products for cash at the end of the winter to repay her loan and to be able to save up to pay the expenses of her children and her family.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seed, and agricultural resources

loans.name: Eliecer Antonio

texts.es: Eliécer tiene 41 años de edad y vive con su pareja en unión libre. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar en su negocio, una carnicería que adquirió en el año 2012 gracias a unos ahorros que tenía y aun crédito que adquirió para ajustar la totalidad del dinero, el establecimiento se encuentra ubicado dentro de un supermercado en el parque principal del municipio donde reside, por lo que ha tenido muy buenos resultados y ha generado ingresos necesarios para suplir los gastos básicos de su familia. El cliente es un hombre trabajador, pujante, se esfuerza día a día para seguir velando por el bienestar de los suyos. Se motiva a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ganado de levante, de esta forma tendrá la capacidad de tener su propia producción de carnes y ahorrar el dinero que invierte comprando la carne día a día. Eliécer sueña con seguir fortaleciendo sus negocios e invertir en más cabezas de ganado, así podrá garantizar una rentabilidad mayor y mejorará las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Eliécer is 41 years old and lives with his common-law wife. Currently he owns a business, a butcher’s shop that he acquired in 2012 thanks to some savings he had and a loan he took out so that he had the total amount of money he needed. His establishment is located inside a supermarket in a principal park of the city where he resides. Consequently he has had very good results and has generated the earnings necessary to pay the basic expenses of his family.

The client is a hard-working, forceful man, who works every day to continue overseeing  the well being of those close to him. He was inspired to apply for a loan in order to purchase cattle to raise so that he will have the capacity to produce his own meat and save the money he spends buying meat everyday. Eliécer dreams of continuing to strengthen his businesses and of investing in more heads of cattle. Thus he will be able to guarantee greater profits and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise.

loans.name: Horonya 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes de Horonya 8 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Kondia dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Baro (1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de   Kondia .Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en: The ten women of Horonya 8 are all married in traditional families. They are on average 35 years old and have three children. They all live in the Kondia village in the Ségou region (4th administratrive region of Mali). They know each other from their winter farming, their neighborhood connections, their marriages, and through family in the village. They farm peanuts, millet, and rice. In the goal of buying small equipment and agricultural resources, the group members went to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 3rd loan. Mrs. Baro (1st seated woman from the left in the photo) is a leading winter farmer in the village of Kondia. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seed and fertilizer, and to pay young workers to weed her field. She sells her products for cash at the end of the winter to repay her loan and to be able to save up to pay the expenses of her children and her family.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seed, and agricultural resources

Mrs. Minata (1st seated woman on the right in the photo) plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seed and fertilizer, and to pay young workers to weed her field. loans.name: Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HUAYNA POTOSI”  iniciará el vigésimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mary es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de medias, venta de polleras, elaboración de macramé, tienda de barrio, venta de ollas, venta de condimentos, costura de chalecos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mary es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de medias y calzas; este negocio lo emprendió al observar la demanda que tienen estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de calzas y medias) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que se realizan.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Huayna Potosi” is starting its 24th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Community Center.  This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Mary as its president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling stockings, selling skirts, producing macramé, managing a neighborhood store, selling pots, selling condiments, and selling vests.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Mary.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago after receiving an invitation from her mother, who is also a member of the organization.  Mary currently has a business of selling stockings and tights.  She started this business after noticing that there was a demand for these products.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital for buying tights and stockings.  She acquires her products at the fairs in the city of La Paz and then sells them from her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to maintain her household.  Mary is widowed and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Mary said that she enjoys the savings she has accumulated.

loans.use: to buy tights and stockings.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо образованная и умная женщина. Она очень позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина, замужем и имеет 3 детей. Она работает медсестрой в одной из  местных клиник. Зарплата, которую она получает не так велика, поэтому она старается как можно экономить. чтобы хватало денег на основные  потребности семьи. Муж Зебо находится в России на заработках, он водит такси. В этом году сын Зебо поступает в университет, он хочет стать финансистом. Зебо очень хочет, чтобы её сын получил хорошее образование и стал лучшим специалистом своего дела. Зебо с мужем, зарабатывая деньги пытались копить деньги на образование своих детей. Но совсем недавно Зебо женила своего старшего сына. И пришлось потратить все накопления на это торжественное событие. Но сейчас Зебо не имеет накопленных средств. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы оплатить обучение сына. Тем болле что сейчас стоимость на образование значительно повысилась. Но тем не менее Зебо верит и надеется, что сможет дать своему сыну возможность обучится и получить высшее образование. Она также надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Zebo is an educated and intelligent woman. She is very positive and hard-working, married, and has three children. She works as a nurse in one of the local clinics. Her salary is not very large, and because of this she tries to economize when possible so that there will be enough money to cover basic family needs. Zebo's husband is in Russia for work; he drives a taxi. This year Zebo's son will start university - he wants to become a financier. Zebo really wants her son to receive a better education and become the best specialist in his field. Zebo and her husband earned money and tried to save for their children's education, but not long ago Zebo married off her oldest son, and had to spend everything they saved on that special occasion. But now Zebo has no savings. She therefore turned to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to pay for her son's education, especially since the cost of education has risen significantly. Zebo nonetheless believes and hopes that she can give her son the opportunity to study and receive a higher education.  She also hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for support.

loans.use: to pay for study

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben es casado, vive en casa de sus familiares  ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario. El trabaja como chofer de maquinaria pesada, percibe un sueldo fijo por ello recogiendo arena para construccion en las diferentes ofras de la ciudad
 Necesita crédito para la compra de motor para su movilidad 
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Ruben is married and lives in his family's home in the city of El Alto.  He went to school up until the secondary level.  He works as a heavy machinery operator, for which he is paid a fixed salary for picking up sand for construction in different areas of the city.

He needs this loan to purchase a vehicle for transportation.  This is the first time he has requested a loan with Kiva.

loans.use: purchase a vehicle.

loans.name: Kotognontala 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes de Kotognontala 2 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de  Fambougou  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Djeneba (2ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village Fambougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.

Mrs. Djeneba (2nd seated woman from the left in the photo) is a leading winter farmer in the Famougou village. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seed and fertilizer, and to pay young workers to weed her field. She sells her products for cash at the end of the winter to repay her loan and to be able to save up to pay the expenses of her children and her family.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seed, and agricultural resources

loans.name: Kelin Mariela

texts.es:
Kelin es una joven de 21 años de edad agricultora y madre de familia de 1 hija el cual es menor de edad y aun non estudia. Ella termino sus estudios en de educación primaria y decidió aprender el cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles desde muy temprana edad. Sus clientes son las personas que viven en los alrededores de la zona donde ella habita como las bodegas y pulperías aledañas. Su único apoyo es su pareja el cual es maestro de educación el cual se desempeña dando clases en una escuela de la zona y al salir se dirige al campo a trabajar en la limpieza, abono y mantenimiento  de su cultivos.

Diariamente ven la necesidad para salir adelante, sacar buenas cosechas y dar un excelente mantenimiento a sus cultivos por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara 50 libras de semilla certificada de frijol para poder cultivarlo, 7 QQ de fórmula 18-46-00 y 5 QQ de urea con los cuales podrá dar una mejor atención y seguridad sus cultivos para obtener buenos ingresos para el desarrollo de su familia y hogar.

Sus planes a futuro son algún día construir su casa de habitación donde ella y su familia puedan estar seguros y con tranquilidad en un hogar propio, darle una excelente educación a su hija para que ella pueda ser una persona de provecho y una mujer prospera en el futuro
texts.en:
Kelin is a 21 year old farmer and mother of 1 daughter who is not yet school aged. She completed her studies in primary education and decided to learn the cultivation of basic grains like corn and beans from an early age. Her customers are people that live in the surrounding area as there are warehouses and grocery stores nearby. Her only support is her partner who is a school teacher in the area and also goes into the fields to work on cleaning, fertilizing and maintaining their crops.

Daily they see the need to get ahead, to have good harvests and give excellent maintenance to their crops. For that they are requesting a loan from the cooperative COMIXMUL with which they will purchase 50 pounds of certified bean seeds in order to cultivate them, 7 QQ (100 lbs.) of 8-46-00 formula and 5 QQ (100 lbs.) of urea with which she will be able to give better attention and security to her crops to obtain better income for the progress of her family and home.
