54-year old Don Juan lives with his wife in their own home. He is a farmer and has grown coffee for ten years. When the beans are ready, he harvests them and puts them into bags as shown in the photograph. Then he sells them in different markets near his home.

Juan is an honest man with a fine credit rating. His coffee is in great demand in the area. Thanks to his job he has managed to support his household. He is now seeking a loan so he can prepare his land and buy fertilizer for the coffee plants. In this way he will be able to earn more money and provide his family with the standard of living they deserve.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for the coffee plants

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie owns and operates a garden in the village of Salimpuno, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer and provides their main source of income. 

Rosalie joined Gata Daku MPC in 2012 and she has borrowed 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her flower garden. While her three children are young, she is saving a portion of her income for their education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her flower garden

loans.name: Brander

texts.en:
Brander is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither piped water nor electricity. She cites school fees as her greatest monthly expense.

Brander has operated a beauty salon business for the past five years. Her potential customers are women.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase hair chemicals, braids, shampoos and hair conditioners for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair chemicals, braids, shampoos and hair conditioners for her business.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en: Jackie is 36 years old and lives in Tappita City of Nimba County, she is married and has five children aged between 3 and 15, for the past three years she has been running a business where she sells many items like pepper, bitter-ball, and plantain among other items. She has a lot of customers and her daily sales are very high during the dry season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter-ball, and plantain for her business, she plans to expand her business and wishes for her children to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter-ball, and plantains

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en: Safia is a 48 year old woman. She is a member of this two person lending group. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. Her husband owns a plumbing shop. He sells a variety of plumbing goods like pipes, sinks, taps, showers, bath tubs, etc. He has a very small shop, in which he has an insufficient amount of goods to sell. He doesn't have enough money to purchase more inventory for his shop. Therefore his wife Safia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase more inventory for her husband's shop. Safia is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of plumbing products for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is married woman with three children, two in school and one underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan she has requested, she wants to purchase sugar, soap, tea leaves, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, tea leaves, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 42 years old and lives in Tappita City of Nimba County, she is a 3rd grade dropout, she is married and has eight children between the ages of 10 and 23 years, only four are in school and live at home.  Her husband is a teacher. For the past 7 years she has been selling dry-bush meat. Some problems she is facing is that during the rainy season, her sales are low. She sells for 12 hours every day. She described her herself as a serious woman. She started this business from her husband salary, and learned business tips from her friends. Her business has enabled her to help support her family which makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry-bush meat for her business. Her plans are to educate all her children and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase dry-bush meat for her business.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a 50 year old married woman. She is a mother of five children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that Sughran is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell. So that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He will put a side some savings amount from the planned profits to pay for their electricity and gas bills. Sughran hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school and one who is still underage. For the past eight years, she has operated a tailoring business. Masika lives at her own house without electricity or running water and her greatest business challenge is seasonality. 

Masika is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase fabric, materials, and thread. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, materials, and thread

loans.name: Aletha

texts.en:
Aletha is 25 years old and lives in Tappita City of Nimba County with her fiancee. They have three children between 1 and 7 years old and two of the children are in school.  They all share a home.  Aletha dropped out in seventh grade.  Her fiancee is a farmer. Since 2007 she has been selling tomatoes, salt, plastic, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tomatoes, salt, plastic, etc. for the business. She sells ten hours per day, six days per week at her business. She describes herself as a businesswoman.

A shortage of goods is the problem she faces in her business.  She learned this business from friends and started it with money from her fiancee. She likes her business because of the way people respond to her business. Her plans are to expand her business, educate her children, and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, salt, plastic, etc. for the business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with no children. For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop where she sells household consumables such as maize flour, cooking oil, soap, sugar, and other items. Esther lives in a rental house with electricity and running water and her greatest business challenge is price fluctuation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, and wheat flour

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman with three children who go to school. She operates a business making food such as beans and chapati to sell to neighbors and passersby. Serah owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Serah is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. In the near future, she dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establishing a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa de un familiar, junto a su madre y su hijo, ella es propietaria de una tienda y una panadería desde hace 6 años, su negocio es muy estable, ella es muy trabajadora, honesta, tiene mucha clientela  gracias a la calidad de sus productos y la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes, ella solicita un crédito para comprar más productos para surtir su tienda como granos básicos, leche, huevos, golosinas, etc. y para mejorar su panadería  y de esta manera satisfacer la gran demanda que posee, obtener mayores ingresos y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This borrower lives in the house of a relative, along with her mother and her son. She has been the proprietor of a store and a bakery for 6 years. Her business is very stable. She is very hard-working and honest. She has many customers thanks to the quality of her products and the friendliness with which she serves her customers. She is applying for a loan to buy more products to stock her store, such as basic foodstuffs, milk, eggs, candies, etc., and to improve her bakery and in this way satisfy the great demand that she has, obtain greater income, and thus give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs, milk, eggs, candies, etc.

loans.name: Jemima's Group

texts.en:
Jemima, standing second from the right in this photo, is the representative of this six-person group loan. Most of the members are married and their average age is 34 and they each have two children. The women all live in the same neighborhood and work buying and selling a variety of merchandise, including cosmetics, plates, corn dough, lining, wax-print, scarves, and bed sheets. Group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution ID-Ghana with the goal of satisfying their fast-growing customer bases. They have successfully repaid previous loans. 

The group is requesting a 2,950 GHS loan to expand their businesses.  Jemima works selling wax-print scarves. Her products are in high demand by her customers and she will use her portion of the loan to purchase wax-print material and scarves wholesale from the central market to resell to customers. She will use the profit from her loan to reinvest in her business and help her husband to meet their household needs.

loans.use: to purchase wax-print material and scarves wholesale from the central market to resell to customers

loans.name: Delmi Azucena

texts.es:
Delmi tiene 25 años de edad ella es una joven mujer con deseos de superarse y sacar sus hijos adelante convirtiéndolos en hombres y mujeres de bien, preparados y de buenos principios. Ella es madre de 3 hijos y en compañía de su pareja se dedican a la siembra de maíz, frijol y arroz desde hace varios años que por medio de esta actividad y estos rubros ha logrado mantener su familia, cubrir los gastos y enviarlos a la escuela. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo económico y moral por parte de sus padres. Su producto al final de la cosecha es comercializado en las bodegas de las zonas aledañas, pulperías y en ocasiones intermediarios que llegan para re vender el producto en otras zonas.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el comprara para extender sus cultivos 40 libras de semilla de maíz certificada, 30 libras de semilla de frijol certificado, 15 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0 y 15 QQ de urea para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a los mismos.

Sus planes a futuro son los de mejorar su área de cultivo ampliarla y fortalecerla ya que de esa forma ella podrá aprovechar para cultivar más producto. Como madre de familia ofrecer un mejor estatus de vida a sus hijos y cumplir su propósito que es dejarles un patrimonio fortalecido y poder enviarlos a la universidad.
texts.en:
Delmi is 25 years old. She has the desire to make herself better and get her children ahead, to turn them into good adults, well-prepared and well-principled. She has three children. Along with her partner she has grown beans, corn and rice for a number of years. By doing this she has been able to maintain her family, pay their bills and send the children to school. She has a degree in Primary Education which she was able to study thanks to the support, both economic and moral, of her parents. 

Delmi has requested a loan from COMIXMUL to buy 40 pounds of certified corn seed, 30 lbs of certified bean seed, 15 quintals of Formula 18-46-0 and 15 quintals of urea to assist and maintain the seeds. At the end of the harvest she sells her product to the warehouses in the surrounding area, small stores and occasionally to intermediaries who then re-sell it in other areas. 

Her future plans are to improve the land she cultivates, expand it and make it more productive and in this way she can harvest more. As the mother of a family she would like to offer a higher living standard to her children and leave them a strong estate, and be able to send them to university.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for the maintenance of her fields.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 30years old, lives in the small village of Telavi with his wife, mother and two infant daughters. The only source of income for the family is the small salary George earns as a physical worker. Because his income is not stable and inadequate for the family, he decided to start his own business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 


The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor and inexperienced to get a loan to start or re-start business ventures. George's application for a loan of 550 Gel was approved under the framework of this program. He will use the loan to purchase a motorbike to transport wood from the forest to resell. This, along with his job as a manual laborer, will generate a stable income, thereby giving him a real opportunity to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to transport wood

loans.name: Farruh

texts.en:
Farruh is married and has two children. It is important for him to provide his family with a good quality of life. Therefore, Farruh began a transportation business eight years ago. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. His hard work has helped to improve his family’s quality of life and now his children are able to get a good education and the family’s financial challenges are being solved little by little. 

Farruh is requesting a loan to make a party in his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to organize a party

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 25 years old and lives in Tappita City of Nimba County. She is single and has a four-year-old child who lives at home and is currently in school.

For two years Catherine has been involved in the egg business. She makes a good profit and has many customers since she is the only one who sells eggs by card and retail.

She sells 12 hours per day six days per week. She describes herself as a businesswoman. She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs by the carton for her business. She hopes to see her child receive a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase eggs by the carton for her business.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 50 years old and is married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emelie is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emelie has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 38 years old and married with seven children, six of whom are in school. For the past 14 years, she has run a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Analyn is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy the raw materials for mat weaving. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for mat weaving

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old and married with seven children. Three of her children are in school. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gloria has been farming vegetables for two years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream – to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

Gloria is borrowing 2,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies .

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 47 years old and is married with 10 children.  Three of her children are in school.

Divina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 4000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Divina has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from nipa making.

Divina aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Садбарг 42 года. Она вдова и сама воспитывает своих 3 детей. Ее дети Мехрона, Фахриддин и Райхона еще не совершеннолетние. Садбарг более 3 лет работает в цехе по производству лепешек. Она каждый месяц получает зарплату и тратит для покупки продуктов питания и образование своих детей. Она уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Она не имеет возможностей купить строительные материалы сделать ремонт, так как она получает маленькую зарплату. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, кирпич, а также для оплаты мастеров по ремонту дома. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Sadbarg is 42 years old.  She is a widow and raises her children by herself.  Her three children's names are Mehrona, Fahriddin and Raihona and they are still minors.  For more than three years now, she has been working in a shop making small cakes.  She receives a monthly salary which she uses to buy food and to send her children to school.

Sadbarg's has been thinking about repairing her house for a few years now, as it is in poor condition.  However, due to her small income, she cannot afford to buy the building materials necessary to perform those repairs.

She is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy building materials such as cement and bricks and also to pay the builders who will repair her house.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your charity.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and bricks, and to pay the builders.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jonalyn works hard to support her family. She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from selling food. Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.

Jonalyn is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of purified drinking water to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 37 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Divina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino is 35 years old. She lives in the Marneuli district with her husband and six children. Tsitsino’s husband is a cook and is the only one who makes money in the household. The family lives below the poverty line and gets a small amount of monthly social assistance from the government. The existing income is not enough to cover the everyday costs of such a large family. 

Tsitsino is unemployed at the moment. She has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but she hasn't had any success. She wants to start a bakery and a confectionery, but her loan request has always been rejected in the past because of her lack of experience, which is usually required by local credit providers. 

Tsitsino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions to vulnerable poor people, who do not have access to regular credit products. These vulnerable poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With her credit, Tsitsino will start her own confectionery shop. She has already rented a store with all of the necessary equipment, and she needs money to purchase raw materials for baking cookies and cakes. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to start a bakery and confectionery

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 48 years old and lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire.  Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. Nimba also has the second highest population in Liberia. Oretha is married and has five children between the ages of four and 22; only four of her children are presently in school and two of them live at home. She did not attend school due to some financial problems according to her parents. 

Oretha has been selling red oil in the local market for the past year. She has a lot of customers and makes lots of profit every day. Oretha is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil. In the future, she plans to expand her business and educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase red oil for her business

loans.name: Nasyan

texts.en:
Nasyan is 21 years old and married with two children. For the past two years, she has worked selling milk. Nasyan has one cow and sells milk to many of her neighbors along with butter that she makes. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. Nasyan is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing.  It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with their support to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

Nasyan is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan to purchase another cow. She hopes that her loan will increase her capacity to produce milk and ultimately generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been stitching clothes for the past two years. Shameem sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, Shameem requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, as well as packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may generate a healthier income. Shameem is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, as well as packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 46-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for many years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Nasreen sells milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She has five children, and she is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life. Nasreen has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. This is her second year with Kashf Foundation.

Nasreen is happily running her business, but she needs money to purchase another buffalo. So, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat, age 51, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals - baby goats and calves - at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. Musarat makes enough through her business to contribute to her family's income. However, she needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses efficiently. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, Musarat will definitely expand her business and increase her income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children.  She has been operating a business making boxes for many years. With the passage of time, Azra has improved her business and gained a lot of regular customers. This is her third year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with its support. Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy bundles of thick paper and cardboard at lower rates from the market to enable her to complete orders on time. Azra hopes to have an increase in sales. She wants to use the earned profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy bundles of thick paper and cardboard.

loans.name: Theres

texts.en:
Theres is 30 years old and lives in Ganta city, one of the most talked-about cities in Nimba county, which is the second largest populated county in Liberia.  She is married and her husband is not working. Theres and her husband have four children between the ages of five and 15. Her children are presently attending school and they all live at home. For the past three years, Theres has been selling clothes such as blouses, tee-shirts, jeans and other items. She enjoys her business because of the profit she makes every day. Theres did not attend school.  

Theres is requesting a loan to purchase additional clothing such as blouses, tee-shirts, and jeans. Her plan is to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as blouses, tee-shirts, and jeans

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a vigorous 34-year-old lady. She has been working in business of clothes sales for a period of about three years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. After purchasing cloth, she stitches clothes for ladies and children and then sells them to the people of her community and earns a good amount to contribute to her family's income. 

By this time Saira has attained good number of customers, but due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. Saira intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread, along with bundles of cloths in different colors. This will help her to sew more dresses on time to generate a healthier income. In addition to repaying the loan, Saira will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, along with bundles of cloths in different colors.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a 28-year-old married woman. She, along with her husband, has been in the business of making artificial jewelery for many years. The business has great potential for growth and Munira is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them. 

In order to meet orders on time and boost her sales, Munira applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 through Kashf to buy materials such as silver and gold, as well as artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to get an increase in her income and wishes to spend part of the profits on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy materials such as silver and gold, as well as artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Ma. Andralyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ma. Andralyn works hard to support her family. She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products and charcoal retail. 

Ma. Andralyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her nipa roofing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through one past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her nipa roofing business.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra is 51 years old and married with five children. For the past 20 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from having a computer gaming station. Petra works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF.

Petra is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, cooking oil, eggs, and other items. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, cooking oil, eggs, and other items

loans.name: Alma Fe

texts.en:
Alma Fe works hard to support her family. Alma Fe is single and selling footwear in the Philippines.

Alma Fe requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more footwear to sell. She has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

In the future, Alma Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. Susana has a live-in partner and has a rug-making business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for making rugs. Susana has been in this business for three years now.

Susana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for making rugs

loans.name: Ely Maribel

texts.es:
Ely es una joven mujer con muchas fuerzas, mucha alegría y muchos deseos de salir adelante con 24 años de edad ella ve y confía mucho en lo que a diario realiza en compañía de su compañero de hogar ya que desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra por medio de sus padres especializándose en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol. Ella es madre de un hijo el cual es menor y depende de ella el aun no asiste a la escuela. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo el cual pudo terminar gracias al apoyo financiero y moral por parte de sus padres a quien ella agradece la enseñanza y disciplina inculcada desde muy joven. Sus clientes son las bodegas, pulperías e intermediarios que llegan a la zona para comprar y re vender en otras zonas.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a COMIXMUL el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a sus cultivos a fortalecerse y evitara que sean contaminados y dañados por bichos entre otros. 

Los planes a futuro son los de hacer mejoras a su casa de habitación ya que son necesarias reparaciones como el  techo y repello en las paredes evitando así la humedad y al mismo tiempo enfermedades respiratorias. Sus prioridades son para con su hijo brindarle una excelente educación darle la oportunidad y apoyarlo para que el asista a la universidad y pueda ser una mejor y preparada persona.
texts.en:
Ely is a young woman of 24 years with a lot of strength, happiness and desire to get ahead. She believes in what her and her partner do every day. She learned from her parents about working the land from a very early age, especially the growing of basic grains like beans and corn. She is the mother of one child, who depends on her and does not yet attend school.She has a degree in Primary Education which she could finish thanks to the moral and financial support of her parents, to whom she is grateful for the teachings and discipline instilled in her when she was young. 

Ely has requested a loan from COMIXMUL which she will use to buy agricultural supplies to help strengthen her crops and protect them from being invaded and damaged by insects, etc. She will sell her harvest to warehouses, stores and intermediaries who come to her area and then re-sell in other areas.  

Her future plans are to fix up her house. The roof needs work on it and the walls have to be whitewashed to keep out the humidity and avoid respiratory diseases. Her priorities with her son is to give him an excellent education. And give him the opportunity and support to attend university, so he can be a well prepared, better person.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 25-year-old married woman who financially helps her husband. Four years ago, she took the initiative in her area and started a school that offers educational services to poor students at cheap rates so they can have a better future. Nazia is satisfied by doing this sort of business as it is beneficial for her household and society as a whole. 

Nazia applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 through Kashf Foundation to purchase furniture, such as chairs and tables, for her school to accommodate more students. She is hopeful to have more students in her academy in the coming days.

loans.use: to purchase furniture, such as chairs and tables, for her school.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Merly works hard to support her family. Three of her children are in school. Merly runs a junk-shop business in the Philippines. She has been sustaining her business activities with a previous loan from NWTF.

Merly is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy recycled materials to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 38-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is presently unmarried and has four children between the ages of nine and 19. Rebecca describes herself as hardworking. She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire.  Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region.  It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

For the past five years, Rebecca has run a restaurant where she sells rice and soup. She started her business with money from her husband and she works 13 hours a day. Rebecca’s greatest business challenge is the price of rice and oil. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice and oil for her business. Rebecca likes her business because it keeps her busy and she hopes to one day to buy a car.
  
Rebecca is grateful for your support!

loans.use: o buy more rice and oil

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 49-year-old man, living with his spouse and 19-year-old daughter in the Gori District. David’s daughter is a consultant at the local supermarket and makes a small monthly income. David is jobless at the moment. He has recently returned from Russia, where he used to work as a car mechanic. He tirelessly sought a job, but there is a high unemployment rate in the region and it is very hard to find a suitable one. That's why he decided to start his own business.

With this start-up credit David will rent a workshop, purchase all the needed equipment, and set up an auto repair shop. He will work as a tinman and serve the local drivers in return for a fee. David hopes that his business initiative will be lucrative and he will make his family members' life easier.

loans.use: to start up an auto repair shop

loans.name: Lismarly

texts.es: Lismarly es originaria de Siuna. De 33 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y servicio de molino desde hace 2 años, actividad que ha realizado con esfuerzo y dedicación para el bienestar de su familia. Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso  la ayuda económica que recibe de su esposo. Su expectativa es prosperar y superarse con el fin de obtener mayor inventario en su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como: Arroz, azúcar, frijoles, gaseosas, golosinas y darle mantenimiento al molino. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en:
Lismarly is 33 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is originally from Siuna. She is a business person. She has a small store and mill service which she had had for the past two years. She has achieved this through hard work and dedication for the well-being of her family. She also has financial support from her husband. Her hopes are to  be successful and get ahead with the goal of better stocking her business. 

Lismarly is requesting this loan to buy products like to buy rice, sugar, beans, soft drinks, sweets and do maintenance work on her mill. Her plan is to improve the infrastructure of her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, soft drinks, sweets and do maintenance work on her mill.

loans.name: Georgen

texts.en:
Georgen works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fitness gymnasium in the Philippines.

Georgen requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her gymnasium. She has been in this business for twelve years.

In the future, Georgen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her gymnasium.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is a single mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a stone quarrying business and has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more hammers and pangas. She has been in this business for 10 years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She sells at retail six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the law enforcement officer. She is hoping to invest in used clothes. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more hammers and pangas

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a young Cameroonian, age 27, married with three children. The oldest is in primary school, while the youngest is just 8 months old. He has been in his business for the past ten years, which makes him very experienced and stable. This business is successful because it is located in an urban area and more so because of the experience he has gained over time. He is likely to succeed because mobile phones are a new phenomenon where he is located, so many people are anxiously buying and repairing their mobile phones. This loan will help him open two new phone-repairing shops.

loans.use: to buy new software for phone repairs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Compound #3 of Grand Bassa County. She is 34 years old, married and has seven children between 8 and 18 years old. They all live at home and her children are attending school. For 15 years now, she has been running a table business selling fish in the local market. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish for her business. She wants to educate her children and expand her business for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Hemeterio

texts.es: El señor Hemeterio, es una persona de 32 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, cuenta con cuatro dependientes económicos a cargo, los cuales son sus pequeños hijos, vive en su propio domicilio de tipo rustico construido con material local, que se halla situado en el Comunidad de Tíraque, la actividad económica que se dedica es la agricultura, en tal entendido produce anualmente los siguientes productos agrícolas, papa 120 cargas, haba (verde) 70 cargas, arveja (verde) 40 arrobas, maíz (grano) 15 cargas, trigo (grano) 15 quintales, avena (forraje) 30 calchas, por la venta de estos productos genera sus ingresos económicos y con ello sostiene a su familia, el préstamo solicitado requiere para capital de operación para la compra de insumos agrícolas, y de esa manera en el futuro incrementar sus ingresos y de esa forma mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hemeterio is 32 years old, single, and finished primary school. He has the responsibility of four economic dependents, who are his small children. He lives in his own home of the rustic type, constructed with local materials, which is located in Tíraque Community. He works in agriculture, in which he produces annually the following agricultural products: 120 bundles of potatoes, 70 bundles of fava beans, 40 arrobas (unit of measure equal to 25 pounds) of peas, 15 bundles of corn, 15 quintales (unit of measure equal to 100 pounds) of wheat, 30 calchas (unit of measurement) of oats. 

He generates his income through the sale of these products, and with it he supports his family. The requested loan requires operating capital to purchase agricultural supplies, and in this way in the future increase his income, and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is a 25-year-old married man. He lives in Kutaisi district with his wife, infant daughter, parents, and grandmother. His grandmother is provided with retirement pension. Teimuraz and his father are artisans; they get orders to renovate houses. 

As the income is not stable and not enough for such a big family, Teimuraz decided to start his own business and seek credit among local financial institutions. His attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The Start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $3,000. 

He will purchase auto spare parts at wholesale prices and then resell them at higher prices. This will increase the income of his family. With the increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. The new business initiative will give Teimuraz a chance to have financial stability and monthly income.

loans.use: to begin trade with auto spare parts.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Анвар добрый и честный человек. Ему 48 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Старшему 21 года, а младшему 15 лет. Он вместе с семьей живет бедно, так как он является единственным кормильцем в семье. Его жена домохозяйка. Анвар более 15 лет занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур как рис, баклажан, репа и т.п. Он имеет большой опыт по земледелию. Данное время он выращивает сельхоз культур на 1 га и 15 соток земли. Анвар с полученного дохода начал стройку дома, но не достроил свой дом, так как у него не хватило денег. В этом году он хочет достроить свой дом. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для постройки дома. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Anvar is a kind and honest person.  He is 48 years old.  He is married and is raising two children.  His oldest child is 21 years old and the youngest one is 15 years old.  Because Anvar is the sole breadwinner for his entire family, they struggle financially.  His wife is a homemaker.  For more than 15 years Anvar has been cultivating crops such as rice, eggplants and turnips.  He has a lot of experience in farming.  Currently, he is growing vegetables on 1.15 hectares of land.  Using the profits from his farming, Anvar began to build a house, but he was unable to finish its construction when the money ran out.  This year, he wishes to complete the construction of his home.  He is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to purchase the building materials needed to complete his house.  He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials for the construction of his house

loans.name: Abdukomil

texts.ru: Абдукомил трудолюбивый человек. Ему 43 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и поэтому Абдукомил является основным кормильцем семьи. Абдукомил более 17 лет работает в государственной организации. Он является одним из лучших работников и выполняет свою работу на высшем уровне. Абдукомил планирует отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег. Его дом старый и имеет плохое состояние. Он срочно должен отремонтировать свой дом, но наступления холодов. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Abdukomil is a hardworking 43-year-old man.  He is married and raises five children.  His wife is a homemaker, so Abdukomil is the only breadwinner in his family.  He has been working for a public  administration for more than 17 years.  He is one of the best employees there and he carries out his duties at a very high level of competence.

Abdukomil is planning to renovate his house, but he doesn't have the money to do so.  He lives in an old house which is in poor condition.  He urgently needs to repair his house before the beginning of the cold season.  He is asking for a loan of 4,500 somoni to buy building materials such as cement and wood.  He is awaiting your kindness and relying on your charity.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood to repair his house.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy raw materials for the extension of her boarding house. Rosalie has been in this business for 12 years. Rosalie earns more income from land rental. Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the extension of her boarding house.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar is 66 years old. He lives with his mother in a small village in Sagarejo district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Eldar has a car and serves local people as a taxi driver. As his income is not stable, Eldar decided to begin an additional business and seek credit among local financial institutions. His attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The Start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $1300. 

With the received credit, he will begin trading in vegetables. He will purchase stocks of groceries and transport them to different villages to resell. This will give him a chance to generate additional income and improve his living conditions. 

This credit will be a great support for the family. Eldar is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to begin trading in vegetables.

loans.name: Eliso

texts.en:
Eliso is a 34-year-old single woman and lives in the Terjola district with her mother, brother, sister-in-law and two nephews. Eliso’s mother works as a cleaner at the local financial institution; her brother is employed at the regional sport palace; and her sister-in-law works at the municipality. They get monthly salaries but existing revenues are very small and not enough to cover everyday expenses. 

Eliso decided to start trading. She requested a loan from the local credit providers, but they usually demand some stable income from the borrowers. Eliso’s credit requests were rejected several times as she didn’t satisfy their requirements. She received this credit within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the so-called "Start-up Program" that gives rural poor the chance to start or re-start their businesses. With this loan of 1,200 USD, she will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and resell it in her community door-to-door. It is obvious that the work is hard for Eliso, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. The start-up credit will be a great support for the family as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: As a single mother of two children, Rowena works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Rowena is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to resell to her customers. Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to resell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a gown rentals business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional gowns to rent.

Lilia has been in this business for seven years. Lilia earns more income from general store.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional gowns to rent.

loans.name: Jenylyn

texts.en:
Jenylyn is 33 years old and married with two children.

Jenylyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jenylyn has borrowed and paid a loan from NWTF before. She has been running the general store for 13 years and earns an income from selling personal products.

Jenylyn aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in the small village of the Tianeti district. Her husband works at the local government municipality and gets a small monthly income. Dali runs a shop. She needs money to purchase additional stock of groceries and sought credit from local financial institutions; however, her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. 

The start-up program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting their businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the received credit, Dali will purchase additional stock for her shop, offer her clients a wide assortment of products, and thus increase sales and income. With the increased income, she will be able to expand her business in the future and thus improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her shop.

loans.name: Alizhon

texts.ru: Алижон 47 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Он работает в заводе по разработки алюминий. Алижон выполняет свою работу отлично, и все его сотрудники очень любят и уважают его. Алижон является единственным кормильцем семьи и поэтому ему трудно справляться одному с семейными расходами. Его сын хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию, так как он не имеет место работы на родине. Алижон должен купить авиабилет для своего сына, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1600 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Alizhon is 47 years old.  He is married and raising three children.  He works in an aluminum manufacturing plant and does an excellent job there.  He is very much liked and respected by all his co-workers.

As the only breadwinner in his family, Alizhon finds it difficult to meet all of his family's expenses on his own.  His son now wants to go to Russia because he cannot find work in his country.  Alizhon needs to buy a plane ticket for him, but he doesn't have enough money to do so.  He is therefore asking for a loan of 1,600 somoni to buy a plane ticket for his son.  He is awaiting your kindness and relying on your charity.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for his son.

loans.name: Princess Unique

texts.en: Princess Unique works hard to support her family. Princess Unique is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Princess Unique requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production. Princess Unique has been in this business for one year now and also earns additional income from clothing sales. In the future, Princess Unique would like to save money to expand her business. She is a transgender client.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Gbassay

texts.en:
Meet 19-year-old Gbassay from Tombo in the Western Area Rural District near Freetown. She is single without children. After the death of her mother, she decided to start a business. Gbassay established her bread business at her house. She began her business because she was trained in business. She needs to generate income to support her younger sisters and brother. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge of her business is lack of capital to run her business.

Gbassay requires a loan in order to buy bread to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, Gbassay plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bread to expand her business.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 28 years old. He lives in the Tskaltubo District with his father and a brother. His brother is a builder and works on special orders to earn a small monthly income. Koba and his father are involved in the agricultural business. Specifically, they have a milk cow and two calves. They produce cheese from the milk and sell it locally. Koba is very hard-working and the type of person who has a great desire to get ahead.

With this loan, Koba will purchase all the building materials for a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built properly, Koba will grow greens and tomatoes, and harvested products will be sold for a good price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family income, and all members will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: María Angela

texts.es: La cliente vive en Machala.  Empezó en esta actividad cuando decidió ir de casa en casa de vecinas y conocidas realizando manicure y pintando uñas.  Ahora pudo montar su local propio y las clientes la buscan en su domicilio.  Es madre soltera y tiene 2 niños pequeños, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal de su zona.  Desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de materiales e insumos de gabinete.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Machala.  She started her business when she decided to go house-to-house and provide manicure and nail polish services to her neighbors and acquaintances.  She now has her own shop in her home where customers can find her.  The borrower is a single and has two young children who attend a state school in the area.  

She wants to invest her loan in the purchase of salon supplies and materials.

loans.use: to buy salon supplies and materials.

loans.name: Johnaby

texts.en:
Johnaby is 37 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

Johnaby works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Johnaby has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year. She also earns an income from frozen foods.

Johnaby aspires to save money to expand her business and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey is from Lusaghbyur village, where he lives with his wife and two little sons. 

Andrey is a policeman who has worked at local police station for many years. Together with his work, Andrey is also involved in an agricultural business. Currently, he keeps livestock (pigs, chickens, cows, and sheep) and cultivates wheat, barley, and grass. Andrey's wife doesn't work, as she takes care of their little children, so Andrey is the only breadwinner of the family. 

As it is very difficult for Andrey to manage the farming business and his work as a policeman, he needs help. By applying for this loan, Andrey asks for $2,000 in order to hire workers who will gather his harvest. The loan will also be used for purchasing forage for feeding the livestock and also wheat seeds for increasing the cultivation process. The loan is very important for Andrey to be able to continue his farming business and improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock, and wheat seeds, and to hire workers for gathering the harvest.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 49 years old and married with one kid. Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries and herbal medicines to resell at her store. Mary Jane has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from room rentals and selling herbal medicines. Mary Jane aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and herbal medicines to resell at her store.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Meet 30-year-old Isatu from Tombo in the Western Area Rural District near Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 5 years and 8 years old. Her children are currently attending school. After she got married, Isatu established her rice business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy a bag of rice for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and establish a permanent business location. In the future, Isatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice for resale.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Binta from Tombo (Western Area Rural District) near Freetown. She is married with two children. After her wedding, Binta established her cookery business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at her business ten hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business lack of enough capital to run her business.

Binta requires a loan in order to buy more rice, onions, and cooking seasonings for her business. She hopes that the extra income resulting from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Binta plans to own a full restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, onions, and cooking seasonings to prepare dishes for her business.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 38 years old and lives in Compound #3 with her eight children between the ages of 12 and 20, who are in school and live at home. For the past 14 years, she has been selling bread. Some problem she faces is the high price of flour. She says she makes a lot of profit since she is one who sells different kinds of bread. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. She is requesting a loan to buy more flour, butter, etc., for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more flour, butter, etc., for her bread business.

loans.name: Grace Wambui

texts.en:
Grace is married with three children, all in primary school. She and her husband practice farming; they grow coffee and keep dairy cows on zero grazing. Seasonally, they are also employed as casuals at a tea farm to pick tea, and this supplements what they get from the farming business. With three children in school, they barely have enough to save and have electricity installed for them. 

Their source of energy for lighting is kerosene, and for cooking it is firewood and charcoal. Every month, they spend at least $35 on purchasing fuel, and this is a huge sacrifice, since they have to cook and the children need light to study in the evening.  

With their four cows, Grace can be able to save this money and enjoy cleaner, better, cheaper fuel for cooking and lighting by having a bio-digester constructed for her. With a loan VEP hopes to assist Grace in getting this bio-digester. In addition to cleaner fuel, she will also be using the bio-slurry to grow fodder and food crops so that she can also save money used on buying manure from other farmers. This will increase her crop production, and we hope in the future, she can start up a business of selling green groceries.

loans.use: To construct a bio-digester.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Lucy from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. Two of her children are going to school. 

After the death of her mother, Lucy established her cookery business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge for her business is lack of enough capital to run it.

Lucy requires a loan in order to buy more rice, onions, and cooking seasonings for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Lucy plans to own a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, onions, and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 43 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She lives with her husband and three children between the ages of 24 and 26; all three of them are in school. She been selling red oil, pepper, salt etc for the past 2 years in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper, salt etc for her business, She likes her business because it helps to support her home.  She hopes one day to own a house.  
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, pepper and salt for her business

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie lives in Buchanan. She is 33 years old, and married with six children between the ages of 1 and  13; only four are in school and they all live at home. She did not go to school. For twenty years she has been selling rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra and palm oil in the local market. She started this business  with money given to her by her mother and learned it from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra and palm oil for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es: Doña Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable vive en casa propia tiene una buena estabilidad domiciliaria  es muy amable y por su atención hacia los clientes a logrado alcanzar una buena clientela en lo que es su negocio de tienda , ella ahora solicita un  crédito para poder invertirlo en su negocio y poder hacer las compra de lo que son mas productos como: detergentes, cereales, bebidas, granos básicos, azúcar, golosinas, entre otros, es por esa razón que ella desea invertir en su negocio para poder ofrecer una amplia variedad en su tienda y de igual manera generarse mayores ingresos y ganancia para alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hard working and responsible woman. She lives in her own house and her home is well established. She is very kind and her attentiveness towards customers has earned her a good clientele base at her store.

Maria requests a loan to invest in her business and make purchases of more products such as: detergents, cereals, drinks, basic grains, sugar and sweets, among other things. She wishes to invest in her business in order to offer a wide variety in her store. In this manner she will generate greater income and earnings to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase items such as detergents, cereals, drinks, basic grains, sugar and sweets.

loans.name: Maron

texts.en:
Maron is a Liberian.  She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish.  In addition, many logging companies are located in the city.  People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 
Maron is 22, single, with two children aged 3 and 7 who are currently living at home and attending school.  
Maron has a table business and has been selling fresh fish in the local market for the past two years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more fresh fish for her business.  On average, she works eight hours each day at her business from Monday to Saturday.  She started her business with a small amount of money from her fiancée. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the money she makes.  In the future, she would like to build a house.  
She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Macario

texts.es: El señor Macario, es una persona de 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo estudiar hasta el bachillerato, vive en la casa de su padre en la comunidad de Tiraque, tiene tres dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos, La actividad económica del señor Macario es la producción agrícola, que en promedio anualmente manifiesta que realiza la venta de los siguientes productos y en las cantidades siguientes: Papa 40 cargas, Arveja (verde) 38 arrobas, Avena 30 calchas, Trigo (Grano) 9 cargas. Cebada (Grano) 10 cargas. La siembra de estos cultivos lo realiza en terrenos de sus padres sin costo alguno en una superficie de 3 hectáreas los terrenos mencionados con anterioridad se hallan situados en la misma comunidad, los trabajos agrícolas los realiza con la colaboración  de sus vecinos, vive en una casa rustica de adobe, con este préstamo que solicita comprara abono de gallinaza y comprara semilla de papa; así con la producción  en el futuro mejorara sus condiciones económicos y por tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Macario is 27 years old, single, and managed to finish high school. He lives at his father's, in the village of Tiraque, and has three children he raises on his own. Macario is a farmer, and reports that he sells, annually, a mean of 40 loads of potatoes, 38 loads of green peas, 30 loads of oats, 9 loads of wheat, and 10 loads of barley. He grows these crops on fields owned by his parents, so it does not cost him anything to use the land. The 3 hectares of land are located in the same village where they live. The whole community helps each other for agricultural work. Macario lives in a rustic house built out of sun-dried brick. He will use the loan to buy chicken guano and potato seeds, in order to improve his economic situation by selling the harvest, so as to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken guano and potato seeds.

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is from Bandivan village in the Shirak region. He is an attractive farmer with many years of experience in this field. Currently, he works as a grazier and breeds his co-villagers' livestock. This provides Artyom with income, which is very important for him to sustain his family. Artyom lives with his wife and is a father of three children (shown in the photo). Besides working as a grazier, Artyom runs his own farm. It includes chickens, calves and cows.

Artyom asked for a loan to purchase three calves and wheat seeds. As this is Artyom's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Thus, this loan is very important for Artyom to enlarge his farm and be able to ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy three calves and wheat seeds

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah from Liberia.  She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish.  In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city.  People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 
Sarah is 34, married with two children aged 1 and 10.  They all are currently living at home and only one is in school. Sarah has owned her own small local shop business selling soap, flour, sugar, rice etc for the past 10 years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more goods such as soap, flour, sugar and rice. On average, she works 12 hours per day at her business from Monday to Saturday.  She started her business with a small amount of money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the profit.  In the future, she would like to build a modern house.  
She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as soap, flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: El señor Zenón es casado más de 32 años, tienen 2 hijos dependientes que estudian, la familia vive en la comunidad de Colomi hace 42 años, es una familia humilde de bajos recursos económicos. El señor Zenón y su esposa se dedican a la producción agrícola, tienen  ingresos económicos de la venta de sus productos agrícolas los cuales son estacionales dentro del año, de esta forma el junto a su esposa mantienen a su familia, cuenta con 4 cabezas de ganado vacuno de trabajo (2 pares de yunta) que los utilizan en las faenas agrícolas, el señor Zenón necesitan crédito para compra de insumos agrícolas abono orgánico (gallinaza) y productos agroquímicos, no tienen para comrpar estos insumos ya que sus ahorros los invirtieron en la compra de techo para su vivienda. El señor Zenón trabajara arduamente  para ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos hasta que salgan profesionales y  tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Zenón is a 32-year old married man who has 2 dependent children attending school. They have lived in Colomi for 42 years and have limited financial resources. Zenón and his wife work in agriculture and earn income from selling their seasonal products. This is how they both support their family. They have 4 cows that are used to work in the land. 

Zenón needs financial assistance to buy farming supplies, such as organic fertilizer and agrochemical products. They have invested their savings in their house ceiling and don't have more resources to spend. Zenón works hard to pay his children's tuition, to help them until they start their professional careers and to provide them with a better future.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 30-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is married and has three children between the ages of 1 and 17 years old.  Two of the children are currently attending school and they all live at home.  She completed 7th grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a hard working woman.

She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.
 
Rebecca has had a cook shop business (restaurant), which sells rice and soup for the past 10 years.  She works from 7 am to 6 pm each day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is limited income. She intends to use the loan to buy more rice, pepper, onion, oil, fish, meat, etc. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day to own a house. 
 
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, onion, oil, fish, meat, etc

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Please meet 40-year-old Hawa from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.
 
Hawa did not go to school and she is married.  She describes herself as a hard working woman. Her spouse works as a security man.  They have three children between 2 and 16 years old, only two of whom are in school and live at home. 

Hawa has a table where she sells fish.  She has been in business for two years and works from Monday to Saturday, spending 10 hours per day.  With this loan, she will buy more fish.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is to increase her sales.  She transports her goods by taxi.  She started her business with money from her husband.  She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house.  She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Marthline

texts.en:
Marthaline is a 32-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is unmarried and has five children, aged between 3 and 19.  Only four are currently attending school and they all live at home.  She was unfortunate not to attend school.  She describes herself as a hard working woman.
She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 
Marthaline has a table business which has been selling palm oil, soap, pepper, milk, sardine, etc for the past four years.  She works from 8am to 5pm every day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is making enough income. She intends to use the loan to buy more palm oil, soap, pepper, milk, sardine, etc for her business. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because it helps to support her family.  She hopes to one day own a house.  
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, soap, pepper, milk and sardines for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Please meet Elizabeth. She is 39 years old. Buchanan is the capital City of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Elizabeth did not go to school and is married. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She has three children between the ages of 11 and 9.  They are in school and live at home. 

Elizabeth has a table business which sells toothpaste, soap, candles, etc. She has been in business for three years and works 10 hours each day at her business. With this loan, she will buy toothpaste, soap, candles etc. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is less income. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, soap, candles, etc.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida, es una mujer trabajadora de 26 años, que está casada con Percy. Ambos tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Hace 5 años empezó con la agricultura,está es su principal actividad económica ya que desde las primeras horas del día, Alida cuida de sus cultivos de papa, alverja y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta a ella es estar junto a su familia. De igual manera, le agrada vender su producción en el mercado mayorista de de su localidad. Pero como padre responsable su esposo, también se dedica al arado de la tierra con los 2 toros que poseen; ganando un buen dinero diario. Ahora ella desea mejorar sus sembríos, pues los planes son aprovechar al máximo su cosecha de flor de gladiolo que se encuentra en la mitad de su crecimiento. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
