Alida, invertirá los S/.3500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Alida is a 26 year old hardworking woman.  She is 26 years old and married to Percy.  They have three children and live in their own home.  She began farming five years ago and this is their main financial activity.  Aida cares for the crops, potatoes, peas and gadiolo flowers, from the first daylight hours.  What she likes the best is being close to her family.  She also likes selling her harvest in the large local market.  As a responsible farmer she is also responsible for plowing the land with the two bulls they have, earning them a good daily income.  Now she wants to improve her crops and take maximum advantage of the gladilo flower harvest, which is half way through its growth cycle.  This will be her fourth loan through Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is getting.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  Aida will use the S/ 3,500 Soles to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, es un hombre soltero y trabajador de 34 años, que vive en compañía de sus padres en su casa propia. Como joven tiene muchas ambiciones. Estudió Farmacia en un instituto reconocido de la localidad; pero sus deseos son consolidarse en un negocio propio, por ello hace 5 años comenzó a dedicar su tiempo y sus fuerzas en la agricultura. En los terrenos de sus padres siembra una variedad de productos como: alverja, papa y flor de gladiolo a gran escala. Asimismo, tiene un botiquín lleno de medicinas, que vende a los pobladores de su localidad cuando se sienten enfermos. En todo este tiempo le fue muy bien, tanto así; que logró obtener un auto propio con el que también hace trasporte público. Ahora consiente de que el precio de venta de los productos en el mercado central de su ciudad son muy buenos, desea mejorar la calidad de sus productos. Por eso comenzó a buscar tierras nuevas y descansadas para obtener frutos nutritivos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Wilfredo, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Wilfredo is a single, hardworking, 34 year old man who lives with his parents in his own home.  He has many ambitions as a young man.  He studied to be a pharmacist at a well-known local school, but he wants to have his own business, so he started focusing his efforts on farming five years ago.  He raises a variety of products on his parents’ farmland, including peas, potatoes, and gladiolo flowers on a large scale.  He also has a chest full of medicines that he sells to the local people when they are feeling sick.  Things have been going well for him all this time, so he was able to buy his own car and also uses it to provide public transportation services.  The prices for his products in the central market are very good and he wants to improve their quality, so he is wants to find good land for new crops.  This will be his fourth Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support so that he can continue forward.  He is also committed to making his payments on time.  Wilfredo will use the S/ 2,000 to buy compost to feed his crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, es una mujer luchadora de 51 años, que vive junto a su esposo Antonio, con el que educó y sacó adelante a sus 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Yolanda se dedica a la agricultura, está es su principal actividad económica desde hace 20 años. Sus principales cultivos, son de flor de gladiolo, alverja y papa, los que cuida y abona; pues sabe que de eso depende la buena venta en cada cosecha, ya que vende en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, y dependiendo de la calidad, los lleva a la capital del país, donde le pagan un mejor precio. Ella tiene sembrado gladiolo y alverja que pronto cosechará y para lo cual se está preparando. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Yolanda, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Yolanda is a hardworking 51 year old woman who lives with her husband, Antonio, with whom she educated her three children and got them ahead.  Only one lives with them now.  Yolanda is a farmer and this has been her main financial activity for 20 years.  Her main crops are gladiolo flower, peas, and potatoes, which she cares for and fertilizes, because she knows that the sale of each harvest depends on that.  She sells at the main market in her city and takes some to the national capital, where they pay better prices, depending on the quality.  She has gladiolo and pea crops that she will harvest soon and is preparing for that.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that allows her to move forward.  She promises to make her payments on time and will use the S/ 2,000 to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, tiene 39 años, se caracteriza por ser alegre. Vive junto a su esposo Luis y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Angélica se dedica a la agricultura por eso todas las mañanas se dirige a sus sembríos de papa, oyuco, alverjas y habas, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, que gracias al trabajo conjunto que realizan como socios y esposos lograron adquirir. Ya tienen 11 años dedicándose a la agricultura, y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo en compañía de su familia. Por el desarrollo y éxito de su negocio, desea más adelante ahorrar el dinero suficiente para poder adquirir un camión y, de esa manera minimizar los gastos de trasporte que realizan desde sus terrenos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde lleva a comercializar su cosecha. Además de ayudarle en su negocio de compra y venta de animales, que consiste en llevar toros, vacas, burros y carneros a la feria ganadera que se realiza en una ciudad cercana donde vende a un buen precio cada ejemplar. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual. Angélica, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Angelica is 39 years old and is known for being a happy person.  She lives with her husband, Luis, and their three children in a home of their own.  Angelica is a farmer and every morning she goes to her potato, oyuco, peas, and bean crops, which she raises on her own farmland, thanks to the work they do together as partners and as a married couple.  They’ve been farming for 11 years and what she likes the best is that she can spend most of the time with her family.  Through her business’ success, she wants to save up enough money to get a truck so she can minimize the cost of transportation from her land to the market to sell her harvest.  It will also help her with her animal sales business, which consists of taking bulls, cows, donkeys, and steer to the livestock market in a nearby town, where each animal sells for a good price.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she will receive in order to move ahead.  She promises to make her payments on time.  Angelica will use the S/ 2,000 to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Sinai Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria es madre soltera, tiene 35 años de edad, de escolaridad primaria completa, tiene 1 hijo que esta estudiando, se dedica a atender su tienda de artículos de consumo diario, inició este negocio con una tiendesita y a la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un prestamo que lo utilizará para la compra de productos de consumo diario para surtir su tienda, en el futuro desea tener una tienda grande en el centro del municipio. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades de comercio.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother, with one child who is in school. She is 35 years old, and has a completed primary school education. She works looking after her shop, selling daily staple items. She began this business with a very small shop, and now has four years of experience.

Maria is a group organiser. She is seeking this loan in order to buy staple goods to stock her shop. In the future she would like to have a large shop in the centre of her town.

The other members of the group also work in commercial activities.

loans.use: to buy staple goods.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Please meet 31-year-old Siah from Buchanan, which is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Siah is a college student and is married. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. Her spouse is a businessman. She has four children between 3 and 13. All of her children are in school and live at home. 

Siah has a shop where she sells used clothes. She has been in business for four years and works every day for five hours per day. With this loan, Siah will buy more used clothes to resell. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is to increase her sales. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profits she earns. Her future plan is to complete her studies.  She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Mammie

texts.en:
This is Mammie from Liberia. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Mammie is 30 and married with three children.  Her children are between the ages of 1 and 20. Only one child is currently living at home and two are in school.  

Mammie has had a business selling fish for the past four years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more fish for her business. On average, she works 10 hours a day at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount of money from her fiancée. She transports her merchandise by a shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is controlling her own money. In the future, she would like to build a modern shop.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigestor.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio es un pequeño productor de café que vive junto a su esposa y 5 hijos en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. Él es parte del grupo de afiliados a la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) que está certificado por Comercio Justo. En el último ciclo obtuvo 200 quintales de café pergamino, además de 40 quintales de frijoles. Para este ciclo de café, Julio está solicitando un crédito para garantizar la fertilización de su cafetal, con lo cual está seguro mejorará la calidad y productividad de este rubro. Su objetivo es seguir creciendo para darle un mejor futuro a su familia y considera que el rubro café tiene un gran potencial para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Julio is a small coffee producer who lives with his wife and five children in a rural community of Northern Nicaragua. He is a member of Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), which is fair-trade certified.

Last season, he produced 200 quintals of parchment coffee and 40 quintals of beans. For this coffee season, Julio is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation, which will improve the quality and productivity of his produce. His goal is to continue growing and give his family a better future. He believes that growing coffee is a good way to achieve it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ileana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Ileana es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Tiene 59 años de edad, soltera y madre de 5 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 5 años. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito por la ayuda que le brindaron en el  financiamiento anterior  ya que pudo estabilizar su negocio y mejorar su nivel de vida. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar  productos tales como: Arroz, azúcar, frijoles, golosinas,  jabón, pasta dental, entre otros con el fin de surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.  Estima que el préstamo será de mucho beneficio para crecer como comerciante. Su expectativa es cumplir sus planes futuros.
texts.en:
Ileana is originally from Managua. She is a 59-year-old single mother of five children. She works as a saleswoman and has had a grocery store for five years. She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito for the help they have given her and the previous loan, which helped her to stabilize her business and improve her quality of life.

Ileana is requesting a new loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, beans, sweets, soap and tooth paste, stock her store and fulfill her customers’ needs. She believes that this loan will help her to grow as a saleswoman. She has some plans for the future that she wants to realize.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, sweets, soap and tooth paste, among other things.

loans.name: Lucio Vidal

texts.es: Lucio es un pequeño productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Cuenta con 36 años de edad y 3 hijos que ha procreado junto a su compañera, con los cuales vive en su pequeña finca de 4 manzanas, de las cuales 2 son de café. Este pequeño productor ha tenido obtenido 40, 35 y 50 quintales de café pergamino en los últimos 3 ciclos. Para este nuevo ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito para garantizar la fertilización y el foleo de su cafetal según los requerimientos técnicos de su plantación, a fin de mejorar la calidad e incrementar la producción. Considera que con su esfuerzo y cuidado podrá obtener mejores rendimientos y con ellos mayores ingresos que le permitirán darle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en: Lucio is a small farmer in northern Nicaragua. He is 36 years old and has 3 children with his wife. They live on their small 7 acre farm, 2 of which are for coffee. This small farmer has produced 40, 35 and 50 quintals of parchment coffee the last 3 cycles. For this new cycle, he is asking for a loan to guarantee fertilizer and foliar for his coffee crop, according to basic technical requirements for his coffee, in order to improve the product quality. He believes that with his hard work and care he will be able to obtain better yields and with them better income that will allow him to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and foliar for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en una comunidad rural de Nicaragua. Tiene más de 25 años de trabajar con café y actualmente, además de este rubro cultiva banano el cual comercializa a nivel local durante todo el año. Este pequeño productor ha tenido 3 créditos de la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), a la cual está afiliado y forma parte del grupo de productores certificados bajo Comercio Justo. En el último ciclo el rendimiento de café por manzana de este productor fue de 24 quintales pergamino. Para mejorar la calidad y los rendimientos de su cafetal, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos que le permita garantizar el mantenimiento adecuado de las plantaciones de café. El está seguro que con la aplicación oportuna de insumos podrá tener mejores resultados en el siguiente ciclo y podrá obtener mayores utilidades para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Juan is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and children in a rural community in Nicaragua. He has been working with coffee for more than 25 years. Right now he is also working growing bananas, which he sells at a local level all year long. This small farmer has had 3 loans from the Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), of which he is a member. He is a part of the group of certified Fair Trade farmers. In the last cycle, his coffee yield per 1.73 acres was 25 quintals of parchment coffee. In order to improve the quality and yields of his coffee crop, he is asking for a loan to buy materials that will allow him to guarantee sufficient maintenance for his coffee plants. He is sure that with the timely application of materials he will be able to have better results in the next cycle and be able to obtain better profits for his family's well being.

loans.use: to buy materials to do maintenance on his coffee crop.

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es:
Medardo, es un hombre de 48 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Medardo se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años por eso se dirige siempre a sus campos de cultivo en donde cuida de sus plantaciones de alverja, papa, flor de gladiolo, habas y maíz. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder disfrutar de la tranquilidad del trabajo en el campo; “también me gusta comercializar mi cosecha, pues veo concretado tanto esfuerzo”, menciona. Ahora tiene pensado renovar sus plantaciones de flor de gladiolo, ya que se acerca la temporada de mayor demanda. Además de trabajar muy duro en sus cultivos de papa y alverja que cosechará en el próximo mes. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Medardo, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Medardo is 48 years old, married, and has two children who live with them in their home.  Medardo has been a farmer for 10 years and goes to his fields where he raises peas, potatoes, gladiolo flower, beans, and corn.  What he likes the most about his job is being able to enjoy the tranquility of the fields, “I also like selling my harvest because I can see the fruits of my labor,” he says.  Now he wants to renew his gladiolo flower crop because the highest demand season approaches.  He also works hard on his potato and pea crops, which he will harvest in the next month.  This will be his fourth Kiva loan and he continues to be grateful for the financial support he is getting.  He also promises to make his payments on time

Medardo will use the S/ 3,000 to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora de 32 años, está casada con Elvis y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en una casa alquilada. Flora se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arvejas y papas, pero afirma que el conviene sembrar arvejas, por sus precios altos y por cosecharse 2 ó 3 veces al año.“Normalmente siembro 3 bolsas de semillas. De una bolsa cosecho 30 sacos.”, menciona. Además su esposo trabaja en la mina, aportando otros ingresos para su familia. Y cuando cesan sus labores en esa empresa, dedica su tiempo a cultivar la tierra. Flora está contenta con sus labores en el campo, por que le agrada su labor, a pesar de ser muy cansado y riesgoso. La ventaja que tiene ella, es que sus productos son vendidos al por mayor inmediatamente, por eso no duda en continuar con su actividad, a pesar de lo cansado que suele ser. Una de sus metas es adquirir otros terrenos para ampliar sus cosechas y seguir sembrando. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Flora, invertirá los S/.4000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Flora is 32 years old and married to Elvis.  They have two children and all live together in a rented home.  Flora is a farmer who raises peas and potatoes, but she says that its more advantageous to raise peas because of their high price and because they can be harvested two or three times per year.  “I usually plant three bags of seeds and I harvest 30 sacks per bag,” she says.  Her husband works in a mine, bringing more income into the family.  When he finishes his work with this company, he spends time working the land.

Flora is happy with her work in the field, because she likes her work even though it’s tiring and risky.  She has the advantage that her products are mostly sold immediately, so she has no doubts about continuing her activity, no matter how tiring it is.  One of her goals is to acquire more land on which to expand her harvest and keep planting.

This will be her fourth Kiva loan.  She is happy for the financial support  and promises to make her payments on time.  She will use the S/4,000 to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, tiene 50 años, enviudó hace tan solo 4 meses y trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Los días son aún difíciles pero a pesar de ello, sigue trabajando como hace 20 años; pero ahora los hace sola ya que quiere mantener a sus cultivos de la mejor manera. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, alverja, maíz y habas. Lo que más le gusta, es la tranquilidad del campo, por ello sigue trabajando arduamente, ya que sabe que es el único aliado que tiene en estos momentos difíciles. Ahora tiene sembrado papa, los cuales están creciendo satisfactoriamente, y cuenta que ya están floreando, por ello dentro de 3 meses cosechará y venderá en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Los planes de ella son mejorar sus sembríos y darle una estabilidad a su familia.  Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Lidia, invertirá los S/.3800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Lidia is 50 years old.  She became a widow only four months ago and she works arduously to get her two children ahead.  The days are still difficult but despite that she continues to work like she did 20 years ago, but now she works alone and she wants to maintain her crops in the best way possible.  Her main crops are potatoes, peas, corn, and beans.  What she likes the best is the tranquility of the fields and she continues to work arduously because she knows that the only allies she has are the difficult moments.  Now she plants potatoes, which are growing satisfactorily.  She says that they are flowering and she will harvest within three months and sell it in the main market in town.  Her plans are to improve her harvest and provide stability to her family.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support so she can move ahead.  She promises to make her payments on time.  Lidia will use the S/ 3,800 from her loan to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot, es una mujer honesta de 34 años, que junto a su esposo Elmer, cuidan de sus 2 hermosos hijos. En unión familiar ellos viven en la casa que compraron hace 6 años. Para poder mantener a su familia, está valerosa mujer se dedica a la agricultura y al trasporte público. Todas las mañanas su esposo Elmer, sale a trabajar con su auto; trasladando a los pobladores del caserío a la ciudad principal,mientras que Margot, dedica su tiempo y esfuerzo a cuidar de sus sembríos de habas, alverja y flor de gladiolo, ya tiene 14 años realizando está labor. Lo que más le gusta a ella es viajar a la ciudad principal, en donde comercializa su producción. “Estar en el campo es maravilloso, no se ganará mucho pero te encuentras tranquila”, afirma; por esa razón desea seguir mejorando sus sembríos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Margot, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Margot is an honest 34 year old woman who, along with her husband Elmer, cares for her two children.  They have lived together for six years.  This brave woman is a farmer and provides public transportation so that she can support her family.  Every morning her husband, Elmer, goes out with his car to work with the people in the main city, while Margot spends her time and energy caring for her bean, pea, and gladiolo flower crops.  She’s been doing this for 14 years.  What she enjoys most is going to the main city where she sells her products. “Being in the fields is marvelous.  I don’t earn much but it’s relaxing,” she says.  For this reason she wants to improve her crops.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she gets so she can move ahead.  She also promises to make her payments on time.

Margot will use the S/ 3,000 to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es: Nerida, es una valiente mujer de 37 años; que en compañía de su esposo Manuel cuidan de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Nerida se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de alverja, papa, y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta a ella es poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, “me siento realizada”, afirma. Pero está pareja de esposos, conjuntamente, viajan a la capital del país donde comercializan su producción después de cada cosecha. Para más adelante desea mejorar sus cultivos, en principal sus sembríos de flor de gladiolo; pues según afirma tiene mayor demando durante todo el año. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Nerida, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Nerida is a brave 37 year old woman.  She’s married to Manuel; they have two children and a home of their own.  Nerida is a farmer and her main crops are peas, potatoes, and gladiolo flower.  What she likes is that she is able to help her husband with the family expenses.  “I feel alive,” she says.  This couple travels together to the capital city to sell their harvest every season.  She wants to improve her production in the future, mainly her gladiolo flower crop because she says that she has a greater demand all year.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she receives so she can continue moving forward.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  Nerida will use the money from this loan to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, tiene 46 años, y en compañía de su esposo Percy, salen adelante en su casa propia. Nora se dedica a la agricultura y siembra productos como: flor de gladiolo, habas, alverjas y papa; pero hace algunos años Percy, se fue a trabajar fuera de la ciudad, dejando en manos de Nora el cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas, los que gracias a su buen juicio logró sacar adelante. Una vez al mes viaja a la capital de país a vender sus cosechas. Por toda la capacidad que está demostrando desea mejorar sus sembríos y así poder generar mejores ganancias. Por ahora está centrada en su próxima cosecha de papa y alverja, además de sentirse feliz de ayudar a personas como ella a salir adelante.Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Nora, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Nora is 46 years old and she and her husband, Percy, have their own home.  Nora is a farmer and raises gladiolo flower, beans, peas, and potatoes, but Percy went to work outside the city a few years ago, leaving Nora in charge of the farmland, which she did well with, thanks to her good judgment.  Once more she goes to the capital to sell her harvest.  She wants to use all her demonstrated ability to improve her crops and in this way generate greater profits.  For now she is focused on her next potato and pea crop, as well as being happy to be able to help others get ahead.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she receives to get ahead.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  Norma will invest the S/ 1,000 in compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Corina

texts.es: Doña corina  de 46 años de edad, vive en casa propia  con su esposo y  sus dos hijos , ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas ubicado en su lugar de residencia, por su amabilidad ha sabido ganarse la confianza sus clientes, doña corina está solicitando un crédito para poder invertirlo en capital de trabajo  y comprar maíz por mayor y cal y poder ofrecerle a  su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Corina is 46 years old and lives in a home of her own, along with her husband and two children.  She has a business selling tortillas located in her home and she has managed to win her customers’ trust because of her friendship.  Corina is asking for a loan to buy dried corn in bulk and lime so she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Sonia Leticia

texts.es: Doña Sonia de 32 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada junto a su compañero de vida y su hija, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 8 años, es una persona amable, responsable, y con excelentes referencias, posee una  gran clientela que demanda su trabajo, de esta manera ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos, doña Sonia solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio compra de telas, hilos, tijeras, botones, agujas, etc. para poder satisfacer  la gran demanda que posee, obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sonia is 32 years old and lives in a rented home with her life partner and her daughter.  She makes clothing and has for eight years.  She is a friendly, responsible person with excellent references and she has a many customers.  In this way she has managed to pay some of her expenses.  Sonia is asking for a loan to invest in her business.  She will buy fabric, thread, scissors, buttons, needles, etc. so that she can satisfy the large demand, increase her income, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medications.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед добрый человек. Ему 35 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена трудолюбивая женщина, но она нигде не работает, так как она является домохозяйкой и занимается воспитанием детей. Хуршед имеет высшее образование. Он работает более 16 лет в Отделе Внутренних Дел на должности майора милиции. Он хорошо знает свою работу и выполняет на высшем уровне. Хуршед планирует отремонтировать свой дом. Он не имеет сбережения для покупки строительных материалов, как краски, цемент и т.п. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Khurshed is a good person. He is 35 years old. He is married and has four children in his care. His wife is a hardworking woman, but she does not work anywhere because she is a homemaker and raises their children. Khurshed has a higher education. He has worked for more than 16 years in the Ministry of Internal Affairs in the post of police chief. He knows his profession very well and fulfills his position to the best of his abilities. Khurshed plans to repair his house. He does not have the savings to purchase building materials such as paint, cement, etc. He is a requesting a loan in the amount of 6000 somoni for the purchase of building materials. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To purchase building materials such as paint and cement for repairing his house

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Исматулло 58 лет. Он женат на доброй женщине и всю жизнь прожил с ней счастливую жизнь. Они воспитали прекрасных детей. Исматулло всегда старался ради благополучия своих детей и жены. Он имеет средне- специальное образование по специальности педагог. Он более 35 лет работает в средней школе преподавателем. Он занимается еще и земледелием, так как его зарплата маленькая и не хватает для обеспечения семьи. Он год за годом развевает свой бизнес по земледелию. Он должен купить минеральные удобрения для выращивания сельхоз культур. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ismatullo is 58 years old. He is married to a kind woman and has had a happy life with her for his entire life. They raised wonderful children. Ismatullo always strives on behalf of his children and wife. He has a secondary specialized education in the field of pedagogy.  For more than 35 years, he has worked in a secondary school as a teacher. He also practices farming, as his salary is small and is not enough to provide for his family. Year by year, he develops his farming business. He needs to buy mineral fertilizer for the growth of his crops. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 7000 somoni. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for his land

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.ru: Джахонгир трудолюбивый человек. Ему 21 года. Он не женат. Джахонгир более 2 года работает в частной компании строителем. Он живет вместе со своими родителями и старается, чтобы их семья жила в достатке. Джахонгир несколько лет назад начал постройку нового дома. Он не закончил постройку дома, так как не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, кирпич и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Jahongir is a hardworking person. He is 21 years old. He is unmarried. Jahongir has worked for more than 2 years as a builder in a private company. He lives with his parents and works hard so that his family can live comfortably. Several years ago, Jahongir began the construction of a new house. He did not finish the house because he did not have the money. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, lumber, bricks, etc. He awaits your kindness and relies upon your generosity.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, lumber, and bricks for building his new house

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru: Вера работает на ферме, получает стабильный доход. Живет в своем доме вместе с сыном, невесткой и своей внучкой. Вера хочет сделать ремонт в коридоре, комнатах и гостинной. Нужно снять старую штукатурку, заделать стены в тех местах, где отваливаются, затем наклеить обои, а также заменить двери. Вера просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 20,000 гривен.
texts.en: Vera works on a farm and receives a stable income. She lives in her home with her son, daughter-in-law, and granddaughter. Vera wants to make repairs in the hallway, bedrooms, and living room. She needs to remove the old plaster, repair the walls in places where it is falling off, and then put up wallpaper and replace the doors. Vera has asked for a loan of 20,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to remodel her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en:
Janjay is 48 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Janjay lives with her husband and six children between the ages of 15 and 25; only three are in school. She been selling red oil, peppers, salt, etc. for the past 13 years in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, peppers, salt, etc. for her business, She likes her business because it helps to support her home.  She hopes one day to own a house.  

She wants to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, peppers, salt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: El señor Lucio, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, trabaja como agricultor desde hace  15 años, tiene plantaciones de yuca y plátano, tambien trabaja como motosierrista donde le genera tambien ingresos para que puedan subsistir él y su familia durante todo el año, estos ingresos le permiten generar dinero suficiente para cubrir los alimentos de toda su familia, además de ropa u otros gastos.  El señor Lucio necesita ayuda para poder comprarse una nueva motosierra porque la que tiene ya está vieja y tiene algunos desperfectos, estos desperfectos no le permiten trabajar bien ya que retrasan su trabajo, por lo que sus ingresos se vieron afectados y genero que le falte un poco más de dinero para que puedan comer y comprar materiales para que puedan estudiar sus hijos, también quiere comprarse una moto fumigadora para cuando vaya a fumigar sus cultivos de plátano y yuca no este tardando demasiado y así tal vez pueda descansar un poco.
texts.en: Lucio is a hardworking and responsible person who has worked in agriculture for 15 years. He owns banana and yucca plantations and also works as a chainsaw operator to earn extra money so he can provide for his family all year round. This income allows him to buy food and clothing and pay for other household expenses. Lucio needs help buying a new chainsaw as the one he has is old and faulty, which slows down his work. This has affected his earnings, meaning he has had less money for food and for his children's school supplies. He also wants to buy a motorised pesticide sprayer so that when he fumigates his banana and yucca crops it doesn't take him so long and he can rest a little.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw.

loans.name: Adalid

texts.es: El señor Adalid vive como concubino junto a la madre de su hija, vive en el domicilio de su suegro. El señor Adalid es de la provincia Chapare, hoy en día trabaja en el sector agrícola y se dedican a la producción de piña, de donde tiene en producción 1/2 hectárea de la cual cosecha un promedio de 11000 unidades  lo que comercializa a los intermediarios que le vienen a comprar al lugar donde vive; el crédito que está solicitando es para mantenimiento de piña (cortado de malezas y  fertilización) con lo que obtendrá mejor rendimiento en cosecha. De esta manera generara mejores ingresos que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Adalid lives in a common-law marriage with the mother of his daughter. He lives in the home of his father-in-law. Adalid is from the province of Chapare, and he currently works in the field of agriculture, dedicating himself to producing pineapples. He has 1/2 hectare in production, from which he harvests an average of 11,000 units. He sells these to intermediaries who come to the place where he lives to buy them. The loan he is requesting is for the maintenance of his pineapple crop (clearing weeds and fertilizing). With this, he will obtain a better level of production at the harvest. In this way, he will generate a better income, permitting him to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to clear weeds and fertilize his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a Liberian.  She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish.  In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city.  People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Betty is 30 years old; she is married and has three children between 26 and 8 years old.  Only two are currently living at home and attending school. Betty has had a "table business" selling fish and frozen chicken for three years now.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more fish and frozen chicken.  
On average, she works ten hours at her business from Monday to Saturday.  

Betty started her business with a little money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the money she makes.  In the future, she would like to build a house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fish and frozen chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Nice

texts.en: Nice is a repeat client in the Ishaka branch who has borrowed seven times. She is married and has three children aged 25, 20 and 17. She is a tea farmer in rural Kyamuhunga and she gives this business a maximum of 6 hours per day. She also has a small retail shop in the same area which she concentrates on when she is not in the tea business. She started growing tea so she could be able to have a clear source of income. She would like to use the 1,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizer for her tea garden. Her clients are mainly the tea traders in the area and she hopes to educate her children using the money she gets from the business. She is challenged by the dry season, which negatively affects her harvests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her tea garden.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.en: Silverio, 38, is a married man who has 4 children aged 14, 12, 10 and 7. All of them go to school. He is a tea farmer and has done tea farming since 2005. His major aim in starting the business was to have a steady source of income. Silverio’s tea garden is in Rwampanga-Kabingo, and he spends an average of 6 hours on the garden per day. His clients are the tea traders in the area. In addition to the tea business, he also supplies vegetables to the nearby school, which gives him additional income.  He would like to buy fertilizer to apply in the garden using this 1,000,000 UGX loan. His main challenge is the weather (dry season), but he strongly believes that if given the money he will apply the fertilizers and harvest more and hence be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Jorgina Berta

texts.es: Doña Jorgina es originaria de la Ciudad de Masaya. Tiene 60 años de edad y madre soltera de 5 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos para el hogar desde hace 12 años. Inicio su negocio vendiendo de manera ambulante por diferentes sectores de la ciudad. Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso el alquiler de una vivienda. Su expectativa es aumentar su inventario y prospera como comerciante. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como: Hornos, tostadora, arroceras, cucharas, platos, vasos entre otros, con el fin de distribuir mayor cantidad de mercadería para satisfacer a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda para pagar los pedidos y a través de la ganancia de sus ventas cancelar el crédito. Su plan futuro es construir un local donde pueda comercializar sus productos. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en: Jorgina comes from the city of Masaya. She is 60 years old and has five children. For 12 years she has worked selling household products. She began her business selling door to door in different areas of the city, and she also rents out a house which provides additional income. Her goal is to grow her inventory and to succeed as a businesswoman. She is asking for a loan to buy products like ovens, toasters, rice cookers, spoons, plates and glasses, among other items, with the aim of selling a larger quantity of products to satisfy her customers. She says that the loan will be a great help in paying for her orders, and with the money she makes from sales she will be able to pay it back. Her plan in the future is to build a shop where she can sell her products. Her next goal is to improve her family's living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ovens, toasters, rice cookers, spoons, plates and glasses.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Here is Oretha from Liberia. Presently she resides in the Buchanan area, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city.  People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Oretha is 23 years old, single, and she has two children aged 1 and 7 years old. One is currently attending school and they all live at home. Oretha has a small shop where she has sold rice, oil, bread, milk, soap, etc for the past five years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more rice, oil, bread, milk, soap, etc.  

On average, she works ten hours a day at her business from Monday through Saturday. She started her business by selling cooked food and learned selling from her sister. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes. In the future, she would like to build a store. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, bread, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Juah

texts.en:
Please meet 50-year-old Juah from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Juah finished 7th grade and is single. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. Her children's ages are between 18 and 32, one of whom is in school and lives at home. Juah has been running a table business, selling fish. She has been in this business for 20 years and works from Monday to Saturday spending 10 hours per day. With this loan, she will buy more fish to sell.  

One of the greatest challenges that she faces is low income. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband.  She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 45 years old and married with 6 children aged between 10 years and 25 years. She runs a business in Jui in the Eastern area in Freetown. She started a business because she wants to create a permanent source of income for her children. 

She's been in this business for 15 years now and sells palm oil at a market place.  She describes her major hardship as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Adama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to open a big palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Please meet 35-year-old Oretha from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.
 
Oretha stopped her education at grade 7 before getting married. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She has four children between the ages of 2 and 19. They are in school and live at home. 

Oretha has been frying and selling fish, cala (balls of rice), plantain and chicken along the roadside since 2009. She works 10 hours each day at her business. With this loan, she will buy flour, fish, chicken, pepper, etc. for her business. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is the low income. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy flour, fish, chicken, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Njina

texts.en:
Njina is thirty-five years old and has four children and one dependent. Her children are aged 19,12, 2 and 1. The additional dependent is an orphan to whom she decided to give support in the form of supplying basic needs. 

Njina is in a decoration business that she has operated for the last 13 years. She started the business so she would be able to sustain herself and care for the needs of her children. She spends an average of five hours per day running the decoration business, and when she is off she works in her restaurant, which is her other source of income. 

Her main purpose of acquiring the UGAFODE loan is to buy materials for decoration. She operates her business in Ishaka and her customers are people from Ishaka and Bushenyi who call upon her to decorate whenever they have special functions. Njina says her major challenge is poor profits, since the profit is sometimes negatively affected by the clients who make partial payment and then default on the balance. She is determined and ready to work on, despite the challenges involved.

loans.use: To buy materials for decoration.

loans.name: Martha Erling

texts.es:
La joven Martha Erling es una joven madre soltera del municipio de Condega a unos 35 km al norte de la cabecera Esteli, esta joven tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar a los que ella sola asume los gastos de mantecion como gastos escolares ya que es padre y madre para sus hijos.
Esta joven trabaja a diario en una fabrica de puros en la partde de produccion, ella tiene aproximadamente unos 10 años de laborar en dicha empresa ya que este es su unico ingreso para el sustento familiar, trabaja de lunes a viernes de las 7 am a las 5 pm.
Esta clienta se presento en las oficinas de ceprodel con el objetivo de hacer una nueva solicitud de credito, ella a tenido nueve ciclos crediticion en ceprodel en un periodo de 10 años y de esta manera ella a logrado mejorar algunas de sus condiciones de vida como es su casa, en esta nueva solicitud ella se muestra positiva que le sera aprobado el credito y asi podra comprar una madera y laminas de zinc para poder componer el techo de la cocina de su casa y evitar mojarce en esteperiodo de ivierno. espera que le sea probado lo mas pornto, ella es madre soltera y no cuenta con una ayuda y por cuenta propia no son lo suficiente los ingresos para asumir ella sola los gastos de la compra de materiales.
texts.en:
Martha Erling is a young single mother from the town of Condega, 35km to the north of the capital of Esteli. She is father and mother to her two children; as sole provider she takes on all the costs of their upbringing, such as schooling. Martha works every day in a factory producing cigars. She has worked there for around 10 years, and it is her only means of providing for her family. Her working hours are monday to Friday, 7am to 5pm.

Martha contacted Ceprodel with the aim of requesting a new loan. She has had 9 loans from Ceprodel in the last 10 years, which have helped her improve her living conditions. She is confident her loan will be approved and she will be able to buy wood and zinc sheets to fix her kitchen roof, so she doesn't get wet during winter. She hopes that it will be approved quickly as she is a single mother and doesn't receive any help, and her own income is not sufficient to pay for the materials.

loans.use: to buy wood and zinc.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is 35 years old and married with 4 children aged between 4 years and 23 years. She runs a milk business in Jui in the Eastern area in Freetown. She started her business because she wants to create a permanent source of income for her children. 

She's been in this business for 12 years now and sells milk at a market place.  She describes her major hardship as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Mabinty requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more bags of milk to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to open to expand her business into more stores. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of milk to expand her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  

Gina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Marianita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Marianita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Balia

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Balia from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has three children between 7 and 19 years.  

In 2003, Balia established her medical drugs business. She began her business because she wanted to create her own source of income to contribute in taking care of the children.  She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Balia requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of medical drugs to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Balia plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase variety of medical drugs to expand her business.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Marion from Tombo in the Western rural area of Freetown. She is married with 4 children. Two of her children are going to school. After her wedding, Marion established her food stand business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Marion requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil, onions, and cooking seasonings for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future Marion plans to own a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, onions, and cooking seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben is 37 years of age and a tea grower in Nyakazinga-kibazi – Kyamuhunga. He has five children and they all go to school. He also has one additional dependent who does work for him at home. His major source of income is tea growing which he started in 2007 with the motive of having a steady source of income. He gives the tea business an average of 6 hours per day, and this has helped him to harvest more quantities of tea. 

In addition to the tea growing business, he also grows pineapples and bananas which are his other sources of income. His clients are mainly the Igara tea factory and tea traders in the area. He hopes to use the loan money of one million UGX (1,000,000) to buy fertilizers for his tea plantation. He hopes that the tea plantation will expand with time and the harvest and sales will increase and hence increase profits. His major challenge is unfavorable weather conditions which negatively affect the quantity harvested.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mariatu from Jui in the Eastern area in Freetown. She is single with 3 children. She began this business because she wants to educate her children. For the past 15 years, Mariatu has been running her clothing and cosmetic business. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to run her business.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material and cosmetics to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Mariatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material and cosmetics to expand her business

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 42 years old and married with 5 children between the age of 4 and 19 years. She runs a fast food business in Jui in the Eastern area of Freetown. She started the business because she wants to create a permanent source of income for her children. 

She's been in this business for 10 years now and sells fried fish and chicken. She describes her major hardship as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cooking oil, fish and carton chicken to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to open a restaurant. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, fish and carton chicken to expand her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Kadiatu from Jui in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children aged 6 years and 10 years.  In 2003, Kadiatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to create her own source of income to contribute to taking care of the children.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and high cost of transportation.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase cosmetic like body cream, perfume and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics such as body cream, perfume and soap to expand her business

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is 23 years old and married with two children.

Angelica is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Angelica requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds for her ducks.

Angelica has been raising ducks for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF, and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her ducks that she raises.

loans.name: Feme

texts.en:
Feme is 30 years old and married. She has two children who are both in school. Feme works very hard to provide for them.

Feme runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other groceries.  

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell in her store.

In the future Feme would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Natasha and Avon personal products and e-loading (mobile prepaid load). Divina is borrowing 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lerma works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and a tailoring business. Lerma is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lerma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Felecita

texts.en:
Felecita is 65 years old and a widowed mother of three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Felecita has a general store business in the Philippines. Felecita requested a 21,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Felecita has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Felecita would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Regina works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Regina is borrowing 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell at her stall.

Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 44 years old, and is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Shiela has a general store business in the Philippines. Shiela requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, noodles, sardines, and other grocery items.

Shiela has been in this business for six years. In the future, Shiela would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, noodles, sardines, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 35 years old and married with 4 children, ages 7 to 18 years. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo in the Western rural area of Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since 2007 and sells glass cups, waxed cotton and food containers within her community.  She says that the main problem in her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more waxed cotton fabric and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more waxed cotton fabric and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is 21 years old and single with one child who is 1 year old.  

She runs a medical drugs business in Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She started this business to get her daily living. She has been in this business for five years now. She says that, at present, her business is doing well because out of the profit she was able to take care of her family.

Ramatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more medical drugs like malarial drugs, body ache drugs and blood syrup for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and get a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a big pharmacy table. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medical drugs like malarial drugs, body ache drugs and blood syrup for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 26 years old and lives in the District of Hurungwe in Zimbabwe. She is a single mother of one and earns a living through her small clothing shop where she sells T-shirts and children’s clothing.  With her flair for business, she not only runs  her clothing stall, but she also volunteers as a mentor for other young women who are just starting businesses in their rural community.  

With a loan, Beatrice will expand her business by purchasing clothing accessories to increase her stock. She is planning to invest her profits in raising her child and helping to pay for the education of her siblings.

loans.use: to increase her stock by purchasing clothes

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis is 23 years-old, married and a mother of 1 who lives in Hurungwe district. She also supports her three siblings. She operates a small grocery store in her village where she sells different products such as eggs, sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, bread, shoe polish, snacks and cotton wool.  

With a loan of $500, Mavis intends to purchase sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, bread, shoe polish, snacks and cotton wool in bulk to reduce costs and increase her sales volumes. She hopes to expand into a large retail business so as to cater for her family, send her child to school and create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her grocery shop

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 49 years old and married with one kid. Melinda works very hard to support her family.

Melinda runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, softdrinks, noodles, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 13 years. 

In the future Melinda would like to save enough money so she continue to send her kid to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es: Felisa tiene 37 años  de edad,  es madre de tres niños, vive en concubinato, se dedica a la producción de la leche y viven en una zona rural de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Felisa es una mujer luchadora ya que hace como seis años atrás su esposo tuvo un accidente en el tractor que él trabajaba y estaba muy delicado de salud fue tan grave que él no podía caminar y tuvieron que hacer tratamientos y fisioterapias en las cuales Felisa siempre estuvo con el apoyándolo, ella se levantaba muy temprano para realizar su trabajo y poder entregar la leche a la empresa de leche y de esa manera poder tener más ingresos para la rehabilitación de su esposo y que sus niños no dejaran  la escuela  ya que era importante para ella; en ningún  momento ella se dejaron vencer salió adelante a pesar de todas las dificultades que atravesó. Felisa solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción para comederos, ya que se acerca la temporada de calor y lluvias y  su ganado tiene que tener un buen lugar para no enfermarse y bajar la producción de leche. Ella junto a su esposo sueñan  que sus niños puedan en un futuro   terminar el colegio y de la misma manera poder hacer una carrera,  ya que ellos no pudieron ni terminar el colegio porque se conocieron muy jóvenes y desde entonces viven juntos.
texts.en:
Felisa is 37 years old and is the mother of three children. She lives in a common-law marriage and works in milk production. They live in the rural zone of the city of Cochabamba. Felisa is a plucky woman, because about six years ago her spouse had an accident with the tractor that he was driving. His health was very fragile; it was so serious that he couldn’t walk and they had to do treatments and physical therapy. Felisa was always with him, supporting him. She would get up very early to do her work and to be able to deliver the milk to the dairy. In this way, she was able to earn more money for her husband’s rehabilitation and so that the children didn’t have to leave school (which is very important to her). She never gave up; she kept pressing on in spite of all the difficulties that she went through.

Felisa is asking for a loan to buy construction materials for feeding troughs, because the  hot and rainy season is approaching and her herd has to have a good place so that they don’t get sick and decrease their milk production. Along with her spouse, she has a dream that her children can finish school and, in the same way, study for a degree, because Felisa and her husband didn’t manage to even finish school; they met when they were very young and since then they have lived together.

loans.use: to build feeding troughs for her cattle.

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: El joven José es una persona humilde de 19 años de edad, estado civil soltero, vive junto a sus padres, económicamente muy independiente, vive en la comunidad de Colomi. El joven es trabajador, responsable, desde muy pequeño se dedico a la producción agrícola con ingresos económicos por la venta estacional de papa y haba en vaina verde dentro del año, José solicita crédito para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y además  una cabeza de ganado vacuno de engorde. Jose con la compra del abono y la cabeza de ganado estará  listo para enfrentar la época de la siembra de esta campaña agrícola como también siempre ayudara a sus padres así para poder tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José, 19, is a humble young man. He is single and lives with his parents in the village of Colomi, although he is economically independent. He is hardworking, responsible and since he was a small boy, he has worked in agriculture, receiving an income from the seasonal sales of potatoes and green beans.

José is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer (hen droppings) and a bull to fatten. With this purchase, he will be ready for the sowing season. He will continue helping his parents and fighting for a better future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and a bull to fatten.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 58 years old and widowed with six children. Margarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks to sell.

Margarita has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Margarita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 46 years old and single. Elma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Elma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 45 years old and married. She has three children between the ages of 10 years and 20 years. 

She runs a general stock business in Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She's been in this business 20 years and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits within her community. She says that the main problem for her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business more. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store. Josephine has been in this business for two years. Josephine earns more income from food vending and direct selling Avon, Natasha and MSE.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 23 years old and single with one child. 

She runs a palm oil business in Jui eastern area in Freetown. She started the business because she wanted to create a permanent source of living.

She's been in this business for three years now and sells palm oil at a particular market place. She describes her major hardship as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Zainab requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to open a big palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas (Successful Women) Group

texts.en:
The six women of the Group Mujeres Exitosas, from Mazatenango, Suchitepéquez, Guatemala, chose their name because they see themselves becoming more successful with the help of the business advisor and the training on managing their money that Namaste will provide them. This business education is in addition to the loan they will receive.  They have a variety of business to support themselves and help educate their children.  Several make and sell food, one has a catalog business and another sells cleaning products.

Ana Griselda (third from the right in the photo) is a 32 year old single mother of two girls 10 years and 3 years.  The older girl, who is in school, suffers from respiratory troubles.  So Ana has expenses for medicine as well as for school.  When she became pregnant with the first daughter her parents threw her out of the house and she cleaned houses to make money to survive.  Subsequently her parents took her back and three years ago she started her food business.  In the morning, from a basket on the street, she sells bread with chicken or black beans, and other items like tortillas and stuffed peppers. She will be spending her loan money on a stove, canister of gas, a blender and a food processor plus some ingredients in bulk.  These purchases will allow her to work more efficiently in the kitchen so she can spend more time on the street selling the food she makes. Her dream is to make enough money to rent a place from which she can sell her food throughout the day.
Her monthly sales are currently Q10,920 (US $1,400) with a profit of Q2,772 (US $355) and she hopes to increase her sales to Q13,720 (US $1,758) with an increase in profit to Q4,889 (US $627) an increase in sales of 25% and an increase in profit of 75%.

loans.use: to buy a stove, a blender and other tools she needs to cook more efficiently and spend more time selling

loans.name: Justo

texts.es: El sr. Justo de 43 años de edad, vive en una comunidad muy alejada del pueblo, a muy temprana edad sufrió la pérdida de su padre quedando a cargo de sus hermanos y de las riendas de la familia. El sr. Justo se dedica a la producción agrícola, por las heladas fuertes  registradas en fechas del 15 al 25 de julio del presente año en la zona, don justo a perdido el 50% de su producción de tomate y papa el cual a ocasionando una disminución de ingresos económicos por venta de estos productos, por estos motivos mencionados la estabilidad económica ha sufrido un desequilibrio afectando directamente en la adquisición de los materiales e insumos requeridos para la producción como en la canasta familiar para la alimentación de la familia. Para enmendar lo mencionado anteriormente ha recurrido al crédito con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia y retomar el camino de la prosperidad.
texts.en:
Señor Justo, age 43, lives in a community that is very far from town. At a very early age he suffered the loss of his father, leaving him in charge of his siblings and holding the reins of his family.  

Señor Justo works in agriculture production. Due to the heavy frosts recorded in that area between June 15 and 25 of this year, Don Justo lost 50% of his tomato and potato production. This led to a decrease in his income from the sale of these products. Because of this, his economic stability has suffered an instability, directly affecting the purchase of materials and supplies required for his production as well as the family pantry for the feeding of his family. To put this situation right, he has turned to a loan, with the goal of improving the quality of life for his family and reclaiming the road to prosperity.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 47 years old and married with 3 children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from tricycle transportation.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.
