loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children between the ages of 2 years and 13 years. Her children are attending school. 

Kadiatu runs a food stand business at home. She sells rice, onions and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since just after her wedding. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is the cost of transportation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, onions and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, onions and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary resides in Houston, Texas, and has operated Icon Nails Spa for more than five years.  The business is located in a busy strip mall, where ladies and men can shop and relax as they have their nails and toes treated at the spa.

In 2008, Mary received an Accion Texas Inc. small business loan to launch and continue her dream as a woman business owner.  Accion holds America’s largest microloan portfolio.  The Accion loan helped Mary take her business from a dream to a reality.  After five years of business she is still going strong and came back to Accion for another business loan to purchase furniture for the nail shop.

With five full- and part-time employees, Mary keeps herself busy managing and running the day-to-day business.  She wanted to do a quick makeover and purchase new updated sitting area furniture for her waiting room.  She came to Accion and received a microloan that allowed her to purchase the furniture, give her store a new look, and make her business more presentable.  

Mary believes the new look will increase business sales, sustain jobs in her community, and allow her to hire two additional full- and part-time employees in the near future.

loans.use: to renovate her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to update her catering equipment.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Delia has been in this business for four years. Delia also earns income from dressmaking, house rentals and a general store.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Stefanie

texts.en:
SMRT Consulting Associates, LLC, pronounced “smart,” is operated by Stefanie and one other full-time employee. Both work to provide businesses and non-profits assistance when developing their business or looking to write competitive papers for potential grants. According to Stefanie’s website, the goal of SMRT is to help clients “build, sustain, enhance, and ultimately, succeed at making their business dreams a reality!” Read more here: http://www.thesmartconsult.com/home/.

After five years of guiding organizations and business, Stefanie decided to invest in a business of her own, providing assistance to anyone who needs it in her hometown of Baton Rouge. Starting with clientele helped Stefanie’s business, but she has greater objectives in mind. Her new plans are to recruit new clients through marketing and advertisements. She plans to upgrade equipment and software before printing any marketing materials. But she did not have enough funds to cover her expenses while completing pending contracts and caring for her two children, for whom she is the sole financial provider. 

Knowing of Stefanie’s struggle, a friend informed her about Accion Texas, Inc., a nonprofit microlender. Stefanie visited the organization with America’s largest microloan portfolio, applied for a loan and was approved. 

With the help, Stefanie was able to purchase everything on her wish list, complete those pending contracts and retain her current employee. She plans to hire two more full-time employees. She says without the funds, her financial situation would not permit her to acquire the necessary equipment, software and supplies needed to complete work, market her business, attract new business, and therefore, maintain or increase her business and income.

loans.use: to upgrade equipment and software to market her business and complete pending contracts.

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.ru: Зокирджон молодой и энергичный молодой человек. Ему 21 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Зокирджон после окончания средней школы не смог поступить в университет, так как не имел возможностей. Зокирджон более 2 года занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Он постепенно развевает свой бизнес. Зокирджон хочет купить новую машину марки «Мерседес Бенц» для того, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов. Данное время он имеет автомашину марки «Опель Астра». Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки автомашины. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zokirjon is a young and energetic young man.  He is 21 years old.  He is not married and lives with his parents.  After high school, Zokirjon was not able to attend the university owing to a lack in the financial means.  For more than two years, Zokirjon has been running a taxi service.  He is successfully advancing his business forward.  To attract more clients, Zokirjon wants to purchase a Mercedes-Benz car.  Currently he has Opel Astra.  He is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to purchase a new car.  He is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy a new car for his taxi service

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase new tools and equipment for her manicure/pedicure business.

Marilou has been in this business for 16 years. Marilou also earns income from motorcycle transportation.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment for her manicure business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is married with 6 children. She is 36 years old and lives in Masabod, Clarin, Philippines. Marlyn is a farmer and grows flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer.
Marlyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Marlyn hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: Don Ernesto  de 61 años de edad vive con su esposa  y su hija de 17 años de edad ella estudia actualmente, él  se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal cultivo es el  güisquil,  comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos que se le presentan a su hogar,  Don Ernesto solicita un crédito para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos y  poder mejorar las enramadas de su cultivo güisquil  y así producir más y generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y así lograr una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ernesto, 61, lives with his wife and their 17-year-old daughter who attends school.  He has been working in agriculture for several years and growing squash which he sells at different markets near his home.  With the income from sales he is able to cover household expenses.

Ernesto is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides and manure to improve his squash crop so he can produce more and earn more income for the family and improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, herbicides and manure to improve his crop.

loans.name: Juana Olivia

texts.es: Doña Juana  de 47 años de edad  vive en casa  propia con su esposo  y su hijo de 12 años de edad quien estudia,  ella tiene una tienda en su lugar de residencia la cual posee hace ya varios años, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora y su amabilidad con sus clientes ha hecho que su clientela sea extensa,  doña Juana  solicita un crédito para la compra  de insumos para su tienda como: golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, aceite, shampoo, huevos, etc. para obtener mejores ingresos  y de esa manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana, 47 lives in her own house with her husband and 12-year-old son who attends school.  She has a store set up at home that she has been running for several years.  She is a very responsible, hard-working person who has attracted many customers because of her kindness.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her store such as sweets, soft drinks, staple goods, oil, shampoo, eggs, etc to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy sweets, soft drinks, staple goods, oil, shampoo, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ibrogim

texts.ru: Иброгиму 28 лет. Он живет вместе со своей семьей в сельской местности. Он женат, но не имеет детей. Иброгим изучил мастерство своего отца. Он данное время является мастером по ремонту дома. Он хорошо знает свою работу и выполняет отлично свою работу. Его клиенты довольны его работой. Иброгим заботливый муж. Он старается обеспечить вою жену с хорошим условием проживания и мечтает иметь детей. Его жена серьёзно больна и ей срочно надо лечиться. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 для покупки лекарств. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ibrogim is 28 years old.  He lives with his family in the countryside.  He is married but has not children.  Ibrogim learned the trade of his father.  Currently, he is an expert in house repair.  He knows his field well and performs his work with diligence. His clients are very happy with his work.  Ibrogim is a caring husband.  He is trying to provide his wife with a comfortable life and he dreams of, one day, having children.  His wife is seriously ill and is in urgent need of medical treatment.  He is asking for a loan of 2500 to purchase medicine.  He is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy medicine for the urgent treatment of his wife

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro is married with 1 child. He is 57 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.
Isidro is a farmer and has an poultry egg business to earn a living. He has been doing this for 21 years. He has requested a loan to purchase additional livestock feed.
Isidro has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Isidro hopes to save money for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock feed

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 62 years old and lives in Pob. Guipos ZDS, Philippines. She is widowed with seven children.

Alejandra has a sari-sari (general) store. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional inventories such as canned goods, soap, softdrinks and other items to add to her business. Alejandra has been a member of PMPC for 3 years and 5 months. In the future, Alejandra hopes to renovate her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories such as canned goods, soap, softdrinks and other items

loans.name: Elsy Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña  Elsy es una persona muy esforzada y trabajadora, vive en casa de un familiar con sus  dos hijos quienes  estudian actualmente, desde hace  varios años se dedica al negocio de venta y elaboración de  tamales su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio  logra solventar algunos gastos de su familia, Doña Elsy solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como: maíz, tomates, pollos, hojas de huerta para envolverlos, verduras, etc.  con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña Elsy is a very vigorous and hardworking person. She lives in a family member’s home with her two children, who are currently studying. For several years she has worked making and selling tamales. Her business is located in her residence. With what she gets from her business she has managed to settle some of the expenses of her family. Doña Elsy is asking for a loan to buy comsumables such as: corn, tomatoes, chicken, wrapping leaves, vegetables, etc. With this she hopes to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, tomatoes, chicken, leaves for wrapping, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta  vive con su madre y dos hermanos en casa propia, ella  tiene su negocio  en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia donde comercializa todo tipo de verduras, es una mujer muy trabajadora  y además responsable pues con muchas ganas de salir adelante trabaja y estudia, tiene mucha clientela por su amabilidad y buenos precios también porque sus productos son frescos, la clienta  está solicitando  un crédito con el cual tiene pensado invertirlo en su negocio comprando  verduras, frutas y cereales  por mayor como cebollas, papa, tomates, ejotes, etc.  para mejor la variedad de sus productos y poder ofrecer calidad a sus clientes y de esa manera seguir ayudando en su casa y terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The borrower lives with her mother and two siblings in her own house.  She has a stall at the market near her home where she sells all types of vegetables.  She is a very hard-working, responsible person who is committed to getting ahead and receiving an education.  She has many customers because of her kindness and affordable prices, and because her products are fresh.

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, such as onions, potatoes, tomatoes and green beans, as well as fruits and cereals.  This will improve the variety of products she can offer to customers so she can continue helping out at home and finish her education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruits and cereals wholesale.

loans.name: Norma Marlene

texts.es: Doña norma  de 36 años de edad  es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su mamá,  sus hijos estudian,  la cliente posee lo que es un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, es una persona muy trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante todo por su familia,  es por ello que día a día se esfuerza lo mejor que puede para poder llevar el sustento a sus hijos,  ahora ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar tomates, papas, cebollas, ejotes, repollos, etc. y así mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Norma is 36 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her own home with her three children and her mother. Her children currently study. 

She has a business that sells fruit and vegetables in a market that is close to her home. 

She is very a hard-working woman who wants her family to prosper. Therefore, she works her hardest every day to be able to support her children. 

She is currently requesting a loan to buy tomatos, potatoes, onions, beans, cabbage, etc. This will improve her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tomatos, potatoes, onions, beans, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is married with 10 children who are between adult and school ages. Esterlita is 59 years old and lives in Tigbawan, Lazi, Siquijor.
Esterlita is engaged in hog raising activity to earn a living, and had done this for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. 

She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional feeds and piglets.
Esterlita is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve their living with this institution.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and piglets.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Philippines. She is married with 1 child.
 
To earn a living, Gina has a business selling bananas in the community. She earns about PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. Gina has requested a loan to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. Gina's goal is to be able to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est veuve et  âgée  de 53 ans. Elle habite le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé et s’occupe seule de ses 04 enfants. 
Afin de nourrir sa famille, elle a commencé en 1992 la vente des ustensiles de cuisine mais à partir de l’année 2000 elle a associé à son commerce la vente directe de la bouillie fait à base des souches.
Très active et affectueuse, Adjo est devenue grossiste  de cette bouillie  localement appelée Efio Zogbon  et reçoit d’importante commande de ses distributeurs.
Afin de répondre aux commandes de ses clients et d’augmenter son stock et chiffre d’affaire, Adjo sollicite un crédit pour acheter 2 sacs de sucre, 1 sac de charbon, 3 sacs de souche, et 1 lot d’emballage plastique.
texts.en: Adjo is a widow and 53 years old. She lives in the Adidogomé district in Lomé, and she is alone in caring for her four children. To feed her family, she started selling kitchen utensils in 1992. But starting in 2000, she has included direct sales of porridge made from 'souches' [perhaps known as chufa or earth almonds]. A very active and loving woman, Adjo is now a wholesaler of this porridge, which is locally called "efio zogbon", and she receives significant orders from distributers. To meet these customer orders and to increase her inventory and her sales, Adjo is requesting a loan to purchase 2 bags of sugar, a bag of charcoal, 3 bags of 'souche', and a load of plastic wrap.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, charcoal, and 'souches' to make porridge to sell

loans.name: Godofreda

texts.en:
Godofreda is 61 years old and lives in Tigbawan, Lazi, Siquijor. She is married with 2 adult children.

Godofreda has a sari-sari store (small general store) that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to be used in purchasing additional canned goods, shampoo, noodles, toothpaste, and soft drinks.

Godofreda is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Godofreda hopes to expand her business as she works with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, shampoo, noodles, toothpaste, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Edilma

texts.en:
Edilma is 65 years old and lives in Cabol-anonan, Tudela, Philippines. She is widowed with 5 children.
 
Edilma works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fish to sell.

Edilma has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Edilma hopes to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 42 is old and lives in Buenavista Pagadian City. She is married with five children.

Merlyn has a sari-sari store that sells household goods. She had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000.

Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future Merlyn hopes to have her own stall to sell products.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Jim

texts.en:
Jim is 53 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City. He is married with 5 children.
 
Jim works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested a loan to buy a fishing net and other items used for fishing.
 
Jim is a new member of PMPC. In the future, he hopes to improves living conditions by using the profits from fishing and aims to have his own fishing boat for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other items used for fishing

loans.name: Señoras De Taguan  (Sigsig) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Señoras de Taguan está formado por 8 mujeres trabajadoras que luchan día a día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar, laboran en las tareas que sus padres les inculcaron desde pequeñas que es la agricultura y la crianza de animales, como también el tejido de sombreros muy reconocidos a nivel mundial. Viven por en el cantón del Sigsig lugar que goza de de mucha vegetación, verdes campos y sobre todo hermosos paisajes gracias a su geografía accidentada, sus tierras son fértiles y las manos de su gente muy hábiles.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Elvia, vive en la parroquia de San Bartolo del cantón Sigsig, tiene 41 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 21, 19, 15, 13 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija ya es casada y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y es quien le ayuda económicamente, sus dos hijos siguientes estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora a diario como jornalero, la casa en la que viven es propia.

La Señora Elvia es una mujer luchadora y muy trabajadora que busca un mejor porvenir para sus hijos y toda su familia, ella se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla, a la agricultura y criar animales, estos trabajos le permite ser una persona independiente económicamente al mismo tiempo que sale en adelante con su familia. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de pollos y alimento para sus animales, de los cuales obtuvo su ganancia y fue de mucha ayuda para su familia. Esta repitiendo el crédito ya que quiere comprar paja toquilla para la elaboración de  sus sombreros y pollos para agrandar sus fuentes de ingresos. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la unión, solidaridad y compañerismo que existe entre todas las socias, al mismo tiempo que los créditos le dan la oportunidad de crecer un poco más cada día. 

Su meta es  tener más animales y de mejor calidad. 

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The credit group “Señoras de Taguan” is made up of 8 working women who fight daily to improve the economic stability of their homes. They work at the jobs that their parents taught them from a young age, which are agriculture and animal husbandry, as well as the weaving of hats recognized worldwide.  They live in the Sigsig district, a community that enjoys a lot of greenery; their fields are fertile and the hands of their people are very capable.

One of the members of this group is Señora Elvia. She lives in the San Bartolo neighborhood of the Sigsig district. She is 41 years old, is married, and from her marriage she has 5 children, ages 21, 19, 15, 13, and 11. Her oldest daughter is already married and lives independently; her second child works and is the one who helps her financially. Her next two children study in school, and her last child is in the small local school.  Her husband works everyday as a day laborer. The house she lives in is her own.

Señora Elvia is a very hardworking and determined woman who is looking for a better future for her children and her entire family. She works weaving Panama hats, growing crops, and raising animals. These jobs allow her to be an economically independent person at the same time she is getting ahead with her family.

She invested her previous loan in the purchase of chickens and feed for her animals, from which she earned profits. It was a big help for her family. She is repeating the loan because she wants to buy Panama hat palm leaves to make her hats and chickens to increase her sources of income. She likes her credit group because of the unity, solidarity, and companionship that exists among all the members.  At the same time, the loans give them the opportunity to grow a little more each day.

Her goal is to have more animals of a higher quality.

The small photo is of a member who couldn’t be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy Panama hat palm leaves and chickens.

loans.name: Adolé

texts.fr:
Adolé a 33 ans et demeure dans le quartier Gblinkomé. Elle est mariée et a 02 enfants. Coiffeuse de profession, elle a ouvert un atelier en 2000. Mais en raison des soucis de santé, elle tient depuis 2010 une boutique au marché d’Assiyéyé pour la vente des trousseaux de bébé et des assiettes en plastique.
Elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaire par l’achat de 17 trousseaux de bébé et de 05 douzaines d’assiette plastique.
Les revenus permettront également de mieux préparer la rentrée scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adolé is 33 years old and lives in Gblinkomé. She's married and has two children. She's a trained hairdresser and she opened a workshop in 2000.

But since 2010, she's been running a shop at the market in Assiyéyé due to health problems. She sells baby clothes and plastic dishes.

She's seeking a loan in order to bolster her revenue. She wants to buy 17 sets of baby clothes and five dozen plastic dishes. Her income will enable her to better prepare her children for the new school year.

loans.use: to buy 17 sets of baby clothes and 5 dozen plastic dishes

loans.name: Grâce

texts.fr:
Grâce a 34 ans et vit dans le quartier Vakpossito à Lomé avec son mari et ses 02 enfants. Pour contribuer à l’épanouissement de son foyer, elle a débuté en 2000  la vente de l’igname frite et KOM (un met fait à base du maïs). 
Grâce est accueillante et très dynamique, elle s’approvisionne 04 fois par mois au marché d’Agoè.
Vu son fonds de roulement et très intéressée par la formation que donne Assilassimé, Grâce sollicite un crédit pour se procurer un demi sac de maïs, des condiments, des poissons frais et des boites de sardines. 
Ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en: Grâce is 34 years old and lives in the Vakpossito district in Lomé with her husband and two children. To help her household to thrive, she started selling fried yams and 'kom' (a dish made from cornmeal) in 2000. Grâce is a very accommodating and energetic woman. She gets her supplies four times a month at the Agoè market. Given her working capital and her great interest in the training which the microfinance institution Assilassimé provides, she is requesting a loan to acquire a half-bag of corn, some condiments, fresh fish, and canned sardines. This loan will enable her to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase corn and fresh fish

loans.name: Mi Armi

texts.en:
Mi Armi is 37 years old and lives in Garang, Tangub City. She is married, with six children. 

Mi Armi has a networking business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to finance Green Barley products for the retail business. 

Mi Armi has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for six years. In the future, Mi Armi hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to finance Green Barley products for her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Mauren Nataly

texts.es:
Ella es Mauren Nataly, es una joven con aspiraciones y sueños por cumplir. Hace dos años salió del colegio con deseos de estudiar para superarse, pero no ha logrado ejercer sus estudios porque no tiene los recursos económicos suficientes , ya que su madre es cabeza de familia y con su arduo trabajo responde por dos hijos con dificultad, por ello Mauren Nataly recurre con esperanza a cualquier oportunidad que pueda recibir y poder estudiar.
Su madre está soñando que su hija estudie, ya que reconoce que es buena estudiante, además le encanta leer, quiere verla triunfar, crecer en intelecto, si esto sucede su familia obtendrá un mejor futuro porque Mauren Nataly podrá trabajar para ayudar a su madre a su hermano menor quien sale dentro de muy poco del colegio con el sueño de estudiar. 
Mauren Nataly anhela estudiar porque de este modo se abrirán puertas de empleo, ella recuerda todo lo que ha pasado en su vida desde pequeña, cuando su madre llegaba a casa sin un sustento de necesidades básicas, a veces en navidades no habían juguetes ni ropa o en aquella noches que se acostaban con hambre, pero todo eso ahora puede cambiar con la ayuda que les puedan brindar en Kiva para que Muaren Nataly pueda estudiar y cumplir sus metas, no quiere repetir la historia de su madre y obtener lo que  muchos otros si han tenido, sueña con tener estabilidad económica, es decir, su propia casa, con buena salud para su madre y estudio para su hermano.
Como muchos otros tiene sueños y miedos pero sus ganas de luchar son más grandes que sus temores no piensa en lo malo que pueda pasar cree que si su fe es tan grande como sus deseos de estudiar todo será posible siempre y cuando sean los más profundos deseos de su corazón y su alma.
texts.en:
This is Mauren Nataly, a young woman with aspirations and dreams to fulfil. Two years ago she finished school with a wish to study in order to improve herself, but she hasn't been able to study since she doesn't have the necessary economic resources. Her mother is a single head of household and provides for her two children with difficulty. Because of that, Mauren Nataly uses every opportunity she can get in order to study. Her mother dreams of her daughter continuing her studies, since she knows she is a good student and loves to read. She wants to see Mauren Nataly succeed and grow intellectually. If she does, her family will have a better future because Mauren Nataly will be able to work and help her mother and her younger brother who will soon finish school and dreams of continuing his studies.

Mauren Nataly longs to continue studying because it will open new employment opportunities. She remembers everything that she has gone through since she was little, when her mother came home without the basic necessities, Christmases when there weren't any toys or clothes, and nights when they went to bed hungry. But all this could change now with the help that Kiva can offer Mauren Nataly so that she can study and achieve her goals. She doesn't want to repeat her mother's story, but instead achieve what many others have done. She dreams of having economic stability, that is, her own house, good health for her mother, and studies for her brother.

As many others she has dreams and fears, but her desire to struggle is greater than her fears and she doesn't think about the bad things that could happen. She believes that if her faith is as strong as her wish to study everything will be possible, as long as that is what her heart and her soul desire.

loans.use: to study accountancy

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El es Santiago quiere realizar su proceso académico en CAMPOALTO porque es su proyecto de vida,su pasión es la COCINA ama el estudio y amara aun mas su profesión quiere realizar su sueño de vida, quiere crecer personal y profesionalmente y siempre ha sido destacado por su buen rendimiento académico su mayor anhelo es cumplir su sueño, ser el mejor chef con reconocimientos nacionales e internacionales  y ayudar económicamente a su familia. Desde pequeño su familia vio en él, la vocación del buen servicio y el amor a la preparación de una cena siempre atento hasta en el más mínimo detalle sorprendiendo por su interés a tan corta edad y fortaleciendo sus habilidades con el pasar de los años queriendo formalizar y aprender aun más sobre el extenso arte de la COCINA.  Sus secretos, recetas, ingredientes, y técnicas han sido para Santiago una forma diferente de apreciar el mundo con sus sabores y texturas, siendo cada vez más comprometido con su futuro profesional atreviéndose a soñar con ser el mejor. 
El estudio para Santiago es la base de todo, cree firmemente que en la educación el mundo puede ser mejor, su ideal es ser un aporte para la sociedad, quiere influir en cada una de las personas que conozca dar su conocimiento compartir e incentivar para que quien sueña no se rinda nunca y vaya tras sus sueños cueste lo que cueste. Siempre pensó de niño que nunca dejaría atrás sus deseos de cocinar y ahora cuando mira atrás siente orgullo de ir tras sus deseos y sueños aún cuando fueron pocos los que creyeron que si es posible y que solo se necesita de ganas y pasión, aunque con dificultades no renunciara y estará atento siempre a quien pueda aportar a su vida tanto como él desea aportar a los demás sin importar clases sociales.
Santiago cree fielmente que todos somos iguales y nos premiaron con  habilidades y capacidades para ser instrumentos de enseñanza y aprendizaje, el dice que son talentos que muchos no han descubierto y que por supuesto el tiene claro cuál es su talento y habilidad más grande ser un amante del delicioso, misterioso, e infinito mundo de la gastronomía.
texts.en:
Santiago wishes to study in an academic program at CAMPOALTO [a technical / vocational school] as his calling in life and his passion is COOKING. Santiago loves to study and has always distinguished himself with his strong performance. He wishes to grow personally and professionally. His greatest ambition is to fulfill his dream of becoming the greatest chef, earning a national and international reputation, and helping his family financially. 

Even when he was a small child, Santiago's family noticed his calling to service and how he relished the preparation of a simple meal. For someone so young, Santiago paid great attention to the smallest details, improved his skills, and as he grew older, developed a passion for learning more about the complex art of COOKING. Santiago's secrets, recipes, ingredients, and techniques have been his own unique way of savoring the world, with its flavors and textures. His commitment to his career grows ever stronger and he has the courage to dream of becoming the best.  

Santiago considers his studies the foundation of his life and believes strongly that education is the key to a better world. His ideal is to contribute to society, influence everyone he meets, and share his knowledge. Santiago hopes that his example will motivate others so that everyone who dreams will never give up and will pursue their dreams, no matter the cost. As a child, Santiago always thought that he'd never give up his culinary dreams. When he looks back, Santiago feels proud that he's pursued those dreams and ambitions even when few people believed he could fulfill them. Santiago believes that he only needs desire and passion, and to never give up in the face of challenges. He will be grateful to anyone who supports him just as he hopes to support others, regardless of social class. 

Santiago believes strongly that we're all equal and were born with talents and abilities that allow us to both to learn and to teach. He says that many people haven't discovered their talents, but that he knows clearly his greatest talent and ability is to love the delicious, mysterious, and endless world of gastronomy.

loans.use: to study in a culinary program in Campoalto.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 33 años, con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido terminar el bachillerato, muchas personas cuando vieron que nuevamente estaba estudiando se decían " después de viejo se puso a estudiar " pero nunca hizo caso a lo que decían, siempre tuvo una meta trazada en su vida; reanudar sus estudios desde el grado 6º en la jornada nocturna, en el año 2008, fue difícil ya que en el día trabajaba y en la noche estudiaba, las trasnochadas para el son un lindo recuerdo que tiene; el día del grado de bachiller 03/12/2010 se sentía tan orgulloso y pensaba que todos los esfuerzos habían valido la pena, lo que las demás personas decían eran solo palabras. Había podido cumplir un sueño de los muchos que tiene.

Ahora ha decidido estudiar auxiliar de enfermería  en una institución prestigiosa reconocida y de buen nombre, ¿por que esta carrera? le gusta ayudar a las demás personas, porque le apasiona el campo de acción de esta profesión todo esta muy bien empezó primer semestre, pero se quedo sin trabajo.  pero no quiere dejar este sueño inconcluso, por esta razón acude a ustedes señores de KIVA.   el cual ayuda a mucha gente a lograr sus sueños por intermedio de la institución,  la verdad desea de corazón poder terminar sus estudios y  que con la ayuda de kiva y con el esfuerzo podrá cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Miguel is 33 years old. With effort and dedication he has been able to finish high school. When they saw he was studying once again, many people said to themselves, "now that he is old he applies himself to study" but he never paid attention to what they said. He always had one goal in his life - to resume his studies from sixth grade at night. In 2008 it was difficult since he was working during the day and studying at night, but for him the sleepless nights are a fond memory. The day of graduation, 03/12/2010, he felt so proud and thought that all his efforts had been worth it. What other people said were just words. He had been able to make one of his many dreams come true.

Now he has decided to study to become a nursing assistant at a prestigious and well-known institution with a good name. Why this course of study? He likes to help other people, because this field of work inspires him. Everything is going well. He began his first semester but finds himself without a job. However he does not want to leave this dream unfulfilled. For this reason he is turning to the people of Kiva, who help many people achieve their dreams through the institution. In his heart he truly wishes to be able to finish his studies and, with effort and with the help of Kiva, be able to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for his second semester of nursing school.

loans.name: Sirly Jineth

texts.es:
Sirly Jineth, llena de sueños por cumplir, una persona muy colaboradora, sociable, alegre, le gusta compartir  con las personas que la rodean. Eligió estudiar Atención Integral a la Primera Infancia porque ama a los niños y piensa que cada uno es un universo nuevo por descubrir y explorar, le encanta ayudarlos con su desarrollo y crecimiento por ello sin importar los obstáculos quiere sacar su vida profesional adelante, Sirly Jineth es la cabeza de su hogar y lo que más anhela es tener los medios para ayudar a sus padres y devolverles un poco de todo lo que ellos han hecho por ella cuidándolos y haciéndose cargo de todo sin importar que tan difil sea pues cumplir sus sueños y  tenerlos junto a ella en sus triunfos , aun en sus fracasos pues de eso se trata la vida de caer y volver a levantarse, asegura ella que para soñar solo basta con vivir y para ser feliz solo basta con despertar y valorar nuestro alrededor.
Sirly Jineth quien a su corta edad ha tomado responsabilidades de admirar es una persona de un corazón inmenso quien ayuda como quisiera le ayudaran y cuanto hace lo hace con amor y dedicación, tiene una hermosa familia que la impulsa cada día a cumplir sus sueños e ideales enseñándole a ser una persona paciente, disciplinada, respetuosa, humilde, y honesta a aprendido a valorar cada segundo en busca de sus sueños en busca de lo que más anhela con su corazón sin importar cuánto tarde, su familia son su fuerza y sin ellos nada tendría sentido, Sirly piensa que de nada sirven los triunfos si no están las personas que amamos y nos aman para compartirlos y aun en las derrotas siempre estarán las verdaderas personas que sin importar la condición estarán para dar una voz de aliento un cálido abrazo una sonrisa sincera y un corazón dispuesto a motivar aun en la situación más difícil.
texts.en:
Sirly Jineth, full of dreams waiting to be fulfilled, is a very cooperative, social, happy person who loves to share with the people around her.  She decided to study Comprehensive Early Childhood Care because she loves children and thinks that each one is a new universe to be discovered and explored.  She loves helping them with their development and growth.  Because of this, she wants to progress in her professional life, regardless of the obstacles.  Sily Jineth is the head of her household and what she wishes for the most is to be able to have the means to help her parents and give them back a portion of everything they have done for her, by taking care of them and all of their affairs regardless of how difficult it may be since they would be with her in her triumphs as she realizes her dreams, as well as in her failures as life is about falling down and getting back up.  She believes that to dream it is enough to live, and to be happy one must just wake up and appreciate their surroundings.

Sirly Jineth, in her short life, has taken on admirable responsibilities, is a person with a huge heart who will help whoever as she would like them to help her.  Everything she does, she does with love and dedication.  She has a beautiful family that drives her everyday to realizes her dreams and goals, teaching her to be a patient, disciplined, respectful, humble and honest person.  She has learned to value every second in the pursuit of her dreams and aspirations, regardless of how long in takes.  Her family is her strength, and without them she would have no purpose.  Sirly believes that accomplishments are worthless if we do not have the people we love and those who loves us to share them with, and even in our defeats, the truest people will be there with us, regardless of the situation, to give us words of encouragement, a warm hug, a sincere smile and a motivating heart even in the most difficult situations.

loans.use: with her education in Comprehensive Early Childhood Care in Campoalto.

loans.name: Lizeth Maribel

texts.es:
Ella es Lizeth Maribel la punta de siete hermanos vive sola sin su familia sus deseos de superación son muy grandes, a pesar de su edad piensa que nunca es tarde para comenzar ya que nunca antes tuvo la oportunidad de iniciar unos estudios profesionales por  dificultades económicas y porque siempre su familia estuvo antes que ella sin pensar que si hubiese estudiado antes la calidad de vida de Lizeth Maribel y de su familia fueran mejores que las actuales.
No cuenta con el apoyo de terceras personas para lograr conseguir sus sueños, con mucho esfuerzo consiguió el dinero para su primer semestre, pero se le dificulto conseguir el dinero para el segundo, por tal razón está buscando una ayuda económica para continuar con su carrera y ser de beneficio para la sociedad.
Con su salario paga su vivienda, alimentación, vestuario se transporta y ayuda económicamente a su familia.
Ella es una persona muy responsable, dedicada, honrada, trabajadora y con muchos más valores que la hacen una gran persona, merecedora de una oportunidad en la vida de salir adelante.
Tiene grandes proyectos para cumplir sus sueños y piensa que este es un buen comienzo para lograrlos.
Nunca antes se había sentido tan feliz como lo es cuando inician sus jornadas académicas, para ella cada minuto de aprendizaje es único y valioso, cada conocimiento es una oportunidad de ayudar a alguien más como ella y un escalón mas en su escalera rumbo a la meta, la meta de sus sueños porque no solo Lizeth Maribel se ve en la cima, se ve con su familia con sus hermanos con las personas que quiere sacar adelante para un futuro mejor con calidad de vida y poder mirar hacia atrás y saber que cada esfuerzo valió la pena no solo para los sueños de ella sino las personas que están detrás de su historia de vida.
No pierde la fe y mucho menos las esperanzas porque para vencer solo basta insistir. Por todas esas razones cree que se merece la oportunidad de conseguir un apoyo para continuar sus estudios en el Area de Farmacia.
texts.en:
Lizeth Maribel is one of seven siblings.  She lives alone without her family.  Her desire for self-improvement is huge.  Despite her age she thinks it's never too late to begin.  She never had the opportunity to begin her professional studies because of financial difficulties and because her family always came first.  If she had studied before, her quality of life and her family's would be better now.

She doesn't have the support of third parties to realize her dream.  With a lot of effort she was able to get the money for her first semester.  It was difficult for her to pay for the second semester, however, so she's looking for financial help to continue her program and be a benefit to society.

Lizeth Maribel pays for her housing, food, clothing, and transportation with her salary, and she helps her family financially.  She's a very responsible, dedicated, honorable, and hardworking person with many values that make her a great person worthy of an opportunity to get ahead in life.  She has big plans for achieving her dreams and thinks this is a good place to start.

She had never been as happy as when she started her academic program.  Every minute of learning is unique and valuable for her.  Every piece of knowledge is an opportunity to help someone else like herself; it's one more step on the ladder to the goal of her dreams.

Lizeth Maribel sees not only herself at the top of the ladder, she sees her family and her siblings with her; they're the people she wants to get ahead for a better future and quality of life.  She wants to be able to look back and know that every effort was worth it, not only for her own dreams but also for the people in her life history.

She's not losing faith or hope because to win it's enough to persevere.  For all these reasons she believes she deserves the opportunity to get support to continue her studies in the field of pharmacy.

loans.use: to finish her pharmacy program at CampoAlto

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 36 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City. He is married, with only one child. 

Vicente has a transportation business and he earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan to fully pay for the motorcycle he purchased. 

Vicente is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). In the future, Vicente hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to fully pay for the motorcycle he purchased.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es: El señor Florencio, es una persona de 34 años de edad, de estado civil casado, alcanzo estudiar hasta la primaria, vive en su propia casa en la comunidad de Tiraque, tiene cuatro dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos. La actividad económica del señor Florencio es la producción agrícola, que en promedio anualmente manifiesta que realiza la venta de los siguientes productos y en las cantidades siguientes: Papa 150 cargas, Haba (verde) 80 cargas, Cebolla 50 K'epis, Cebada (Grano) 10 cargas. La siembra de estos cultivos lo realiza en sus propios terrenos heredados por sus padres en una superficie de 3 hectáreas, los terrenos se hallan situados en la misma comunidad los cuales cuentan con riego. Vive en una casa rustica de adobe, con este préstamo que realiza es para  la compra de 1 vaca, compra abono de gallinaza y compra semilla de Haba y así con la producción  en el futuro mejorara sus condiciones económicos y por tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en:
Señor Florencio is a 34 year old married man. He completed his primary school studies. He lives in his own house in the community of Tiraque, where he is responsible for four economic dependents, who are his children. 

Señor Florencio works in agricultural production. In an average year, he sells these products in these quantities: Potatoes, 150 loads; green beans, 80 loads; onions, 50 K’epis (bundles); barley (grain), 10 loads. The sowing of these crops happens on his own plots of land, inherited from his parents. The lands consist of about 3 hectares; they are located in the same community. They have an irrigation system. He lives in a rustic adobe home.  This loan buys one cow, fertilizer made from chicken droppings, and bean seed. In this way, the future production will improve his economic conditions and also his dependents’ quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow, fertilizer made from chicken droppings, and bean seed.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is married, with three children who are in adult-aged. Liliosa is 63 years old and lives in Cangmalalag, Larena, Siquijor. 

Liliosa is a pensioner. Each month, she earns PHP 9,000. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to pay for the repair of her computer. 

Liliosa is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). In the future, Liliosa hopes to improve her living through this institution.

loans.use: to pay for computer repairs.

loans.name: And Siggil Hann 5 Group

texts.fr: L’Association And Siggil Hann regroupe plusieurs femmes ressortissant de l’une des banlieues  Dakaroises. Au départ elles se fréquentaient   a travers des  tontines  hebdomadaires  qui leur permettaient de s’autofinancer pour soutenir leurs activités génératrices de revenus .Actuellement l’association vient de signer un partenariat avec l’UIMCEC dans le cadre du renforcement du pouvoir économique des femmes  pour les aider  a mieux gérer leurs activités et lutter contre la pauvreté. De ce fait And Siggil Hann 5  est un groupe de crédit de 10 femmes  qui habitent le même quartier et exerce évolue dans le même secteur d’activité. Elles sont représentées par madame Anta, femme mariée qui pratique depuis plus de 20 ans la vente de jus de fruits naturels. Elle démarre chaque jour sa journée e de travail a 8 heures jusqu'à 13 heures l’après midi.. Les bénéfices que lui procure son activité lui permettent prendre en charge les frais d’électricité de son foyer. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de pain de singe et de bissap qui sont les produits de base qui lui permettent de préparer le jus qu’elle commercialise. Avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices elle compte diversifier les produits qu’elle vend en démarrant la vente de fataya et de café. Elle souhaite aussi épargner de l’argent qui lui permettra dans le futur de réaliser son vœu qui consiste a voyager dans les grands pays a vocation commerciale pour importer des marchandises a revendre.
texts.en:
The association "And Siggil Hann" comprises several women who are residents from the suburbs of Dakar. At first, the women associated with each another at weekly tontine meetings enabling them to finance themselves in support of their revenue-generating businesses. Today, the association has just signed a partnership with the microfinance institution U-IMCEC in order to bolster the women's economic power, so as to help manage their businesses better and to fight poverty. 

Thus, the association "And Siggil Hann 5" is a loan group of ten women who live in the same district and who work in the same business sector. The women are represented by Ms. Anta, a married woman who has been selling natural fruit drinks for twenty years. She starts each workday at 8 AM and works until 1 PM. The profits she earns from her business enable her to cover her home's electricity costs. 

Anta is a member of a U-IMCEC branch, where she is requesting a loan to purchase 'monkey bread' (the fruit of the baobab tree) and some 'bissap' (dried hibiscus flowers), which are the ingredients for making the juice drinks she sells.

With the growth in her profits, she plans on diversifying the products she sells by starting sales of 'fataya' [a kind of empanada served with sauce] and coffee. She would also like to save money for realizing her wish to travel to large countries for business purposes, so as to import merchandise to resell.

loans.use: to purchase local products to making juice drinks

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is married, with three children. She is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Charity is a farmer and she grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years.

She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm.

Charity has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for seven years. In the future, she hopes to have her own rice mill.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Lord Leo

texts.en: Lord Leo is 27 years old and lives in Nonoc, Larena, Siquijor. He is single with one school-aged child. He has had a sari-sari store for almost 1 year that sells a variety of products and is requesting this loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, shampoo, noodles, toothpaste and soft drinks. Lord Leo is a new member of PMPC; in the future, Lord Leo hopes to expand his business with this Cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, shampoo, noodles. toothpaste and soft drinks.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Juliana from Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with three children between 2 years and 14 years old. 

She began her business because she wants to educate her children. In 2010, Juliana established her local food business. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Juliana requires a loan in order to buy more sugar, cooking oil, and flour to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Juliana plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cooking oil, and flour to expand her business.

loans.name: Jenemar

texts.en:
Jenemar is 28 years old and lives in Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married, with two children.

Jenemar has a shop where she sells canned goods and other home needs. She has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan to buy additional inventory for her store.

Jenemar has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for less than a year. In the future, Jenemar hopes to make her little store into a convenience store.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her store.

location.town: Pagadian - Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa  alquilada junto a su compañero de vida, no tiene hijos,  ella se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde algunos años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, es una joven  muy trabajadora honesta  y responsable  además es muy atenta con sus clientes  gracias a la calidad de sus productos  ha ganado mucha clientela  que demanda sus productos  y es asi como ha  logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos de su casa. La clienta solicita  un crédito para la compra de medicina natural por mayor, para atender mejor a sus clientes, obtener  mayores ingresos  y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: This borrower lives in a rented house with her partner. She doesn't have any children. For some years she has worked selling natural medicines from her home. She is young, hardworking and responsible and provides very attentive service to her customers. Thanks to the quality of her products her customer base has grown and she has been able to pay many of her household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale medicines so she can better serve her clients, earn more money and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale natural medicines.

loans.name: Merdel

texts.en:
Merdel is a 39-years-old married woman with 3 children who lives in Pan-ay Clarin, Philippines.  To earn a living, Merdel has been a government employee for 7 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 10,000. 

Merdel has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Merdel hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a 73-year-old married woman with 4 children. She lives in Silongon, Tudela, Philippines.

Avelina sells a variety of foods to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 2000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, junk foods, candies, etc.

Avelina has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Avelina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, junk foods, candies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive junto a su esposo  y a su hijo en casa de un familiar, ella se dedica al venta de ropa interior desde hace  6 años, su esposo se dedica a la venta de verduras,  es una persona muy amble, trabajadora, y luchadora con ganas de sacar a su familia adelante, gracias a su trabajo  y a la ayuda de su esposo han logrado solventar algunos gastos familiares. La clienta solicita  un crédito para la compra de ropa interior por mayor y así tener surtido el negocio para poder sacar a su familia adelante y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client lives with her husband and her son in the house of a relative. She has made a living by selling underwear for the last six years. Her husband makes a living by selling vegetables. She is a very friendly, hard-working and striving person with the desire to get her family ahead. Thanks to her work and with her husband's help, they have managed to pay off some family expenses. The client is asking for a loan to buy underwear wholesale and thus have her business stocked to be able to get her family ahead and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy underwear wholesale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Cecilia de 62 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo, hace varios años se dedica a la venta de productos como cremas, perfumes, lociones, desodorantes, shampoo, etc. con lo que obtiene de su negocio  logra solventar algunos gastos de su familia, Doña Cecilia solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor y generar mejores ganancias, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 62, lives in her own house with her husband.  For several years she’s been working selling products like creams, perfumes, lotions, deodorant, shampoo, etc.  She’s able to cover some of her family’s expenses with what she earns from her sales.  

Cecilia’s asking for a loan to buy more products at wholesale to generate higher profits.  She hopes this way to provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es: Don Gilberto de 53 años de edad es una persona muy esforzada a su trabajo y dedicada a su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 16 años de edad el estudia actualmente, hace 33 años se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su familia, Don Gilberto solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y maicillo como herbicidas, semillas, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gilberto, 53, is very dedicated to his work and to his family.  He lives in his own house with his wife and 16-year-old son who attends school.  He’s been growing corn and sorghum for 33 years and uses what he earns from his sales to cover some of his family’s expenses.

Gilberto’s asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like herbicide, seed, manure, pesticide, etc. for his corn and sorghum crops.  He hopes with this to provide better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is a single mother and has two children. After successfully graduating from junior high school, Philomena is now an established businesswoman.  She sells cosmetics in Kufur (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Philomena uses her income to provide for the entire family. Philomena will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cosmetics, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Philomena plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Aminata from Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with three children between the ages of 12 years and 23 years old. 

She began her business because she wants to educate her children. In 2010, Aminata established her retail business. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material and slippers, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Aminata plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material and slippers, to expand her business.

loans.name: Clenita

texts.en:
Clenita is 46 years old and lives in Helen, Larena, Siquijor. She is married with 5 children who are in school and infant-aged.

Clenita has a boarding house and earns approximately PHP 28,000 per month. She has requested this loan of PHP 50,000 to be used to purchase additional cement, sand, gravel and wood.
 
Clenita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Clenita hopes to expand her business with this Cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase additional cement, sand, gravel and wood.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a 48-year-old married woman with 3 children who lives in the Philippines.  Pacita is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living; she has been doing this for 15 years.  She has requested this loan to be used to buy fertilizer for her farm.

Pacita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Pacita hopes to have her own rice mill.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old, a businessman; he is married to Jacinta, a housewife. They are blessed with two children.  

John has been running his shop for the past four years with a monthly income of Ksh 6000 which he uses to support his family. He also does fencing of houses as a part time business.

John is applying for his first loan with KADET;  John will use the loan to purchase washing detergents, cooking oil and toilet rolls to sell. With the expected profit from the business he will pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams are to open a hardware store and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase washing detergents, cooking oil and toilet rolls to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a new member of PMPC and is from Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines. She sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She is 40 years old and married with two children. 

Each month, Emelita earns PHP 3,000 with her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional ingredients for her hotdog and barbecue business.

In the future, Emelita hope to financially support immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her hotdog and barbecue business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 25 years old and married, with one child, four years old. She runs a used shoe business in Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She started her business because she wants to create a permanent source of living for her children. 

Zainab has been in this business for 12 years now and she sells used shoes within the community. She describes her major hardships as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Zainab requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to purchase more used shoes, to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. 

In the future, she would like to open a big, used clothing shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more used shoes, to expand her business.

loans.name: Kodon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    KODON est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de48 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4éme prêt. Les 6 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait la restauration à l’image de AWA qui est la 1ére femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite.  AWA compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100Kg de riz et des condiments   avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue la vente de ses plats alimentaires  au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Kodon group is composed of four married women averaging 48 years of age, with five children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, other wives, siblings and children in the village of Méridièla. They know each other as neighbors and friends as well as through their work. In order to bolster the financial capital in order to better manage their businesses, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on their fourth loan. The six prior loans have been duly repaid. This group of women cooks food for sale, which is the case of Awa, the first one standing from the left in the photo. Awa plans to use her loan to buy 100 kg [220 lbs] of rice and condiments from wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells her cooked dishes at the marketplace and out of her home, retail, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed mainly of women. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 20,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and pay off her loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking food for sale.

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es: Don José de 34 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada, junto a sus hijos y su compañera de vida, él se dedica a la venta de tostadas de plátanos desde hace varios años, es una persona honesta, atenta, amable con sus clientes, lo que lo ha llevado a ser muy buscado en la zona donde comercializa sus productos gracias a la calidad e higiene con que los prepara gracias a su trabajo  ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos familiares. Don José solicita un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar las tostadas como plátanos, papas, yuca, aceite etc. Para aumentar su producción y mejorar sus ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 34 years old and lives in a rented house with his children and his life's companion. He has sold fried plantains for several years now. Jose is an honest and attentive person, and he is amiable with his customers. This has led him to be much sought after in the zone where he sells his products, thanks to the quality and hygiene with which he prepares them. Thanks to this work, he has managed to cover some of his family's expenses.

Jose is requesting a loan to purchase the ingredients necessary to prepare his fried foods, including plantains, potatoes, cassava, cooking oil, etc., and to increase production and improve his income, offering his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy plantains, potatoes, yuca, cooking oil, etc., for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 32 years old and married to Kiprono, who also supports the family of five. 

Lilian runs a clothing business in Kapsabet town. This has been her income-generating business for the last eight years. From this business, she gets an average monthly income of KES 80,000. 

She has borrowed a fourth loan, in the amount of KES 50,000, to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the profits from the clothing business to pay her children's school fees. 

Her dream is to lead a successful life.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old and lives in Margibi County, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She and her fiancée live, together along with their four children, whose ages range from 2 to 11. Only three of her children are in school. Her fiancée works as a security guard. Rose did not attend school but she has been good at managing her business for over seven years now. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. 

Rose received a little money from her fiancée to establish her business. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit and has more customers. She sell for ten hours a day, six days a week. 

Martha is requesting a loan to buy more rice for her business. Her plan is to increase her business even more. She would like to say thanks to the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more rice for her business

loans.name: Prencisita

texts.en: Prencisita is married with 3 children. She is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Prencisita hopes to own a rice mill.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Corazón de Jesús está formado por 11 mujeres y 1 hombre que viven por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una belleza  arquitectónica y natural, esta parroquia guarda muchos mitos y leyendas de su cultura que se guardan recelosamente, tiene un clima frió. Su genta al igual que todos los miembros del grupo son personas trabajadoras que luchan día a día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus familias y así poco a poco están logrando la superación de su familia.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora.  María Gerardina, forma parte del grupo de crédito Corazón de Jesús desde hace 9 años y en todo este tiempo ha llegada a tener una relación de muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras, al mismo tiempo que ha logrado mejorar su estabilidad económica de su familia.

La Señora. María Gerardina tiene 66 años, es viuda pero en su vida conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y viven independientes. Vive sola en una casa que es arrendada.

Ella se dedica a las tareas que aprendió de sus padres, las cuales le ha permitido sacar a sus hijos y familia adelante, cría ganado, cerdos, gallinas y cuyes, la leche que tiene de su ganado hace quesillo y los vende, también siembre y lo que cosecha vende en los mercados de la ciudad. 

Las ganancias que obtuvo de su crédito anterior le ayudaron a solventar muchos gastos de su hogar, es por esto que quiere otro crédito para invertir en la compra de cerdos, cuyes, gallinas y alimento para animales para serguir creciendo en su negocio que es la fuente de sus ingresos.

Su sueño es conservar su salud para continuar con su negocio.

La foto pequeña es de un socio y una socia que no estuvieron presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Corazón de Jesús” (Heart of Jesus) credit group consists of 11 women and one man who live around El Valle Parish in Cuenca, a place blessed with natural and architectonic beauty.  This parish retains many myths and legends from their culture that are jealously guarded.  Its climate is cold.  Its residents, like all the members of this group, are hardworking people who strive daily to improve their families’ economic stability and this is how they are gradually attaining their families’ improvement.

One of the group members is María Gerardina.  She’s been part of the Corazón de Jesús credit group for nine years and in all this time has managed to establish a strong bond of friendship with all the other members while at the same time has attained better economic stability for her family.

María Gerardina is 66-years-old and a widow but while she was married she had six children who are all married adults now living independently.  She lives alone in a rented house.

She works doing tasks she learned from her parents.  She’s been able to raise her children this way and to move her family forward. She raises cattle, pigs, chickens and guinea pigs.  She uses milk she gets from her cattle to make cheese to sell.  Also, she sells what she grows in the city markets.

The profits earned from her previous loan helped her cover many of her household expenses which is why she wants another loan to use to buy pigs, guinea pigs, chicks and animal feed to continue growing in her business which is her source of income.  Her dream is to conserve her health so that she can stay in business.

Two members, a man and a woman, who were unable to be present when the group photo was taken, appear in the small photo.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old and lives in Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with four children.

She has a piggery business and earns approximately Php8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in buying feeds for her growing pigs.

She has been a member of PMPC for less than year. In the future, Gina hopes to have her own slaughterhouse and make her piggery business into a bigger one.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs.

location.town: Pagadian - Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 22 years old and resides in the community surrounding Airport. Ruth is a eight grade dropout. She and her fiancée live together. They both have two children ages 5 and 11. Their children are currently attending school and living at home. For the past four years she has been selling soft drinks and used clothes. A problem she faces is the rainy season. She started this business with 3000 LRD from her aunty who taught her how to do business. She sells for six days each week, spending nine hours each day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks and used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a house and live a happy life. She wants to thank the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru: Исроил 40-летний мужчина, проживающий на юге страны в городе Куляб. У него есть жена, трое сыновей и одна дочь, которых он очень любит и для которых старается работать усердно, чтобы они ни в чем не нуждались. Сейчас Исроил хочет начать деятельность по предоставлению услуги такси по маршруту Куляб-Душанбе. По его мнению это хорошая работа с хорошим доходом. У него есть трехлетний опыт вождения. Исроил хочет купить машину марки «OPEL». Но он не в состоянии реализовать задуманное из-за нехватки денежных средств. Он просит в кредит необходимую сумму для того чтобы купить машину и начать новую деятельность. Исроил планирует в будущем доход от деятельности вкладывать в бюджет семьи и от бюджета семьи оплачивать образование детей.
texts.en: Isroil is a 40 year-old man who lives in the southern city of Kulab. He has a wife, three sons, and one daughter, all of whom he loves very much and for whom he works very hard to ensure that they have everything they need. Now Isroil wants to start a private taxi service that serves the route between Kulab and Dushanbe. He thinks that this is a good job that earns a good income. He has three years of driving experience. He wants to purchase an Opel-branded car. But he cannot carry out his plan because he lacks the money. He is asking for a loan that would cover the car purchase and enable him to launch the business. Isroil plans to use the income earned with the loan to bolster the family budget and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To buy an Opel-branded car for operating a private taxi service.

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Mujeres de Esperanza esta formado por 6 mujeres, son amigas y vecinas que viven en la parroquia de Baños en Cuenca, esta parroquia cuenta con varios lugares turísticos, tiene aguas termales por lo que existen varios balnearios y restaurantes en donde se puede disfrutar de la gastronomía, y sus bellos paisajes son para disfrutar de la naturaleza. Su gente al igual que las socias son personas que trabajan día a día para mejorar su situación económica y así entregarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa Nieves, se encuentra realizando su cuarto crédito a lado de todas sus compañeras que conforman el grupo de crédito Mujeres de Esperanza, tiene 37 años, está separada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos  de 19, 14, 12, 8 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia y trabaja, sus dos hijos siguientes estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, su penúltimo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa Nieves se dedica a la elaboración y venta de helados, actividad que la viene desempeñando desde hace 5 años, todos los días elabora sus helados y los vende recorriendo los mercados de la ciudad, también vende espumillas, cosméticos y se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y gallinas. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de pollos, la ganancia que obtuvo le sirvió para cubrir muchos gastos de su hogar. Su nuevo crédito lo va a  invertir en la compra de cosméticos, frutas, azúcar, huevos y leche para la elaboración de sus espumillas y helados. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres de Esperanza” (Women of Hope) credit group consists of six women who are friends and neighbors living in Baños Parish in Cuenca.   This parish has several tourist sites, thermal water resorts and restaurants where the cuisine can be enjoyed; it also has beautiful scenic points from which to enjoy nature.  Its people, like the group members, are hardworking people who work daily to improve their economic situation in order to provide a better future for their children.

One of the members of this group is Rosa Nieves who is taking out her fourth loan alongside her companions who form the Mujeres de Esperanza credit group.  She’s 37-years-old, separated and mother of five children who are 19, 14, 12, 8 and 1 years of age.  Her oldest son works and studies, her next two children attend a secondary school in the city and her next-to-last child attends the local little elementary school.  She does not own a house; she’s a renter.

Rosa Nieves works making and selling frozen treats, an activity she’s been doing for the last five years.
