She makes frozen treats every day and sells them groin from market to market in the city; she also sells ‘espumillas’ [type of fruit meringue], cosmetics and also raises guinea pigs and chickens.

 She used her previous loan to buy chicks and used profits earned to cover some of her household expensed.  She will use her new loan to buy cosmetic, fruit, sugar, eggs and milk to make the espumillas and the frozen treats.  Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy fruit, eggs, milk and cosmetics.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 62 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin, Philippines. She is widowed, with 3 children. She has a tailoring business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

Tita has requested a loan to purchase additional tailoring materials such as hand-sewing needles, scissors, metal zippers, and plastic buttons. Tita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring materials such as needles, scissors, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is married with four children. She is 61 years old and lives in Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur.

She sells canned goods and school supplies to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns about PHP10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 8,000 to be used as additional capital to restock her store.

She has been a member of PMPC for less than a year. In the future, Judith hopes to make her little store into a grocery store.

loans.use: to be used as additional capital to restock her store.

location.town: Pagadian - Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 55 years old and lives in Motosawa, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with 3 children. 

Estrella has a sari-sari store that sells goods and dry goods. She has had this business for 10 years.

She requested a loan for additional capital for her sari-sari. She wants to buy more canned goods, detergents, soft drinks and other items to sell. 

Estrella has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Estrella hopes to be the best supplier in her area.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, detergents, soft drinks and other items to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Motosawa, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is married, with four children. She is 52 years old and lives in Pan-ay Clarin, Philippines. Nila sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

Nila has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional products for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, candies, snack foods, beverages, detergents and soaps. Nila has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hope to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her store.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is 30 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. She works in the fishing industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. 

She has requested a loan to pay for fishing net and other fishing materials. She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Charlita hopes to have more savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Liezelda

texts.en:
Liezelda is 26 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children.
 
She has a shell craft making business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay for additional shells and nylon.
 
She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Liezelda hopes to build her family's own house.

loans.use: to pay for shells and nylon.

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora. Mayra es una joven alegre que ve en el día a día una oportunidad más para salir en adelante, hace un año forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Triunfadoras, vive por la parroquia de Paccha en Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió y de bellos paisajes gracias a su geografía accidentada, sus tierras son fértiles en donde se cosechan hortalizas y frutas, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, aun mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Mayra tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos niños de 5 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo este año ingresa a la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de una tía con quien comparte los gastos del hogar. 

Doña Mayra pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo al cuidado de sus hijos, pero para tener ingresos económicos se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes y pollos. 

El dinero de su crédito va ha invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para todos sus animales. 

Su meta es que sus hijos se preparen para que lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mayra is a happy young woman who sees every day as another opportunity to get ahead. A year ago she joined the 'Las Triunfadoras' loan group. She lives in the parish of Paccha in Cuenca, a place that has a cool climate and beautiful landscapes. Thanks to its hilly geography, its lands are fertile and vegetables and fruits are grown there. Its people make a living by raising animals, still keeping their culture and traditions alive.

Mayra is 26 years old and is the single mother of two children aged 5 and 2. Her older son starts school this year. She doesn't have a house of her own so she lives with an aunt and they share the household expenses.

Mayra spends most of her time caring for her children, but in order to have an income she makes a living by raising and selling guinea pigs and chickens.

She will invest the money from her loan in buying chickens and food for all of her animals. 

Her goal is for her children to study so that they become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with two children. She is 51 years old and lives in Tigdok, Tudela, Philippines. Helen sells baked breads and cakes to earn a living and has had this business for two years. 

Helen has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery, such as flour, baking powder, baking soda, yeast, nuts, almond paste, meringue, sugar, and whipped cream. Helen has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба жительница района Муминобод. Ей 35 лет. Она является матерью двоих детей. У нее сын и дочь. Она одна воспитывает своих детей. Махбуба хорошая портниха. У нее имеется богатый опыт в этой области, но Махбуба несколько лет не шила. Ее дети были маленькими и у нее не было времени, чтобы сесть шить и вышивать. Сейчас Махбуба намерена продолжить свое любимое дело, предоставлять услугу, шить платья для продажи, а также придумывать новые модели платьев. Чтобы начать работу ей необходима новая модернизированная швейная машинка, которая не отнимает много времени. Именно с такой целью она обратилась за кредитом на сумму 1500 USD. Махбуба ждет от вас помощи. 
Чтобы обеспечить своих детей Махбубе приходится много работать. На сегодняшний день Махбуба разводит скот у себя дома. Она продает скот по приемлемой цене.
texts.en:
Makhbuba lives in Muminobod. She is 34, and has two children, a son and a daughter. She is raising the children by herself. Makhbuba is an excellent seamstress. She has a lot of experience in this field of work, but she hasn't done any sewing work for several years. Her children were small, and she didn't have any time to sit down and do any sewing or embroidery. Now Makhbuba is ready to resume her favorite activity and make dresses for sale, as well as create new  types of dresses. To do this she needs a new, upgraded sewing machine that is quick and easy to set up and operate. With this goal in mind, she has requested a loan in the amount of 1500 US dollars. She awaits your kind assistance.

Makhbuba has to work a lot to provide for her children. Currently she takes care of livestock on her home property. She is going to sell the animals for an decent price.

loans.use: to purchase a new, upgraded sewing machine  that is quick and easy to set up and operate

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents). She has a business of selling used shoes and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. 

Sarah works at the market six days a week and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity, but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is married and lives with her family in Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer, which is their main source of income, while Marlita runs a sari sari store to make a living. 

Marlita successfully repaid her previous loans from Gata Daku MPC, which she used in their farm to improve their living condition. She borrowed a new loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more stock, such as canned goods, soft drinks, dried fish and sugar. Marlita wants to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as canned goods, soft drinks, dried fish and sugar.

loans.name: Josselina

texts.pt:
A SRA  JOSSELINA TEM 28 ANOS DE IDADE, É CASADA E TEM 02 FILHOS QUE ESTUDAM PERTO DE SUA CASA, DE MANHA ELA PREPERA AS CRIANCAS PARA IREM A ESCOLA E DEPOIS VAI AO MERCADO ABRIR A BARRACA
A SUA BASE DE SUSTENTO É O NEGOCIO, ELE TRABALHA  DAS 07 ATE AS 21 HORAS  NA SUA BARRACA.
COM O EMPRESTIMO PRETENDE COMPRAR MATERIAL DE CONSTRUCAO PARA INICIAR  COM A CONSTRUCAO DA SUA CASA, 
SEU MAIOR SONHO É  TERMINAR A SUA CASA E EM SEGUDA  MATRICULAR- SE NUMA ESCOLA DE CONDUCAO, POREM ENFRENTA O DESAFIO DE  DE PAGAR A ESCOLA DOS FILHOS E ACUMULAR DINHEIRO PARA PAGAR NA ESCOLA DE CONDUCAO
texts.en:
Josselina, 28 years old, is married and has two children who go to school near her house. In the morning she gets the kids ready for school and then goes to the market to open her stall.
She earns a living with her business, working from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. in her stall at the market.
She will use this loan to buy construction materials to start building a house.
Her biggest dream is to finish her house and then enroll in driving classes, so she is determined to meet the challenge of paying for her children’s education and then saving money to pay for driving school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to start building a house.
